arabic_uthmani: وَقَد نَزَّلَ عَلَيكُم فِي الكِتابِ أَن إِذا سَمِعتُم آياتِ اللَّهِ يُكفَرُ بِها وَيُستَهزَأُ بِها فَلا تَقعُدوا مَعَهُم حَتّىٰ يَخوضوا في حَديثٍ غَيرِهِ ۚ إِنَّكُم إِذًا مِثلُهُم ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ جامِعُ المُنافِقينَ وَالكافِرينَ في جَهَنَّمَ جَميعًا
blank: w-qad nazzal ʿalaykum fīl-kitāb ʾ ʾidhā samiʿtum ʾāyāt llāh yukfar bihā w-yustahzaʾ bihā f-lā taqʿudū maʿahum ḥattā yakhūḍū fī ḥadīth ghayrihī ʾinnakum ʾidham-mithluhum ʾinn llāh jāmiʿul-munāfiqīn w-l-kāfirīn fī jahannam jamīʿ-
english_saheeh_international: And it has already come down to you in the Book that when you hear the verses of Allah recited, they are denied by them and ridiculed; so do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation. Indeed, you would then be like them. Indeed Allah will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ يَتَرَبَّصونَ بِكُم فَإِن كانَ لَكُم فَتحٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ قالوا أَلَم نَكُن مَعَكُم وَإِن كانَ لِلكافِرينَ نَصيبٌ قالوا أَلَم نَستَحوِذ عَلَيكُم وَنَمنَعكُم مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ ۚ فَاللَّهُ يَحكُمُ بَينَكُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ وَلَن يَجعَلَ اللَّهُ لِلكافِرينَ عَلَى المُؤمِنينَ سَبيلًا
blank: alladhīn yatarabbaṣūn bikum f-ʾ kān lakum fatḥ min llāh qālū ʾ-lam nak maʿakum w-ʾ kān l-l-kāfirīn naṣīb qālū ʾ-lam nastaḥwidh ʿalaykum w-namnaʿkum minal-muʾminīn f-llāh yaḥkum baynakum yawmal-qiyāmat w-l yajʿal llāh l-l-kāfirīn ʿalāl-muʾminīn sabīl
english_saheeh_international: Those who wait and watch you. Then if you gain a victory from Allah, they say, "Were we not with you?" But if the disbelievers have a success, they say to them, "Did we not gain the advantage over you, but we protected you from the believers?" Allah will judge between all of you on the Day of Resurrection, and never will Allah give the disbelievers over the believers a way to overcome them

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ المُنافِقينَ يُخادِعونَ اللَّهَ وَهُوَ خادِعُهُم وَإِذا قاموا إِلَى الصَّلاةِ قاموا كُسالىٰ يُراءونَ النّاسَ وَلا يَذكُرونَ اللَّهَ إِلّا قَليلًا
blank: ʾinnal-munāfiqīn yukhādiʿūn llāh w-huw khādiʿuhum w-ʾidhā qāmū ʾilā ṣ-ṣalāt qāmū kusālā yurāʾūn n-nās w-lā yadhkurūn llāh ʾillā qalīl
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, the hypocrites think to deceive Allah, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing themselves to the people and not remembering Allah except a little

arabic_uthmani: مُذَبذَبينَ بَينَ ذٰلِكَ لا إِلىٰ هٰؤُلاءِ وَلا إِلىٰ هٰؤُلاءِ ۚ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُ سَبيلًا
blank: mudhabdhabīn bayn dhālik lā ʾilā hāʾulāʾ w-lā ʾilā hāʾulāʾ w-m yuḍlil llāh f-l tajid lahū sabīl
english_saheeh_international: Wavering between them, belonging neither to the believers nor to the disbelievers. And whoever Allah leaves astray - never will you find for him a way

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَتَّخِذُوا الكافِرينَ أَولِياءَ مِن دونِ المُؤمِنينَ ۚ أَتُريدونَ أَن تَجعَلوا لِلَّهِ عَلَيكُم سُلطانًا مُبينًا
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū lā tattakhidhūl-kāfirīn ʾawliyāʾ m dūnil-muʾminīn ʾ-turīdūn ʾ tajʿalū l-llāh ʿalaykum sulṭānam-mubīn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do you wish to give Allah against yourselves a clear case

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ المُنافِقينَ فِي الدَّركِ الأَسفَلِ مِنَ النّارِ وَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُم نَصيرًا
blank: ʾinnal-munāfiqīn fī d-darkil-ʾasfal min n-nār w-l tajid lahum naṣīr
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper

arabic_uthmani: إِلَّا الَّذينَ تابوا وَأَصلَحوا وَاعتَصَموا بِاللَّهِ وَأَخلَصوا دينَهُم لِلَّهِ فَأُولٰئِكَ مَعَ المُؤمِنينَ ۖ وَسَوفَ يُؤتِ اللَّهُ المُؤمِنينَ أَجرًا عَظيمًا
blank: ʾillālladhīn tābū w-ʾaṣlaḥū w-ʿtaṣamū b-llāh w-ʾakhlaṣū dīnahum l-llāh f-ʾulāʾik maʿal-muʾminīn w-sawf yuʾt llāhul-muʾminīn ʾajr ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: Except for those who repent, correct themselves, hold fast to Allah, and are sincere in their religion for Allah, for those will be with the believers. And Allah is going to give the believers a great reward

arabic_uthmani: ما يَفعَلُ اللَّهُ بِعَذابِكُم إِن شَكَرتُم وَآمَنتُم ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ شاكِرًا عَليمًا
blank: mā yafʿal llāh b-ʿadhābikum ʾ shakartum w-ʾāmantum w-kān llāh shākir ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: What would Allah do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe? And ever is Allah Appreciative and Knowing

arabic_uthmani: ۞ لا يُحِبُّ اللَّهُ الجَهرَ بِالسّوءِ مِنَ القَولِ إِلّا مَن ظُلِمَ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ سَميعًا عَليمًا
blank: lā yuḥibb llāhul-jahr b-s-sūʾ minal-qawl ʾillā m ẓulim w-kān llāh samīʿ ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: Allah does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing

arabic_uthmani: إِن تُبدوا خَيرًا أَو تُخفوهُ أَو تَعفوا عَن سوءٍ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ عَفُوًّا قَديرًا
blank: ʾ tubdū khayr ʾaw tukhfūh ʾaw taʿfū ʿ sūʾ f-ʾinn llāh kān ʿafuww qadīr
english_saheeh_international: If instead you show some good or conceal it or pardon an offense - indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Competent

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَكفُرونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ وَيُريدونَ أَن يُفَرِّقوا بَينَ اللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ وَيَقولونَ نُؤمِنُ بِبَعضٍ وَنَكفُرُ بِبَعضٍ وَيُريدونَ أَن يَتَّخِذوا بَينَ ذٰلِكَ سَبيلًا
blank: ʾinnalladhīn yakfurūn b-llāh w-rusulihī w-yurīdūn ʾ yufarriqū bayn llāh w-rusulihī w-yaqūlūn nuʾmin b-baʿḍ w-nakfur b-baʿḍ w-yurīdūn ʾ yattakhidhū bayn dhālik sabīl
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allah and His messengers and say, "We believe in some and disbelieve in others," and wish to adopt a way in between

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الكافِرونَ حَقًّا ۚ وَأَعتَدنا لِلكافِرينَ عَذابًا مُهينًا
blank: ʾulāʾik humul-kāfirūn ḥaqq w-ʾaʿtadnā l-l-kāfirīn ʿadhābam-muhīn
english_saheeh_international: Those are the disbelievers, truly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ وَلَم يُفَرِّقوا بَينَ أَحَدٍ مِنهُم أُولٰئِكَ سَوفَ يُؤتيهِم أُجورَهُم ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
blank: w-lladhīn ʾāmanū b-llāh w-rusulihī w-lam yufarriqū bayn ʾaḥad minhum ʾulāʾik sawf yuʾtīhim ʾujūrahum w-kān llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: But they who believe in Allah and His messengers and do not discriminate between any of them - to those He is going to give their rewards. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: يَسأَلُكَ أَهلُ الكِتابِ أَن تُنَزِّلَ عَلَيهِم كِتابًا مِنَ السَّماءِ ۚ فَقَد سَأَلوا موسىٰ أَكبَرَ مِن ذٰلِكَ فَقالوا أَرِنَا اللَّهَ جَهرَةً فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الصّاعِقَةُ بِظُلمِهِم ۚ ثُمَّ اتَّخَذُوا العِجلَ مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَتهُمُ البَيِّناتُ فَعَفَونا عَن ذٰلِكَ ۚ وَآتَينا موسىٰ سُلطانًا مُبينًا
blank: yasʾaluk ʾahlul-kitāb ʾ tunazzil ʿalayhim kitābam-min s-samāʾ f-qad saʾalū mūsā ʾakbar m dhālik f-qālū ʾarinā llāh jahrat f-ʾakhadhathum ṣ-ṣāʿiqat b-ẓulmihim thumm ttakhadhūl-ʿijl m baʿd mā jāʾathumul-bayyināt f-ʿafawnā ʿ dhālik w-ʾātaynā mūsā sulṭānam-mubīn
english_saheeh_international: The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses even greater than that and said, "Show us Allah outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf for worship after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority

arabic_uthmani: وَرَفَعنا فَوقَهُمُ الطّورَ بِميثاقِهِم وَقُلنا لَهُمُ ادخُلُوا البابَ سُجَّدًا وَقُلنا لَهُم لا تَعدوا فِي السَّبتِ وَأَخَذنا مِنهُم ميثاقًا غَليظًا
blank: w-rafaʿnā fawqahum ṭ-ṭūr b-mīthāqihim w-qulnā lahum dkhulūl-bāb sujjad w-qulnā lahum lā taʿdū fī s-sabt w-ʾakhadhnā minhum mīthāq ghalīẓ
english_saheeh_international: And We raised over them the mount for refusal of their covenant; and We said to them, "Enter the gate bowing humbly", and We said to them, "Do not transgress on the sabbath", and We took from them a solemn covenant

arabic_uthmani: فَبِما نَقضِهِم ميثاقَهُم وَكُفرِهِم بِآياتِ اللَّهِ وَقَتلِهِمُ الأَنبِياءَ بِغَيرِ حَقٍّ وَقَولِهِم قُلوبُنا غُلفٌ ۚ بَل طَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلَيها بِكُفرِهِم فَلا يُؤمِنونَ إِلّا قَليلًا
blank: f-b-mā naqḍihim mīthāqahum w-kufrihim b-ʾāyāt llāh w-qatlihimul-ʾanbiyāʾ b-ghayr ḥaqq w-qawlihim qulūbunā ghulf bal ṭabaʿ llāh ʿalayhā b-kufrihim f-lā yuʾminūn ʾillā qalīl
english_saheeh_international: And We cursed them for their breaking of the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of Allah and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, "Our hearts are wrapped". Rather, Allah has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few

arabic_uthmani: وَبِكُفرِهِم وَقَولِهِم عَلىٰ مَريَمَ بُهتانًا عَظيمًا
blank: w-b-kufrihim w-qawlihim ʿalā maryam buhtān ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: And We cursed them for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander

arabic_uthmani: وَقَولِهِم إِنّا قَتَلنَا المَسيحَ عيسَى ابنَ مَريَمَ رَسولَ اللَّهِ وَما قَتَلوهُ وَما صَلَبوهُ وَلٰكِن شُبِّهَ لَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّ الَّذينَ اختَلَفوا فيهِ لَفي شَكٍّ مِنهُ ۚ ما لَهُم بِهِ مِن عِلمٍ إِلَّا اتِّباعَ الظَّنِّ ۚ وَما قَتَلوهُ يَقينًا
blank: w-qawlihim ʾinnā qatalnāl-masīḥ ʿīsā bn maryam rasūl llāh w-mā qatalūh w-mā ṣalabūh w-lāk shubbih lahum w-ʾinnalladhīn khtalafū fīh l-fī shakk minh mā lahum bihī m ʿilm ʾillā ttibāʿ ẓ-ẓann w-mā qatalūh yaqīn
english_saheeh_international: And for their saying, "Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of Allah." And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but another was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. And they did not kill him, for certain

arabic_uthmani: بَل رَفَعَهُ اللَّهُ إِلَيهِ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَزيزًا حَكيمًا
blank: bal rafaʿah llāh ʾilayh w-kān llāh ʿazīz ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: Rather, Allah raised him to Himself. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise

arabic_uthmani: وَإِن مِن أَهلِ الكِتابِ إِلّا لَيُؤمِنَنَّ بِهِ قَبلَ مَوتِهِ ۖ وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ يَكونُ عَلَيهِم شَهيدًا
blank: w-ʾ m ʾahlil-kitāb ʾillā l-yuʾminann bihī qabl mawtihī w-yawmal-qiyāmat yakūn ʿalayhim shahīd
english_saheeh_international: And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in Jesus before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness

arabic_uthmani: فَبِظُلمٍ مِنَ الَّذينَ هادوا حَرَّمنا عَلَيهِم طَيِّباتٍ أُحِلَّت لَهُم وَبِصَدِّهِم عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ كَثيرًا
blank: f-b-ẓulm minalladhīn hādū ḥarramnā ʿalayhim ṭayyibāt ʾuḥillat lahum w-b-ṣaddihim ʿ sabīl llāh kathīr
english_saheeh_international: For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We made unlawful for them certain good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of Allah many people

arabic_uthmani: وَأَخذِهِمُ الرِّبا وَقَد نُهوا عَنهُ وَأَكلِهِم أَموالَ النّاسِ بِالباطِلِ ۚ وَأَعتَدنا لِلكافِرينَ مِنهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
blank: w-ʾakhdhihim r-ribā w-qad nuhū ʿanh w-ʾaklihim ʾamwāl n-nās b-l-bāṭil w-ʾaʿtadnā l-l-kāfirīn minhum ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: And for their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And we have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: لٰكِنِ الرّاسِخونَ فِي العِلمِ مِنهُم وَالمُؤمِنونَ يُؤمِنونَ بِما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ وَما أُنزِلَ مِن قَبلِكَ ۚ وَالمُقيمينَ الصَّلاةَ ۚ وَالمُؤتونَ الزَّكاةَ وَالمُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الآخِرِ أُولٰئِكَ سَنُؤتيهِم أَجرًا عَظيمًا
blank: lākin r-rāsikhūn fīl-ʿilm minhum w-l-muʾminūn yuʾminūn b-mā ʾunzil ʾilayk w-mā ʾunzil m qablik w-l-muqīmīn ṣ-ṣalāt w-l-muʾtūn z-zakāt w-l-muʾminūn b-llāh w-l-yawmil-ʾākhir ʾulāʾik s-nuʾtīhim ʾajr ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, O Muhammad, and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer especially and the givers of zakah and the believers in Allah and the Last Day - those We will give a great reward

arabic_uthmani: ۞ إِنّا أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ كَما أَوحَينا إِلىٰ نوحٍ وَالنَّبِيّينَ مِن بَعدِهِ ۚ وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسماعيلَ وَإِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ وَالأَسباطِ وَعيسىٰ وَأَيّوبَ وَيونُسَ وَهارونَ وَسُلَيمانَ ۚ وَآتَينا داوودَ زَبورًا
blank: ʾinnā ʾawḥaynā ʾilayk k-mā ʾawḥaynā ʾilā nūḥ w-n-nabiyyīn m baʿdihī w-ʾawḥaynā ʾilā ʾibrāhīm w-ʾismāʿīl w-ʾisḥāq w-yaʿqūb w-l-ʾasbāṭ w-ʿīsā w-ʾayyūb w-yūnus w-hārūn w-sulaymān w-ʾātaynā dāwūd zabūr
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, We have revealed to you, O Muhammad, as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book of Psalms

arabic_uthmani: وَرُسُلًا قَد قَصَصناهُم عَلَيكَ مِن قَبلُ وَرُسُلًا لَم نَقصُصهُم عَلَيكَ ۚ وَكَلَّمَ اللَّهُ موسىٰ تَكليمًا
blank: w-rusul qad qaṣaṣnāhum ʿalayk m qabl w-rusul lam naqṣuṣhum ʿalayk w-kallam llāh mūsā taklīm
english_saheeh_international: And We sent messengers about whom We have related their stories to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with direct speech

arabic_uthmani: رُسُلًا مُبَشِّرينَ وَمُنذِرينَ لِئَلّا يَكونَ لِلنّاسِ عَلَى اللَّهِ حُجَّةٌ بَعدَ الرُّسُلِ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَزيزًا حَكيمًا
blank: rusulam-mubashshirīn w-mundhirīn l-ʾallā yakūn l-n-nās ʿalā llāh ḥujjat baʿd r-rusul w-kān llāh ʿazīz ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: We sent messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise

arabic_uthmani: لٰكِنِ اللَّهُ يَشهَدُ بِما أَنزَلَ إِلَيكَ ۖ أَنزَلَهُ بِعِلمِهِ ۖ وَالمَلائِكَةُ يَشهَدونَ ۚ وَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا
blank: lākin llāh yashhad b-mā ʾanzal ʾilayk ʾanzalahū b-ʿilmihī w-l-malāʾikat yashhadūn w-kafā b-llāh shahīd
english_saheeh_international: But Allah bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness as well. And sufficient is Allah as Witness

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ قَد ضَلّوا ضَلالًا بَعيدًا
blank: ʾinnalladhīn kafarū w-ṣaddū ʿ sabīl llāh qad ḍallū ḍalāl baʿīd
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert people from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَظَلَموا لَم يَكُنِ اللَّهُ لِيَغفِرَ لَهُم وَلا لِيَهدِيَهُم طَريقًا
blank: ʾinnalladhīn kafarū w-ẓalamū lam yakun llāh l-yaghfir lahum w-lā l-yahdiyahum ṭarīq
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong or injustice - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path

arabic_uthmani: إِلّا طَريقَ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا ۚ وَكانَ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرًا
blank: ʾillā ṭarīq jahannam khālidīn fīhā ʾabad w-kān dhālik ʿalā llāh yasīr
english_saheeh_international: Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that, for Allah, is always easy

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ قَد جاءَكُمُ الرَّسولُ بِالحَقِّ مِن رَبِّكُم فَآمِنوا خَيرًا لَكُم ۚ وَإِن تَكفُروا فَإِنَّ لِلَّهِ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَليمًا حَكيمًا
blank: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nās qad jāʾakum r-rasūl b-l-ḥaqq m rabbikum f-ʾāminū khayr lakum w-ʾ takfurū f-ʾinn l-llāh mā fī s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-kān llāh ʿalīm ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: O Mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe; it is better for you. But if you disbelieve - then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise

arabic_uthmani: يا أَهلَ الكِتابِ لا تَغلوا في دينِكُم وَلا تَقولوا عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الحَقَّ ۚ إِنَّمَا المَسيحُ عيسَى ابنُ مَريَمَ رَسولُ اللَّهِ وَكَلِمَتُهُ أَلقاها إِلىٰ مَريَمَ وَروحٌ مِنهُ ۖ فَآمِنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ ۖ وَلا تَقولوا ثَلاثَةٌ ۚ انتَهوا خَيرًا لَكُم ۚ إِنَّمَا اللَّهُ إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۖ سُبحانَهُ أَن يَكونَ لَهُ وَلَدٌ ۘ لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۗ وَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ وَكيلًا
blank: yā-ʾahlal-kitāb lā taghlū fī dīnikum w-lā taqūlū ʿalā llāh ʾillāl-ḥaqq ʾinnamāl-masīḥ ʿīsā bn maryam rasūl llāh w-kalimatuhū ʾalqāhā ʾilā maryam w-rūḥ minh f-ʾāminū b-llāh w-rusulihī w-lā taqūlū thalāthat- ntahū khayr lakum ʾinnamā llāh ʾilāh wāḥid subḥānahū ʾ yakūn lahū walad lahū mā fī s-samāwāt w-mā fīl-ʾarḍ w-kafā b-llāh wakīl
english_saheeh_international: O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul created at a command from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs

arabic_uthmani: لَن يَستَنكِفَ المَسيحُ أَن يَكونَ عَبدًا لِلَّهِ وَلَا المَلائِكَةُ المُقَرَّبونَ ۚ وَمَن يَستَنكِف عَن عِبادَتِهِ وَيَستَكبِر فَسَيَحشُرُهُم إِلَيهِ جَميعًا
blank: l yastankifal-masīḥ ʾ yakūn ʿabd l-llāh w-lāl-malāʾikatul-muqarrabūn w-m yastankif ʿ ʿibādatihī w-yastakbir f-s-yaḥshuruhum ʾilayh jamīʿ
english_saheeh_international: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor would the angels near to Him. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together

arabic_uthmani: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ فَيُوَفّيهِم أُجورَهُم وَيَزيدُهُم مِن فَضلِهِ ۖ وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ استَنكَفوا وَاستَكبَروا فَيُعَذِّبُهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا وَلا يَجِدونَ لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَلِيًّا وَلا نَصيرًا
blank: f-ʾammālladhīn ʾāmanū w-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāt f-yuwaffīhim ʾujūrahum w-yazīduhum m faḍlihī w-ʾammālladhīn stankafū w-stakbarū f-yuʿadhdhibuhum ʿadhāb ʾalīm w-lā yajidūn lahum m dūn llāh waliyy w-lā naṣīr
english_saheeh_international: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who disdained and were arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ قَد جاءَكُم بُرهانٌ مِن رَبِّكُم وَأَنزَلنا إِلَيكُم نورًا مُبينًا
blank: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nās qad jāʾakum burhān m rabbikum w-ʾanzalnā ʾilaykum nūram-mubīn
english_saheeh_international: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light

arabic_uthmani: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا بِاللَّهِ وَاعتَصَموا بِهِ فَسَيُدخِلُهُم في رَحمَةٍ مِنهُ وَفَضلٍ وَيَهديهِم إِلَيهِ صِراطًا مُستَقيمًا
blank: f-ʾammālladhīn ʾāmanū b-llāh w-ʿtaṣamū bihī f-s-yudkhiluhum fī raḥmat minh w-faḍl w-yahdīhim ʾilayh ṣirāṭam-mustaqīm
english_saheeh_international: So those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him - He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path

arabic_uthmani: يَستَفتونَكَ قُلِ اللَّهُ يُفتيكُم فِي الكَلالَةِ ۚ إِنِ امرُؤٌ هَلَكَ لَيسَ لَهُ وَلَدٌ وَلَهُ أُختٌ فَلَها نِصفُ ما تَرَكَ ۚ وَهُوَ يَرِثُها إِن لَم يَكُن لَها وَلَدٌ ۚ فَإِن كانَتَا اثنَتَينِ فَلَهُمَا الثُّلُثانِ مِمّا تَرَكَ ۚ وَإِن كانوا إِخوَةً رِجالًا وَنِساءً فَلِلذَّكَرِ مِثلُ حَظِّ الأُنثَيَينِ ۗ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُم أَن تَضِلّوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
blank: yastaftūnak qul llāh yuftīkum fīl-kalālat ʾin mruʾ halak lays lahū walad w-lahū ʾukht f-lahā niṣf mā tarak w-huw yarithuhā ʾ lam yak lahā walad f-ʾ kānatā thnatayn f-lahumā th-thuluthān mimmā tarak w-ʾ kānū ʾikhwat rijāl w-nisāʾ f-l-dh-dhakar mithl ḥaẓẓil-ʾunthayayn yubayyin llāh lakum ʾ taḍillū w-llāh b-kull shayʾ ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: They request from you a legal ruling. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants as heirs." If a man dies, leaving no child but only a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she dies and has no child. But if there are two sisters or more, they will have two-thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females. Allah makes clear to you His law, lest you go astray. And Allah is Knowing of all things

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَوفوا بِالعُقودِ ۚ أُحِلَّت لَكُم بَهيمَةُ الأَنعامِ إِلّا ما يُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم غَيرَ مُحِلِّي الصَّيدِ وَأَنتُم حُرُمٌ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحكُمُ ما يُريدُ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū ʾawfū b-l-ʿuqūd ʾuḥillat lakum bahīmatul-ʾanʿām ʾillā mā yutlā ʿalaykum ghayr muḥillī ṣ-ṣayd w-ʾantum ḥurum ʾinn llāh yaḥkum mā yurīd
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, fulfill all contracts. Lawful for you are the animals of grazing livestock except for that which is recited to you in this Qur'an - hunting not being permitted while you are in the state of ihram. Indeed, Allah ordains what He intends

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تُحِلّوا شَعائِرَ اللَّهِ وَلَا الشَّهرَ الحَرامَ وَلَا الهَديَ وَلَا القَلائِدَ وَلا آمّينَ البَيتَ الحَرامَ يَبتَغونَ فَضلًا مِن رَبِّهِم وَرِضوانًا ۚ وَإِذا حَلَلتُم فَاصطادوا ۚ وَلا يَجرِمَنَّكُم شَنَآنُ قَومٍ أَن صَدّوكُم عَنِ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ أَن تَعتَدوا ۘ وَتَعاوَنوا عَلَى البِرِّ وَالتَّقوىٰ ۖ وَلا تَعاوَنوا عَلَى الإِثمِ وَالعُدوانِ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ شَديدُ العِقابِ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū lā tuḥillū shaʿāʾir llāh w-lā sh-shahral-ḥarām w-lāl-hady w-lāl-qalāʾid w-lā ʾāmmīnal-baytal-ḥarām yabtaghūn faḍlam-m rabbihim w-riḍwān w-ʾidhā ḥalaltum f-ṣṭādū w-lā yajrimannakum shanaʾān qawm ʾ ṣaddūkum ʿanil-masjidil-ḥarām ʾ taʿtadū w-taʿāwanū ʿalāl-birr w-t-taqwā w-lā taʿāwanū ʿalāl-ʾithm w-l-ʿudwān w-ttaqū llāh ʾinn llāh shadīdul-ʿiqāb
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, do not violate the rites of Allah or the sanctity of the sacred month or neglect the marking of the sacrificial animals and garlanding them or violate the safety of those coming to the Sacred House seeking bounty from their Lord and His approval. But when you come out of ihram, then you may hunt. And do not let the hatred of a people for having obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram lead you to transgress. And cooperate in righteousness and piety, but do not cooperate in sin and aggression. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty

arabic_uthmani: حُرِّمَت عَلَيكُمُ المَيتَةُ وَالدَّمُ وَلَحمُ الخِنزيرِ وَما أُهِلَّ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ بِهِ وَالمُنخَنِقَةُ وَالمَوقوذَةُ وَالمُتَرَدِّيَةُ وَالنَّطيحَةُ وَما أَكَلَ السَّبُعُ إِلّا ما ذَكَّيتُم وَما ذُبِحَ عَلَى النُّصُبِ وَأَن تَستَقسِموا بِالأَزلامِ ۚ ذٰلِكُم فِسقٌ ۗ اليَومَ يَئِسَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن دينِكُم فَلا تَخشَوهُم وَاخشَونِ ۚ اليَومَ أَكمَلتُ لَكُم دينَكُم وَأَتمَمتُ عَلَيكُم نِعمَتي وَرَضيتُ لَكُمُ الإِسلامَ دينًا ۚ فَمَنِ اضطُرَّ في مَخمَصَةٍ غَيرَ مُتَجانِفٍ لِإِثمٍ ۙ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: ḥurrimat ʿalaykumul-maytat w-d-dam w-laḥmul-khinzīr w-mā ʾuhill l-ghayr llāh bihī w-l-munkhaniqat w-l-mawqūdhat w-l-mutaraddiyat w-n-naṭīḥat w-mā ʾakal s-sabuʿ ʾillā mā dhakkaytum w-mā dhubiḥ ʿalā n-nuṣub w-ʾ tastaqsimū b-l-ʾazlām dhālikum fisq-il-yawm yaʾisalladhīn kafarū m dīnikum f-lā takhshawhum w-khshawnil-yawm ʾakmalt lakum dīnakum w-ʾatmamt ʿalaykum niʿmatī w-raḍīt lakumul-ʾislām dīn f-man ḍṭurr fī makhmaṣat ghayr mutajānif l-ʾithm f-ʾinn llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah, and those animals killed by strangling or by a violent blow or by a head-long fall or by the goring of horns, and those from which a wild animal has eaten, except what you are able to slaughter before its death, and those which are sacrificed on stone altars, and prohibited is that you seek decision through divining arrows. That is grave disobedience. This day those who disbelieve have despaired of defeating your religion; so fear them not, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. But whoever is forced by severe hunger with no inclination to sin - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: يَسأَلونَكَ ماذا أُحِلَّ لَهُم ۖ قُل أُحِلَّ لَكُمُ الطَّيِّباتُ ۙ وَما عَلَّمتُم مِنَ الجَوارِحِ مُكَلِّبينَ تُعَلِّمونَهُنَّ مِمّا عَلَّمَكُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ فَكُلوا مِمّا أَمسَكنَ عَلَيكُم وَاذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
blank: yasʾalūnak mādhā ʾuḥill lahum qul ʾuḥill lakum ṭ-ṭayyibāt w-mā ʿallamtum minal-jawāriḥ mukallibīn tuʿallimūnahunn mimmā ʿallamakum llāh f-kulū mimmā ʾamsakn ʿalaykum w-dhkurū sm llāh ʿalayh w-ttaqū llāh ʾinn llāh sarīʿul-ḥisāb
english_saheeh_international: They ask you, O Muhammad, what has been made lawful for them. Say, "Lawful for you are all good foods and game caught by what you have trained of hunting animals which you train as Allah has taught you. So eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of Allah upon it, and fear Allah." Indeed, Allah is swift in account

arabic_uthmani: اليَومَ أُحِلَّ لَكُمُ الطَّيِّباتُ ۖ وَطَعامُ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ حِلٌّ لَكُم وَطَعامُكُم حِلٌّ لَهُم ۖ وَالمُحصَناتُ مِنَ المُؤمِناتِ وَالمُحصَناتُ مِنَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ مِن قَبلِكُم إِذا آتَيتُموهُنَّ أُجورَهُنَّ مُحصِنينَ غَيرَ مُسافِحينَ وَلا مُتَّخِذي أَخدانٍ ۗ وَمَن يَكفُر بِالإيمانِ فَقَد حَبِطَ عَمَلُهُ وَهُوَ فِي الآخِرَةِ مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
blank: al-yawm ʾuḥill lakum ṭ-ṭayyibāt w-ṭaʿāmulladhīn ʾūtūl-kitāb ḥill lakum w-ṭaʿāmukum ḥill lahum w-l-muḥṣanāt minal-muʾmināt w-l-muḥṣanāt minalladhīn ʾūtūl-kitāb m qablikum ʾidhā ʾātaytumūhunn ʾujūrahunn muḥṣinīn ghayr musāfiḥīn w-lā muttakhidhī ʾakhdān w-m yakfur b-l-ʾīmān f-qad ḥabiṭ ʿamaluhū w-huw fīl-ʾākhirat minal-khāsirīn
english_saheeh_international: This day all good foods have been made lawful, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is lawful for you and your food is lawful for them. And lawful in marriage are chaste women from among the believers and chaste women from among those who were given the Scripture before you, when you have given them their due compensation, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse or taking secret lovers. And whoever denies the faith - his work has become worthless, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِذا قُمتُم إِلَى الصَّلاةِ فَاغسِلوا وُجوهَكُم وَأَيدِيَكُم إِلَى المَرافِقِ وَامسَحوا بِرُءوسِكُم وَأَرجُلَكُم إِلَى الكَعبَينِ ۚ وَإِن كُنتُم جُنُبًا فَاطَّهَّروا ۚ وَإِن كُنتُم مَرضىٰ أَو عَلىٰ سَفَرٍ أَو جاءَ أَحَدٌ مِنكُم مِنَ الغائِطِ أَو لامَستُمُ النِّساءَ فَلَم تَجِدوا ماءً فَتَيَمَّموا صَعيدًا طَيِّبًا فَامسَحوا بِوُجوهِكُم وَأَيديكُم مِنهُ ۚ ما يُريدُ اللَّهُ لِيَجعَلَ عَلَيكُم مِن حَرَجٍ وَلٰكِن يُريدُ لِيُطَهِّرَكُم وَلِيُتِمَّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū ʾidhā qumtum ʾilā ṣ-ṣalāt f-ghsilū wujūhakum w-ʾaydiyakum ʾilāl-marāfiq w-msaḥū b-ruʾūsikum w-ʾarjulakum ʾilāl-kaʿbayn w-ʾ kuntum junub f-ṭṭahharū w-ʾ kuntum marḍā ʾaw ʿalā safar ʾaw jāʾ ʾaḥad minkum minal-ghāʾiṭ ʾaw lāmastum n-nisāʾ f-lam tajidū māʾ f-tayammamū ṣaʿīd ṭayyib f-msaḥū b-wujūhikum w-ʾaydīkum minh mā yurīd llāh l-yajʿal ʿalaykum m ḥaraj w-lāk yurīd l-yuṭahhirakum w-l-yutimm niʿmatahū ʿalaykum laʿallakum tashkurūn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, when you rise to perform prayer, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. Allah does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful

arabic_uthmani: وَاذكُروا نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَميثاقَهُ الَّذي واثَقَكُم بِهِ إِذ قُلتُم سَمِعنا وَأَطَعنا ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
blank: w-dhkurū niʿmat llāh ʿalaykum w-mīthāqahulladhī wāthaqakum bihī ʾidh qultum samiʿnā w-ʾaṭaʿnā w-ttaqū llāh ʾinn llāh ʿalīm b-dhāt ṣ-ṣudūr
english_saheeh_international: And remember the favor of Allah upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, "We hear and we obey"; and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا كونوا قَوّامينَ لِلَّهِ شُهَداءَ بِالقِسطِ ۖ وَلا يَجرِمَنَّكُم شَنَآنُ قَومٍ عَلىٰ أَلّا تَعدِلُوا ۚ اعدِلوا هُوَ أَقرَبُ لِلتَّقوىٰ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبيرٌ بِما تَعمَلونَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū kūnū qawwāmīn l-llāh shuhadāʾ b-l-qisṭ w-lā yajrimannakum shanaʾān qawm ʿalā ʾallā taʿdilū ʿdilū huw ʾaqrab l-t-taqwā w-ttaqū llāh ʾinn llāh khabīr b-mā taʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do

arabic_uthmani: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ ۙ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ عَظيمٌ
blank: waʿad llāhulladhīn ʾāmanū w-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāt lahum maghfirat w-ʾajr ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds that for them there is forgiveness and great reward

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَحيمِ
blank: w-lladhīn kafarū w-kadhdhabū b-ʾāyātinā ʾulāʾik ʾaṣḥābul-jaḥīm
english_saheeh_international: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اذكُروا نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم إِذ هَمَّ قَومٌ أَن يَبسُطوا إِلَيكُم أَيدِيَهُم فَكَفَّ أَيدِيَهُم عَنكُم ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَليَتَوَكَّلِ المُؤمِنونَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū dhkurū niʿmat llāh ʿalaykum ʾidh hamm qawm ʾ yabsuṭū ʾilaykum ʾaydiyahum f-kaff ʾaydiyahum ʿankum w-ttaqū llāh w-ʿalā llāh f-l-yatawakkalil-muʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when a people determined to extend their hands in aggression against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَلَقَد أَخَذَ اللَّهُ ميثاقَ بَني إِسرائيلَ وَبَعَثنا مِنهُمُ اثنَي عَشَرَ نَقيبًا ۖ وَقالَ اللَّهُ إِنّي مَعَكُم ۖ لَئِن أَقَمتُمُ الصَّلاةَ وَآتَيتُمُ الزَّكاةَ وَآمَنتُم بِرُسُلي وَعَزَّرتُموهُم وَأَقرَضتُمُ اللَّهَ قَرضًا حَسَنًا لَأُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنكُم سَيِّئَاتِكُم وَلَأُدخِلَنَّكُم جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۚ فَمَن كَفَرَ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ مِنكُم فَقَد ضَلَّ سَواءَ السَّبيلِ
blank: w-l-qad ʾakhadh llāh mīthāq banī ʾisrāʾīl w-baʿathnā minhum thnay ʿashar naqīb w-qāl llāh ʾinnī maʿakum l-ʾ ʾaqamtum ṣ-ṣalāt w-ʾātaytum z-zakāt w-ʾāmantum b-rusulī w-ʿazzartumūhum w-ʾaqraḍtum llāh qarḍ ḥasan l-ʾukaffirann ʿankum sayyiʾātikum w-l-ʾudkhilannakum jannāt tajrī m taḥtihāl-ʾanhār f-m kafar baʿd dhālik minkum f-qad ḍall sawāʾ s-sabīl
english_saheeh_international: And Allah had already taken a covenant from the Children of Israel, and We delegated from among them twelve leaders. And Allah said, "I am with you. If you establish prayer and give zakah and believe in My messengers and support them and loan Allah a goodly loan, I will surely remove from you your misdeeds and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever of you disbelieves after that has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way

arabic_uthmani: فَبِما نَقضِهِم ميثاقَهُم لَعَنّاهُم وَجَعَلنا قُلوبَهُم قاسِيَةً ۖ يُحَرِّفونَ الكَلِمَ عَن مَواضِعِهِ ۙ وَنَسوا حَظًّا مِمّا ذُكِّروا بِهِ ۚ وَلا تَزالُ تَطَّلِعُ عَلىٰ خائِنَةٍ مِنهُم إِلّا قَليلًا مِنهُم ۖ فَاعفُ عَنهُم وَاصفَح ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ المُحسِنينَ
blank: f-b-mā naqḍihim mīthāqahum laʿannāhum w-jaʿalnā qulūbahum qāsiyat yuḥarrifūnal-kalim ʿam-mawāḍiʿihī w-nasū ḥaẓẓam-mimmā dhukkirū bihī w-lā tazāl taṭṭaliʿ ʿalā khāʾinat minhum ʾillā qalīlam-minhum f-ʿf ʿanhum w-ṣfaḥ ʾinn llāh yuḥibbul-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: So for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their proper usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. But pardon them and overlook their misdeeds. Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good

arabic_uthmani: وَمِنَ الَّذينَ قالوا إِنّا نَصارىٰ أَخَذنا ميثاقَهُم فَنَسوا حَظًّا مِمّا ذُكِّروا بِهِ فَأَغرَينا بَينَهُمُ العَداوَةَ وَالبَغضاءَ إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ ۚ وَسَوفَ يُنَبِّئُهُمُ اللَّهُ بِما كانوا يَصنَعونَ
blank: w-minalladhīn qālū ʾinnā naṣārā ʾakhadhnā mīthāqahum f-nasū ḥaẓẓam-mimmā dhukkirū bihī f-ʾaghraynā baynahumul-ʿadāwat w-l-baghḍāʾ ʾilā yawmil-qiyāmat w-sawf yunabbiʾuhum llāh b-mā kānū yaṣnaʿūn
english_saheeh_international: And from those who say, "We are Christians" We took their covenant; but they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded. So We caused among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. And Allah is going to inform them about what they used to do

arabic_uthmani: يا أَهلَ الكِتابِ قَد جاءَكُم رَسولُنا يُبَيِّنُ لَكُم كَثيرًا مِمّا كُنتُم تُخفونَ مِنَ الكِتابِ وَيَعفو عَن كَثيرٍ ۚ قَد جاءَكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ نورٌ وَكِتابٌ مُبينٌ
blank: yā-ʾahlal-kitāb qad jāʾakum rasūlunā yubayyin lakum kathīram-mimmā kuntum tukhfūn minal-kitāb w-yaʿfū ʿ kathīr qad jāʾakum min llāh nūr w-kitāb mubīn
english_saheeh_international: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger making clear to you much of what you used to conceal of the Scripture and overlooking much. There has come to you from Allah a light and a clear Book

arabic_uthmani: يَهدي بِهِ اللَّهُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ رِضوانَهُ سُبُلَ السَّلامِ وَيُخرِجُهُم مِنَ الظُّلُماتِ إِلَى النّورِ بِإِذنِهِ وَيَهديهِم إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
blank: yahdī bih llāh man ttabaʿ riḍwānahū subul s-salām w-yukhrijuhum min ẓ-ẓulumāt ʾilā n-nūr b-ʾidhnihī w-yahdīhim ʾilā ṣirāṭ mustaqīm
english_saheeh_international: By which Allah guides those who pursue His pleasure to the ways of peace and brings them out from darknesses into the light, by His permission, and guides them to a straight path

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد كَفَرَ الَّذينَ قالوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ المَسيحُ ابنُ مَريَمَ ۚ قُل فَمَن يَملِكُ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيئًا إِن أَرادَ أَن يُهلِكَ المَسيحَ ابنَ مَريَمَ وَأُمَّهُ وَمَن فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما ۚ يَخلُقُ ما يَشاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
blank: l-qad kafaralladhīn qālū ʾinn llāh huwal-masīḥ bn maryam qul f-m yamlik min llāh shayʾ ʾ ʾarād ʾ yuhlikal-masīḥ bn maryam w-ʾummahū w-m fīl-ʾarḍ jamīʿ w-l-llāh mulk s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-mā baynahumā yakhluq mā yashāʾ w-llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ qadīr
english_saheeh_international: They have certainly disbelieved who say that Allah is Christ, the son of Mary. Say, "Then who could prevent Allah at all if He had intended to destroy Christ, the son of Mary, or his mother or everyone on the earth?" And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. He creates what He wills, and Allah is over all things competent

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَتِ اليَهودُ وَالنَّصارىٰ نَحنُ أَبناءُ اللَّهِ وَأَحِبّاؤُهُ ۚ قُل فَلِمَ يُعَذِّبُكُم بِذُنوبِكُم ۖ بَل أَنتُم بَشَرٌ مِمَّن خَلَقَ ۚ يَغفِرُ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما ۖ وَإِلَيهِ المَصيرُ
blank: w-qālatil-yahūd w-n-naṣārā naḥn ʾabnāʾ llāh w-ʾaḥibbāʾuhū qul f-l-m yuʿadhdhibukum b-dhunūbikum bal ʾantum bashar mimm khalaq yaghfir l-m yashāʾ w-yuʿadhdhib m yashāʾ w-l-llāh mulk s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-mā baynahumā w-ʾilayhil-maṣīr
english_saheeh_international: But the Jews and the Christians say, "We are the children of Allah and His beloved." Say, "Then why does He punish you for your sins?" Rather, you are human beings from among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the final destination

arabic_uthmani: يا أَهلَ الكِتابِ قَد جاءَكُم رَسولُنا يُبَيِّنُ لَكُم عَلىٰ فَترَةٍ مِنَ الرُّسُلِ أَن تَقولوا ما جاءَنا مِن بَشيرٍ وَلا نَذيرٍ ۖ فَقَد جاءَكُم بَشيرٌ وَنَذيرٌ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
blank: yā-ʾahlal-kitāb qad jāʾakum rasūlunā yubayyin lakum ʿalā fatrat min r-rusul ʾ taqūlū mā jāʾanā m bashīr w-lā nadhīr f-qad jāʾakum bashīr w-nadhīr w-llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ qadīr
english_saheeh_international: O People of the Scripture, there has come to you Our Messenger to make clear to you the religion after a period of suspension of messengers, lest you say, "There came not to us any bringer of good tidings or a warner." But there has come to you a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And Allah is over all things competent

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِقَومِهِ يا قَومِ اذكُروا نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم إِذ جَعَلَ فيكُم أَنبِياءَ وَجَعَلَكُم مُلوكًا وَآتاكُم ما لَم يُؤتِ أَحَدًا مِنَ العالَمينَ
blank: w-ʾidh qāl mūsā l-qawmihī yā-qawm dhkurū niʿmat llāh ʿalaykum ʾidh jaʿal fīkum ʾanbiyāʾ w-jaʿalakum mulūk w-ʾātākum mā lam yuʾt ʾaḥadam-minal-ʿālamīn
english_saheeh_international: And mention, O Muhammad, when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors and gave you that which He had not given anyone among the worlds

arabic_uthmani: يا قَومِ ادخُلُوا الأَرضَ المُقَدَّسَةَ الَّتي كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَكُم وَلا تَرتَدّوا عَلىٰ أَدبارِكُم فَتَنقَلِبوا خاسِرينَ
blank: yā-qawm dkhulūl-ʾarḍal-muqaddasat llatī katab llāh lakum w-lā tartaddū ʿalā ʾadbārikum f-tanqalibū khāsirīn
english_saheeh_international: O my people, enter the Holy Land which Allah has assigned to you and do not turn back from fighting in Allah 's cause and thus become losers

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا موسىٰ إِنَّ فيها قَومًا جَبّارينَ وَإِنّا لَن نَدخُلَها حَتّىٰ يَخرُجوا مِنها فَإِن يَخرُجوا مِنها فَإِنّا داخِلونَ
blank: qālū yā-mūsā ʾinn fīhā qawm jabbārīn w-ʾinnā l nadkhulahā ḥattā yakhrujū minhā f-ʾ yakhrujū minhā f-ʾinnā dākhilūn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O Moses, indeed within it is a people of tyrannical strength, and indeed, we will never enter it until they leave it; but if they leave it, then we will enter

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَجُلانِ مِنَ الَّذينَ يَخافونَ أَنعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِمَا ادخُلوا عَلَيهِمُ البابَ فَإِذا دَخَلتُموهُ فَإِنَّكُم غالِبونَ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَتَوَكَّلوا إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
blank: qāl rajulān minalladhīn yakhāfūn ʾanʿam llāh ʿalayhimā dkhulū ʿalayhimul-bāb f-ʾidhā dakhaltumūh f-ʾinnakum ghālibūn w-ʿalā llāh f-tawakkalū ʾ kuntum muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: Said two men from those who feared to disobey upon whom Allah had bestowed favor, "Enter upon them through the gate, for when you have entered it, you will be predominant. And upon Allah rely, if you should be believers

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا موسىٰ إِنّا لَن نَدخُلَها أَبَدًا ما داموا فيها ۖ فَاذهَب أَنتَ وَرَبُّكَ فَقاتِلا إِنّا هاهُنا قاعِدونَ
blank: qālū yā-mūsā ʾinnā l nadkhulahā ʾabadam-mā dāmū fīhā f-dhhab ʾant w-rabbuk f-qātilā ʾinnā hāhunā qāʿidūn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O Moses, indeed we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are within it; so go, you and your Lord, and fight. Indeed, we are remaining right here

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي لا أَملِكُ إِلّا نَفسي وَأَخي ۖ فَافرُق بَينَنا وَبَينَ القَومِ الفاسِقينَ
blank: qāl rabb ʾinnī lā ʾamlik ʾillā nafsī w-ʾakhī f-fruq baynanā w-baynal-qawmil-fāsiqīn
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "My Lord, indeed I do not possess except myself and my brother, so part us from the defiantly disobedient people

arabic_uthmani: قالَ فَإِنَّها مُحَرَّمَةٌ عَلَيهِم ۛ أَربَعينَ سَنَةً ۛ يَتيهونَ فِي الأَرضِ ۚ فَلا تَأسَ عَلَى القَومِ الفاسِقينَ
blank: qāl f-ʾinnahā muḥarramat ʿalayhim ʾarbaʿīn sanat yatīhūn fīl-ʾarḍ f-lā taʾs ʿalāl-qawmil-fāsiqīn
english_saheeh_international: Allah said, "Then indeed, it is forbidden to them for forty years in which they will wander throughout the land. So do not grieve over the defiantly disobedient people

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَاتلُ عَلَيهِم نَبَأَ ابنَي آدَمَ بِالحَقِّ إِذ قَرَّبا قُربانًا فَتُقُبِّلَ مِن أَحَدِهِما وَلَم يُتَقَبَّل مِنَ الآخَرِ قالَ لَأَقتُلَنَّكَ ۖ قالَ إِنَّما يَتَقَبَّلُ اللَّهُ مِنَ المُتَّقينَ
blank: w-tl ʿalayhim nabaʾ bnay ʾādam b-l-ḥaqq ʾidh qarrabā qurbān f-tuqubbil m ʾaḥadihimā w-lam yutaqabbal minal-ʾākhar qāl l-ʾaqtulannak qāl ʾinnamā yataqabbal llāh minal-muttaqīn
english_saheeh_international: And recite to them the story of Adam's two sons, in truth, when they both offered a sacrifice to Allah, and it was accepted from one of them but was not accepted from the other. Said the latter, "I will surely kill you." Said the former, "Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous who fear Him

arabic_uthmani: لَئِن بَسَطتَ إِلَيَّ يَدَكَ لِتَقتُلَني ما أَنا بِباسِطٍ يَدِيَ إِلَيكَ لِأَقتُلَكَ ۖ إِنّي أَخافُ اللَّهَ رَبَّ العالَمينَ
blank: l-ʾ basaṭt ʾilayy yadak l-taqtulanī mā ʾan b-bāsiṭ yadiy ʾilayk l-ʾaqtulak ʾinnī ʾakhāf llāh rabbal-ʿālamīn
english_saheeh_international: If you should raise your hand against me to kill me - I shall not raise my hand against you to kill you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds

arabic_uthmani: إِنّي أُريدُ أَن تَبوءَ بِإِثمي وَإِثمِكَ فَتَكونَ مِن أَصحابِ النّارِ ۚ وَذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ الظّالِمينَ
blank: ʾinnī ʾurīd ʾ tabūʾ b-ʾithmī w-ʾithmik f-takūn m ʾaṣḥāb n-nār w-dhālik jazāʾ ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed I want you to obtain thereby my sin and your sin so you will be among the companions of the Fire. And that is the recompense of wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: فَطَوَّعَت لَهُ نَفسُهُ قَتلَ أَخيهِ فَقَتَلَهُ فَأَصبَحَ مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
blank: f-ṭawwaʿat lahū nafsuhū qatl ʾakhīh f-qatalahū f-ʾaṣbaḥ minal-khāsirīn
english_saheeh_international: And his soul permitted to him the murder of his brother, so he killed him and became among the losers

arabic_uthmani: فَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ غُرابًا يَبحَثُ فِي الأَرضِ لِيُرِيَهُ كَيفَ يُواري سَوءَةَ أَخيهِ ۚ قالَ يا وَيلَتا أَعَجَزتُ أَن أَكونَ مِثلَ هٰذَا الغُرابِ فَأُوارِيَ سَوءَةَ أَخي ۖ فَأَصبَحَ مِنَ النّادِمينَ
blank: f-baʿath llāh ghurāb yabḥath fīl-ʾarḍ l-yuriyahū kayf yuwārī sawʾat ʾakhīh qāl yā-waylatā ʾ-ʿajazt ʾ ʾakūn mithl hādhāl-ghurāb f-ʾuwāriy sawʾat ʾakhī f-ʾaṣbaḥ min n-nādimīn
english_saheeh_international: Then Allah sent a crow searching in the ground to show him how to hide the disgrace of his brother. He said, "O woe to me! Have I failed to be like this crow and hide the body of my brother?" And he became of the regretful

arabic_uthmani: مِن أَجلِ ذٰلِكَ كَتَبنا عَلىٰ بَني إِسرائيلَ أَنَّهُ مَن قَتَلَ نَفسًا بِغَيرِ نَفسٍ أَو فَسادٍ فِي الأَرضِ فَكَأَنَّما قَتَلَ النّاسَ جَميعًا وَمَن أَحياها فَكَأَنَّما أَحيَا النّاسَ جَميعًا ۚ وَلَقَد جاءَتهُم رُسُلُنا بِالبَيِّناتِ ثُمَّ إِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنهُم بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ فِي الأَرضِ لَمُسرِفونَ
blank: m ʾajl dhālik katabnā ʿalā banī ʾisrāʾīl ʾannahū m qatal nafs b-ghayr nafs ʾaw fasād fīl-ʾarḍ f-k-ʾannamā qatal n-nās jamīʿ w-m ʾaḥyāhā f-k-ʾannamā ʾaḥyā n-nās jamīʿ w-l-qad jāʾathum rusulunā b-l-bayyināt thumm ʾinn kathīram-minhum baʿd dhālik fīl-ʾarḍ l-musrifūn
english_saheeh_international: Because of that, We decreed upon the Children of Israel that whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption done in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely. And whoever saves one - it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. And our messengers had certainly come to them with clear proofs. Then indeed many of them, even after that, throughout the land, were transgressors

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّما جَزاءُ الَّذينَ يُحارِبونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَيَسعَونَ فِي الأَرضِ فَسادًا أَن يُقَتَّلوا أَو يُصَلَّبوا أَو تُقَطَّعَ أَيديهِم وَأَرجُلُهُم مِن خِلافٍ أَو يُنفَوا مِنَ الأَرضِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ لَهُم خِزيٌ فِي الدُّنيا ۖ وَلَهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
blank: ʾinnamā jazāʾulladhīn yuḥāribūn llāh w-rasūlahū w-yasʿawn fīl-ʾarḍ fasād ʾ yuqattalū ʾaw yuṣallabū ʾaw tuqaṭṭaʿ ʾaydīhim w-ʾarjuluhum m khilāf ʾaw yunfaw minal-ʾarḍ dhālik lahum khizy fī d-dunyā w-lahum fīl-ʾākhirat ʿadhāb ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth to cause corruption is none but that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the land. That is for them a disgrace in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment

arabic_uthmani: إِلَّا الَّذينَ تابوا مِن قَبلِ أَن تَقدِروا عَلَيهِم ۖ فَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: ʾillālladhīn tābū m qabl ʾ taqdirū ʿalayhim f-ʿlamū ʾann llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: Except for those who return repenting before you apprehend them. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَابتَغوا إِلَيهِ الوَسيلَةَ وَجاهِدوا في سَبيلِهِ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū ttaqū llāh w-btaghū ʾilayhil-wasīlat w-jāhidū fī sabīlihī laʿallakum tufliḥūn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means of nearness to Him and strive in His cause that you may succeed

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَو أَنَّ لَهُم ما فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا وَمِثلَهُ مَعَهُ لِيَفتَدوا بِهِ مِن عَذابِ يَومِ القِيامَةِ ما تُقُبِّلَ مِنهُم ۖ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
blank: ʾinnalladhīn kafarū law ʾann lahum mā fīl-ʾarḍ jamīʿ w-mithlahū maʿahū l-yaftadū bihī m ʿadhāb yawmil-qiyāmatimā tuqubbil minhum w-lahum ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who disbelieve - if they should have all that is in the earth and the like of it with it by which to ransom themselves from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and for them is a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: يُريدونَ أَن يَخرُجوا مِنَ النّارِ وَما هُم بِخارِجينَ مِنها ۖ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ مُقيمٌ
blank: yurīdūn ʾ yakhrujū min n-nār w-mā hum b-khārijīn minhā w-lahum ʿadhāb muqīm
english_saheeh_international: They will wish to get out of the Fire, but never are they to emerge therefrom, and for them is an enduring punishment

arabic_uthmani: وَالسّارِقُ وَالسّارِقَةُ فَاقطَعوا أَيدِيَهُما جَزاءً بِما كَسَبا نَكالًا مِنَ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
blank: w-s-sāriq w-s-sāriqat f-qṭaʿū ʾaydiyahumā jazāʾ b-mā kasabā nakālam-min llāh w-llāh ʿazīz ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: As for the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands in recompense for what they committed as a deterrent punishment from Allah. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise

arabic_uthmani: فَمَن تابَ مِن بَعدِ ظُلمِهِ وَأَصلَحَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يَتوبُ عَلَيهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: f-m tāb m baʿd ẓulmihī w-ʾaṣlaḥ f-ʾinn llāh yatūb ʿalayh ʾinn llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: But whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, indeed, Allah will turn to him in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: أَلَم تَعلَم أَنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ يُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَغفِرُ لِمَن يَشاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
blank: ʾ-lam taʿlam ʾann llāh lahū mulk s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ yuʿadhdhib m yashāʾ w-yaghfir l-m yashāʾ w-llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ qadīr
english_saheeh_international: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent

arabic_uthmani: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا الرَّسولُ لا يَحزُنكَ الَّذينَ يُسارِعونَ فِي الكُفرِ مِنَ الَّذينَ قالوا آمَنّا بِأَفواهِهِم وَلَم تُؤمِن قُلوبُهُم ۛ وَمِنَ الَّذينَ هادوا ۛ سَمّاعونَ لِلكَذِبِ سَمّاعونَ لِقَومٍ آخَرينَ لَم يَأتوكَ ۖ يُحَرِّفونَ الكَلِمَ مِن بَعدِ مَواضِعِهِ ۖ يَقولونَ إِن أوتيتُم هٰذا فَخُذوهُ وَإِن لَم تُؤتَوهُ فَاحذَروا ۚ وَمَن يُرِدِ اللَّهُ فِتنَتَهُ فَلَن تَملِكَ لَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيئًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَم يُرِدِ اللَّهُ أَن يُطَهِّرَ قُلوبَهُم ۚ لَهُم فِي الدُّنيا خِزيٌ ۖ وَلَهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhā r-rasūl lā yaḥzunkalladhīn yusāriʿūn fīl-kufr minalladhīn qālū ʾāmannā b-ʾafwāhihim w-lam tuʾm qulūbuhum w-minalladhīn hādū sammāʿūn l-l-kadhib sammāʿūn l-qawm ʾākharīn lam yaʾtūk yuḥarrifūnal-kalim m baʿd mawāḍiʿihī yaqūlūn ʾ ʾūtītum hādhā f-khudhūh w-ʾ lam tuʾtawh f-ḥdharū w-m yurid llāh fitnatahū f-l tamlik lahū min llāh shayʾ ʾulāʾikalladhīn lam yurid llāh ʾ yuṭahhir qulūbahum lahum fī d-dunyā khizy w-lahum fīl-ʾākhirat ʿadhāb ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: O Messenger, let them not grieve you who hasten into disbelief of those who say, "We believe" with their mouths, but their hearts believe not, and from among the Jews. They are avid listeners to falsehood, listening to another people who have not come to you. They distort words beyond their proper usages, saying "If you are given this, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware." But he for whom Allah intends fitnah - never will you possess power to do for him a thing against Allah. Those are the ones for whom Allah does not intend to purify their hearts. For them in this world is disgrace, and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment

arabic_uthmani: سَمّاعونَ لِلكَذِبِ أَكّالونَ لِلسُّحتِ ۚ فَإِن جاءوكَ فَاحكُم بَينَهُم أَو أَعرِض عَنهُم ۖ وَإِن تُعرِض عَنهُم فَلَن يَضُرّوكَ شَيئًا ۖ وَإِن حَكَمتَ فَاحكُم بَينَهُم بِالقِسطِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ المُقسِطينَ
blank: sammāʿūn l-l-kadhib ʾakkālūn l-s-suḥt f-ʾ jāʾūk f-ḥkum baynahum ʾaw ʾaʿriḍ ʿanhum w-ʾ tuʿriḍ ʿanhum f-l yaḍurrūk shayʾ w-ʾ ḥakamt f-ḥkum baynahum b-l-qisṭ ʾinn llāh yuḥibbul-muqsiṭīn
english_saheeh_international: They are avid listeners to falsehood, devourers of what is unlawful. So if they come to you, O Muhammad, judge between them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them - never will they harm you at all. And if you judge, judge between them with justice. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly

arabic_uthmani: وَكَيفَ يُحَكِّمونَكَ وَعِندَهُمُ التَّوراةُ فيها حُكمُ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّونَ مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ ۚ وَما أُولٰئِكَ بِالمُؤمِنينَ
blank: w-kayf yuḥakkimūnak w-ʿindahum t-tawrāt fīhā ḥukm llāh thumm yatawallawn m baʿd dhālik w-mā ʾulāʾik b-l-muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: But how is it that they come to you for judgement while they have the Torah, in which is the judgement of Allah? Then they turn away, even after that; but those are not in fact believers

arabic_uthmani: إِنّا أَنزَلنَا التَّوراةَ فيها هُدًى وَنورٌ ۚ يَحكُمُ بِهَا النَّبِيّونَ الَّذينَ أَسلَموا لِلَّذينَ هادوا وَالرَّبّانِيّونَ وَالأَحبارُ بِمَا استُحفِظوا مِن كِتابِ اللَّهِ وَكانوا عَلَيهِ شُهَداءَ ۚ فَلا تَخشَوُا النّاسَ وَاخشَونِ وَلا تَشتَروا بِآياتي ثَمَنًا قَليلًا ۚ وَمَن لَم يَحكُم بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الكافِرونَ
blank: ʾinnā ʾanzalnā t-tawrāt fīhā hud w-nūr yaḥkum bihā n-nabiyyūnalladhīn ʾaslamū l-lladhīn hādū w-r-rabbāniyyūn w-l-ʾaḥbār b-mā stuḥfiẓū m kitāb llāh w-kānū ʿalayh shuhadāʾ f-lā takhshaw n-nās w-khshawn w-lā tashtarū b-ʾāyātī thaman qalīl w-m lam yaḥkum b-mā ʾanzal llāh f-ʾulāʾik humul-kāfirūn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which was guidance and light. The prophets who submitted to Allah judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars by that with which they were entrusted of the Scripture of Allah, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not exchange My verses for a small price. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the disbelievers

arabic_uthmani: وَكَتَبنا عَلَيهِم فيها أَنَّ النَّفسَ بِالنَّفسِ وَالعَينَ بِالعَينِ وَالأَنفَ بِالأَنفِ وَالأُذُنَ بِالأُذُنِ وَالسِّنَّ بِالسِّنِّ وَالجُروحَ قِصاصٌ ۚ فَمَن تَصَدَّقَ بِهِ فَهُوَ كَفّارَةٌ لَهُ ۚ وَمَن لَم يَحكُم بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الظّالِمونَ
blank: w-katabnā ʿalayhim fīhā ʾann n-nafs b-n-nafs w-l-ʿayn b-l-ʿayn w-l-ʾanf b-l-ʾanf w-l-ʾudhun b-l-ʾudhun w-s-sinn b-s-sinn w-l-jurūḥ qiṣāṣ f-m taṣaddaq bihī f-huw kaffārat lahū w-m lam yaḥkum b-mā ʾanzal llāh f-ʾulāʾik hum ẓ-ẓālimūn
english_saheeh_international: And We ordained for them therein a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds is legal retribution. But whoever gives up his right as charity, it is an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: وَقَفَّينا عَلىٰ آثارِهِم بِعيسَى ابنِ مَريَمَ مُصَدِّقًا لِما بَينَ يَدَيهِ مِنَ التَّوراةِ ۖ وَآتَيناهُ الإِنجيلَ فيهِ هُدًى وَنورٌ وَمُصَدِّقًا لِما بَينَ يَدَيهِ مِنَ التَّوراةِ وَهُدًى وَمَوعِظَةً لِلمُتَّقينَ
blank: w-qaffaynā ʿalā ʾāthārihim b-ʿīsā bn maryam muṣaddiq l-mā bayn yadayh min t-tawrāt w-ʾātaynāhul-ʾinjīl fīh hud w-nūr w-muṣaddiq l-mā bayn yadayh min t-tawrāt w-hud w-mawʿiẓat l-l-muttaqīn
english_saheeh_international: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming that which came before him in the Torah; and We gave him the Gospel, in which was guidance and light and confirming that which preceded it of the Torah as guidance and instruction for the righteous

arabic_uthmani: وَليَحكُم أَهلُ الإِنجيلِ بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ فيهِ ۚ وَمَن لَم يَحكُم بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الفاسِقونَ
blank: w-l-yaḥkum ʾahlul-ʾinjīl b-mā ʾanzal llāh fīh w-m lam yaḥkum b-mā ʾanzal llāh f-ʾulāʾik humul-fāsiqūn
english_saheeh_international: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allah has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient

arabic_uthmani: وَأَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ الكِتابَ بِالحَقِّ مُصَدِّقًا لِما بَينَ يَدَيهِ مِنَ الكِتابِ وَمُهَيمِنًا عَلَيهِ ۖ فَاحكُم بَينَهُم بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ ۖ وَلا تَتَّبِع أَهواءَهُم عَمّا جاءَكَ مِنَ الحَقِّ ۚ لِكُلٍّ جَعَلنا مِنكُم شِرعَةً وَمِنهاجًا ۚ وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُم أُمَّةً واحِدَةً وَلٰكِن لِيَبلُوَكُم في ما آتاكُم ۖ فَاستَبِقُوا الخَيراتِ ۚ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرجِعُكُم جَميعًا فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِما كُنتُم فيهِ تَختَلِفونَ
blank: w-ʾanzalnā ʾilaykal-kitāb b-l-ḥaqq muṣaddiq l-mā bayn yadayh minal-kitāb w-muhaymin ʿalayh f-ḥkum baynahum b-mā ʾanzal llāh w-lā tattabiʿ ʾahwāʾahum ʿammā jāʾak minal-ḥaqq l-kull jaʿalnā minkum shirʿat w-minhāj w-law shāʾ llāh l-jaʿalakum ʾummat wāḥidat w-lāk l-yabluwakum fī mā ʾātākum f-stabiqūl-khayrāt ʾilā llāh marjiʿukum jamīʿ f-yunabbiʾukum b-mā kuntum fīh takhtalifūn
english_saheeh_international: And We have revealed to you, O Muhammad, the Book in truth, confirming that which preceded it of the Scripture and as a criterion over it. So judge between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations away from what has come to you of the truth. To each of you We prescribed a law and a method. Had Allah willed, He would have made you one nation united in religion, but He intended to test you in what He has given you; so race to all that is good. To Allah is your return all together, and He will then inform you concerning that over which you used to differ

arabic_uthmani: وَأَنِ احكُم بَينَهُم بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ وَلا تَتَّبِع أَهواءَهُم وَاحذَرهُم أَن يَفتِنوكَ عَن بَعضِ ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ إِلَيكَ ۖ فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَاعلَم أَنَّما يُريدُ اللَّهُ أَن يُصيبَهُم بِبَعضِ ذُنوبِهِم ۗ وَإِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنَ النّاسِ لَفاسِقونَ
blank: w-ʾan ḥkum baynahum b-mā ʾanzal llāh w-lā tattabiʿ ʾahwāʾahum w-ḥdharhum ʾ yaftinūk ʿ baʿḍ mā ʾanzal llāh ʾilayk f-ʾ tawallaw f-ʿlam ʾannamā yurīd llāh ʾ yuṣībahum b-baʿḍ dhunūbihim w-ʾinn kathīram-min n-nās l-fāsiqūn
english_saheeh_international: And judge, O Muhammad, between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations and beware of them, lest they tempt you away from some of what Allah has revealed to you. And if they turn away - then know that Allah only intends to afflict them with some of their own sins. And indeed, many among the people are defiantly disobedient

arabic_uthmani: أَفَحُكمَ الجاهِلِيَّةِ يَبغونَ ۚ وَمَن أَحسَنُ مِنَ اللَّهِ حُكمًا لِقَومٍ يوقِنونَ
blank: ʾ-f-ḥukmal-jāhiliyyat yabghūn w-m ʾaḥsan min llāh ḥukm l-qawm yūqinūn
english_saheeh_international: Then is it the judgement of the time of ignorance they desire? But who is better than Allah in judgement for a people who are certain in faith

arabic_uthmani: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَتَّخِذُوا اليَهودَ وَالنَّصارىٰ أَولِياءَ ۘ بَعضُهُم أَولِياءُ بَعضٍ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّهُم مِنكُم فَإِنَّهُ مِنهُم ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الظّالِمينَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū lā tattakhidhūl-yahūd w-n-naṣārā ʾawliyāʾ baʿḍuhum ʾawliyāʾ baʿḍ w-m yatawallahum minkum f-ʾinnahū minhum ʾinn llāh lā yahdīl-qawm ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are in fact allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is one of them. Indeed, Allah guides not the wrongdoing people

arabic_uthmani: فَتَرَى الَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ يُسارِعونَ فيهِم يَقولونَ نَخشىٰ أَن تُصيبَنا دائِرَةٌ ۚ فَعَسَى اللَّهُ أَن يَأتِيَ بِالفَتحِ أَو أَمرٍ مِن عِندِهِ فَيُصبِحوا عَلىٰ ما أَسَرّوا في أَنفُسِهِم نادِمينَ
blank: f-tarālladhīn fī qulūbihim maraḍ yusāriʿūn fīhim yaqūlūn nakhshā ʾ tuṣībanā dāʾirat f-ʿasā llāh ʾ yaʾtiy b-l-fatḥ ʾaw ʾamr m ʿindihī f-yuṣbiḥū ʿalā mā ʾasarrū fī ʾanfusihim nādimīn
english_saheeh_international: So you see those in whose hearts is disease hastening into association with them, saying, "We are afraid a misfortune may strike us." But perhaps Allah will bring conquest or a decision from Him, and they will become, over what they have been concealing within themselves, regretful

arabic_uthmani: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَهٰؤُلاءِ الَّذينَ أَقسَموا بِاللَّهِ جَهدَ أَيمانِهِم ۙ إِنَّهُم لَمَعَكُم ۚ حَبِطَت أَعمالُهُم فَأَصبَحوا خاسِرينَ
blank: w-yaqūlulladhīn ʾāmanū ʾ-hāʾulāʾilladhīn ʾaqsamū b-llāh jahd ʾaymānihim ʾinnahum l-maʿakum ḥabiṭat ʾaʿmāluhum f-ʾaṣbaḥū khāsirīn
english_saheeh_international: And those who believe will say, "Are these the ones who swore by Allah their strongest oaths that indeed they were with you?" Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا مَن يَرتَدَّ مِنكُم عَن دينِهِ فَسَوفَ يَأتِي اللَّهُ بِقَومٍ يُحِبُّهُم وَيُحِبّونَهُ أَذِلَّةٍ عَلَى المُؤمِنينَ أَعِزَّةٍ عَلَى الكافِرينَ يُجاهِدونَ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَلا يَخافونَ لَومَةَ لائِمٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ فَضلُ اللَّهِ يُؤتيهِ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ واسِعٌ عَليمٌ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū m yartadd minkum ʿ dīnihī f-sawf yaʾtī llāh b-qawm yuḥibbuhum w-yuḥibbūnahū ʾadhillat ʿalāl-muʾminīn ʾaʿizzat ʿalāl-kāfirīn yujāhidūn fī sabīl llāh w-lā yakhāfūn lawmat lāʾim dhālik faḍl llāh yuʾtīh m yashāʾ w-llāh wāsiʿ ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, whoever of you should revert from his religion - Allah will bring forth in place of them a people He will love and who will love Him who are humble toward the believers, powerful against the disbelievers; they strive in the cause of Allah and do not fear the blame of a critic. That is the favor of Allah; He bestows it upon whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّما وَلِيُّكُمُ اللَّهُ وَرَسولُهُ وَالَّذينَ آمَنُوا الَّذينَ يُقيمونَ الصَّلاةَ وَيُؤتونَ الزَّكاةَ وَهُم راكِعونَ
blank: ʾinnamā waliyyukum llāh w-rasūluhū w-lladhīn ʾāmanūlladhīn yuqīmūn ṣ-ṣalāt w-yuʾtūn z-zakāt w-hum rākiʿūn
english_saheeh_international: Your ally is none but Allah and therefore His Messenger and those who have believed - those who establish prayer and give zakah, and they bow in worship

arabic_uthmani: وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا فَإِنَّ حِزبَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الغالِبونَ
blank: w-m yatawall llāh w-rasūlahū w-lladhīn ʾāmanū f-ʾinn ḥizb llāh humul-ghālibūn
english_saheeh_international: And whoever is an ally of Allah and His Messenger and those who have believed - indeed, the party of Allah - they will be the predominant

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَتَّخِذُوا الَّذينَ اتَّخَذوا دينَكُم هُزُوًا وَلَعِبًا مِنَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ مِن قَبلِكُم وَالكُفّارَ أَولِياءَ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū lā tattakhidhūlladhīn ttakhadhū dīnakum huzuw w-laʿibam-minalladhīn ʾūtūl-kitāb m qablikum w-l-kuffār ʾawliyāʾ w-ttaqū llāh ʾ kuntum muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, take not those who have taken your religion in ridicule and amusement among the ones who were given the Scripture before you nor the disbelievers as allies. And fear Allah, if you should truly be believers

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا نادَيتُم إِلَى الصَّلاةِ اتَّخَذوها هُزُوًا وَلَعِبًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم قَومٌ لا يَعقِلونَ
blank: w-ʾidhā nādaytum ʾilā ṣ-ṣalāt ttakhadhūhā huzuw w-laʿib dhālik b-ʾannahum qawm lā yaʿqilūn
english_saheeh_international: And when you call to prayer, they take it in ridicule and amusement. That is because they are a people who do not use reason

arabic_uthmani: قُل يا أَهلَ الكِتابِ هَل تَنقِمونَ مِنّا إِلّا أَن آمَنّا بِاللَّهِ وَما أُنزِلَ إِلَينا وَما أُنزِلَ مِن قَبلُ وَأَنَّ أَكثَرَكُم فاسِقونَ
blank: qul yā-ʾahlal-kitāb hal tanqimūn minnā ʾillā ʾ ʾāmannā b-llāh w-mā ʾunzil ʾilaynā w-mā ʾunzil m qabl w-ʾann ʾaktharakum fāsiqūn
english_saheeh_international: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except for the fact that we have believed in Allah and what was revealed to us and what was revealed before and because most of you are defiantly disobedient

arabic_uthmani: قُل هَل أُنَبِّئُكُم بِشَرٍّ مِن ذٰلِكَ مَثوبَةً عِندَ اللَّهِ ۚ مَن لَعَنَهُ اللَّهُ وَغَضِبَ عَلَيهِ وَجَعَلَ مِنهُمُ القِرَدَةَ وَالخَنازيرَ وَعَبَدَ الطّاغوتَ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكانًا وَأَضَلُّ عَن سَواءِ السَّبيلِ
blank: qul hal ʾunabbiʾukum b-sharr m dhālik mathūbat ʿind llāh m laʿanah llāh w-ghaḍib ʿalayh w-jaʿal minhumul-qiradat w-l-khanāzīr w-ʿabad ṭ-ṭāghūt ʾulāʾik sharr makān w-ʾaḍall ʿ sawāʾ s-sabīl
english_saheeh_international: Say, "Shall I inform you of what is worse than that as penalty from Allah? It is that of those whom Allah has cursed and with whom He became angry and made of them apes and pigs and slaves of Taghut. Those are worse in position and further astray from the sound way

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا جاءوكُم قالوا آمَنّا وَقَد دَخَلوا بِالكُفرِ وَهُم قَد خَرَجوا بِهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما كانوا يَكتُمونَ
blank: w-ʾidhā jāʾūkum qālū ʾāmannā w-qad dakhalū b-l-kufr w-hum qad kharajū bihī w-llāh ʾaʿlam b-mā kānū yaktumūn
english_saheeh_international: And when they come to you, they say, "We believe." But they have entered with disbelief in their hearts, and they have certainly left with it. And Allah is most knowing of what they were concealing

arabic_uthmani: وَتَرىٰ كَثيرًا مِنهُم يُسارِعونَ فِي الإِثمِ وَالعُدوانِ وَأَكلِهِمُ السُّحتَ ۚ لَبِئسَ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
blank: w-tarā kathīram-minhum yusāriʿūn fīl-ʾithm w-l-ʿudwān w-ʾaklihim s-suḥt l-biʾs mā kānū yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And you see many of them hastening into sin and aggression and the devouring of what is unlawful. How wretched is what they have been doing

arabic_uthmani: لَولا يَنهاهُمُ الرَّبّانِيّونَ وَالأَحبارُ عَن قَولِهِمُ الإِثمَ وَأَكلِهِمُ السُّحتَ ۚ لَبِئسَ ما كانوا يَصنَعونَ
blank: law-lā yanhāhum r-rabbāniyyūn w-l-ʾaḥbār ʿ qawlihimul-ʾithm w-ʾaklihim s-suḥt l-biʾs mā kānū yaṣnaʿūn
english_saheeh_international: Why do the rabbis and religious scholars not forbid them from saying what is sinful and devouring what is unlawful? How wretched is what they have been practicing

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَتِ اليَهودُ يَدُ اللَّهِ مَغلولَةٌ ۚ غُلَّت أَيديهِم وَلُعِنوا بِما قالوا ۘ بَل يَداهُ مَبسوطَتانِ يُنفِقُ كَيفَ يَشاءُ ۚ وَلَيَزيدَنَّ كَثيرًا مِنهُم ما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ طُغيانًا وَكُفرًا ۚ وَأَلقَينا بَينَهُمُ العَداوَةَ وَالبَغضاءَ إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ ۚ كُلَّما أَوقَدوا نارًا لِلحَربِ أَطفَأَهَا اللَّهُ ۚ وَيَسعَونَ فِي الأَرضِ فَسادًا ۚ وَاللَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ المُفسِدينَ
blank: w-qālatil-yahūd yad llāh maghlūlat ghullat ʾaydīhim w-luʿinū b-mā qālū bal yadāh mabsūṭatān yunfiq kayf yashāʾ w-l-yazīdann kathīram-minhum mā ʾunzil ʾilayk m rabbik ṭughyān w-kufr w-ʾalqaynā baynahumul-ʿadāwat w-l-baghḍāʾ ʾilā yawmil-qiyāmat kullamā ʾawqadū nār l-l-ḥarb ʾaṭfaʾahā llāh w-yasʿawn fīl-ʾarḍ fasād w-llāh lā yuḥibbul-mufsidīn
english_saheeh_international: And the Jews say, "The hand of Allah is chained." Chained are their hands, and cursed are they for what they say. Rather, both His hands are extended; He spends however He wills. And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. And We have cast among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. Every time they kindled the fire of war against you, Allah extinguished it. And they strive throughout the land causing corruption, and Allah does not like corrupters

arabic_uthmani: وَلَو أَنَّ أَهلَ الكِتابِ آمَنوا وَاتَّقَوا لَكَفَّرنا عَنهُم سَيِّئَاتِهِم وَلَأَدخَلناهُم جَنّاتِ النَّعيمِ
blank: w-law ʾann ʾahlal-kitāb ʾāmanū w-ttaqaw l-kaffarnā ʿanhum sayyiʾātihim w-l-ʾadkhalnāhum jannāt n-naʿīm
english_saheeh_international: And if only the People of the Scripture had believed and feared Allah, We would have removed from them their misdeeds and admitted them to Gardens of Pleasure

arabic_uthmani: وَلَو أَنَّهُم أَقامُوا التَّوراةَ وَالإِنجيلَ وَما أُنزِلَ إِلَيهِم مِن رَبِّهِم لَأَكَلوا مِن فَوقِهِم وَمِن تَحتِ أَرجُلِهِم ۚ مِنهُم أُمَّةٌ مُقتَصِدَةٌ ۖ وَكَثيرٌ مِنهُم ساءَ ما يَعمَلونَ
blank: w-law ʾannahum ʾaqāmū t-tawrāt w-l-ʾinjīl w-mā ʾunzil ʾilayhim m rabbihim l-ʾakalū m fawqihim w-m taḥt ʾarjulihim minhum ʾummat muqtaṣidat w-kathīr minhum sāʾ mā yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And if only they upheld the law of the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have consumed provision from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them are a moderate community, but many of them - evil is that which they do

arabic_uthmani: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا الرَّسولُ بَلِّغ ما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ ۖ وَإِن لَم تَفعَل فَما بَلَّغتَ رِسالَتَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعصِمُكَ مِنَ النّاسِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الكافِرينَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhā r-rasūl balligh mā ʾunzil ʾilayk m rabbik w-ʾ lam tafʿal f-mā ballaght risālatahū w-llāh yaʿṣimuk min n-nās ʾinn llāh lā yahdīl-qawmal-kāfirīn
english_saheeh_international: O Messenger, announce that which has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people

arabic_uthmani: قُل يا أَهلَ الكِتابِ لَستُم عَلىٰ شَيءٍ حَتّىٰ تُقيمُوا التَّوراةَ وَالإِنجيلَ وَما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكُم مِن رَبِّكُم ۗ وَلَيَزيدَنَّ كَثيرًا مِنهُم ما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ طُغيانًا وَكُفرًا ۖ فَلا تَأسَ عَلَى القَومِ الكافِرينَ
blank: qul yā-ʾahlal-kitāb lastum ʿalā shayʾ ḥattā tuqīmū t-tawrāt w-l-ʾinjīl w-mā ʾunzil ʾilaykum m rabbikum w-l-yazīdann kathīram-minhum mā ʾunzil ʾilayk m rabbik ṭughyān w-kufr f-lā taʾs ʿalāl-qawmil-kāfirīn
english_saheeh_international: Say, "O People of the Scripture, you are standing on nothing until you uphold the law of the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord." And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. So do not grieve over the disbelieving people

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَالَّذينَ هادوا وَالصّابِئونَ وَالنَّصارىٰ مَن آمَنَ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الآخِرِ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَلا خَوفٌ عَلَيهِم وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
blank: ʾinnalladhīn ʾāmanū w-lladhīn hādū w-ṣ-ṣābiʾūn w-n-naṣārā m ʾāman b-llāh w-l-yawmil-ʾākhir w-ʿamil ṣāliḥ f-lā khawf ʿalayhim w-lā hum yaḥzanūn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who have believed in Prophet Muhammad and those before Him who were Jews or Sabeans or Christians - those among them who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد أَخَذنا ميثاقَ بَني إِسرائيلَ وَأَرسَلنا إِلَيهِم رُسُلًا ۖ كُلَّما جاءَهُم رَسولٌ بِما لا تَهوىٰ أَنفُسُهُم فَريقًا كَذَّبوا وَفَريقًا يَقتُلونَ
blank: l-qad ʾakhadhnā mīthāq banī ʾisrāʾīl w-ʾarsalnā ʾilayhim rusul kullamā jāʾahum rasūl b-mā lā tahwā ʾanfusuhum farīq kadhdhabū w-farīq yaqtulūn
english_saheeh_international: We had already taken the covenant of the Children of Israel and had sent to them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a party of messengers they denied, and another party they killed

arabic_uthmani: وَحَسِبوا أَلّا تَكونَ فِتنَةٌ فَعَموا وَصَمّوا ثُمَّ تابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم ثُمَّ عَموا وَصَمّوا كَثيرٌ مِنهُم ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصيرٌ بِما يَعمَلونَ
blank: w-ḥasibū ʾallā takūn fitnat f-ʿamū w-ṣammū thumm tāb llāh ʿalayhim thumm ʿamū w-ṣammū kathīr minhum w-llāh baṣīr b-mā yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And they thought there would be no resulting punishment, so they became blind and deaf. Then Allah turned to them in forgiveness; then again many of them became blind and deaf. And Allah is Seeing of what they do

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد كَفَرَ الَّذينَ قالوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ المَسيحُ ابنُ مَريَمَ ۖ وَقالَ المَسيحُ يا بَني إِسرائيلَ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ رَبّي وَرَبَّكُم ۖ إِنَّهُ مَن يُشرِك بِاللَّهِ فَقَد حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِ الجَنَّةَ وَمَأواهُ النّارُ ۖ وَما لِلظّالِمينَ مِن أَنصارٍ
blank: l-qad kafaralladhīn qālū ʾinn llāh huwal-masīḥ bn maryam w-qālal-masīḥ yā-banī ʾisrāʾīl ʿbudū llāh rabbī w-rabbakum ʾinnahū m yushrik b-llāh f-qad ḥarram llāh ʿalayhil-jannat w-maʾwāh n-nār w-mā l-ẓ-ẓālimīn m ʾanṣār
english_saheeh_international: They have certainly disbelieved who say, "Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary" while the Messiah has said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord." Indeed, he who associates others with Allah - Allah has forbidden him Paradise, and his refuge is the Fire. And there are not for the wrongdoers any helpers

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد كَفَرَ الَّذينَ قالوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ ثالِثُ ثَلاثَةٍ ۘ وَما مِن إِلٰهٍ إِلّا إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۚ وَإِن لَم يَنتَهوا عَمّا يَقولونَ لَيَمَسَّنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِنهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
blank: l-qad kafaralladhīn qālū ʾinn llāh thālith thalāthat w-mā m ʾilāh ʾillā ʾilāh wāḥid w-ʾ lam yantahū ʿammā yaqūlūn l-yamassannalladhīn kafarū minhum ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: They have certainly disbelieved who say, "Allah is the third of three." And there is no god except one God. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict the disbelievers among them a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: أَفَلا يَتوبونَ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَيَستَغفِرونَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: ʾ-f-lā yatūbūn ʾilā llāh w-yastaghfirūnahū w-llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: So will they not repent to Allah and seek His forgiveness? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: مَا المَسيحُ ابنُ مَريَمَ إِلّا رَسولٌ قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِهِ الرُّسُلُ وَأُمُّهُ صِدّيقَةٌ ۖ كانا يَأكُلانِ الطَّعامَ ۗ انظُر كَيفَ نُبَيِّنُ لَهُمُ الآياتِ ثُمَّ انظُر أَنّىٰ يُؤفَكونَ
blank: māl-masīḥ bn maryam ʾillā rasūl qad khalat m qablih r-rusul w-ʾummuhū ṣiddīqat kānā yaʾkulān ṭ-ṭaʿām nẓur kayf nubayyin lahumul-ʾāyāt thumm nẓur ʾannā yuʾfakūn
english_saheeh_international: The Messiah, son of Mary, was not but a messenger; other messengers have passed on before him. And his mother was a supporter of truth. They both used to eat food. Look how We make clear to them the signs; then look how they are deluded

arabic_uthmani: قُل أَتَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَملِكُ لَكُم ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا ۚ وَاللَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
blank: qul ʾ-taʿbudūn m dūn llāh mā lā yamlik lakum ḍarr w-lā nafʿ w-llāh huw s-samīʿul-ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: Say, "Do you worship besides Allah that which holds for you no power of harm or benefit while it is Allah who is the Hearing, the Knowing

arabic_uthmani: قُل يا أَهلَ الكِتابِ لا تَغلوا في دينِكُم غَيرَ الحَقِّ وَلا تَتَّبِعوا أَهواءَ قَومٍ قَد ضَلّوا مِن قَبلُ وَأَضَلّوا كَثيرًا وَضَلّوا عَن سَواءِ السَّبيلِ
blank: qul yā-ʾahlal-kitāb lā taghlū fī dīnikum ghayral-ḥaqq w-lā tattabiʿū ʾahwāʾ qawm qad ḍallū m qabl w-ʾaḍallū kathīr w-ḍallū ʿ sawāʾ s-sabīl
english_saheeh_international: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do not exceed limits in your religion beyond the truth and do not follow the inclinations of a people who had gone astray before and misled many and have strayed from the soundness of the way

arabic_uthmani: لُعِنَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن بَني إِسرائيلَ عَلىٰ لِسانِ داوودَ وَعيسَى ابنِ مَريَمَ ۚ ذٰلِكَ بِما عَصَوا وَكانوا يَعتَدونَ
blank: luʿinalladhīn kafarū m banī ʾisrāʾīl ʿalā lisān dāwūd w-ʿīsā bn maryam dhālik b-mā ʿaṣaw w-kānū yaʿtadūn
english_saheeh_international: Cursed were those who disbelieved among the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and of Jesus, the son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed and habitually transgressed

arabic_uthmani: كانوا لا يَتَناهَونَ عَن مُنكَرٍ فَعَلوهُ ۚ لَبِئسَ ما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
blank: kānū lā yatanāhawn ʿam-munkar faʿalūh l-biʾs mā kānū yafʿalūn
english_saheeh_international: They used not to prevent one another from wrongdoing that they did. How wretched was that which they were doing

arabic_uthmani: تَرىٰ كَثيرًا مِنهُم يَتَوَلَّونَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا ۚ لَبِئسَ ما قَدَّمَت لَهُم أَنفُسُهُم أَن سَخِطَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم وَفِي العَذابِ هُم خالِدونَ
blank: tarā kathīram-minhum yatawallawnalladhīn kafarū l-biʾs mā qaddamat lahum ʾanfusuhum ʾ sakhiṭ llāh ʿalayhim w-fīl-ʿadhāb hum khālidūn
english_saheeh_international: You see many of them becoming allies of those who disbelieved. How wretched is that which they have put forth for themselves in that Allah has become angry with them, and in the punishment they will abide eternally

arabic_uthmani: وَلَو كانوا يُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالنَّبِيِّ وَما أُنزِلَ إِلَيهِ مَا اتَّخَذوهُم أَولِياءَ وَلٰكِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنهُم فاسِقونَ
blank: w-law kānū yuʾminūn b-llāh w-n-nabiyy w-mā ʾunzil ʾilayh mā ttakhadhūhum ʾawliyāʾ w-lākinn kathīram-minhum fāsiqūn
english_saheeh_international: And if they had believed in Allah and the Prophet and in what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies; but many of them are defiantly disobedient

arabic_uthmani: ۞ لَتَجِدَنَّ أَشَدَّ النّاسِ عَداوَةً لِلَّذينَ آمَنُوا اليَهودَ وَالَّذينَ أَشرَكوا ۖ وَلَتَجِدَنَّ أَقرَبَهُم مَوَدَّةً لِلَّذينَ آمَنُوا الَّذينَ قالوا إِنّا نَصارىٰ ۚ ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ مِنهُم قِسّيسينَ وَرُهبانًا وَأَنَّهُم لا يَستَكبِرونَ
blank: l-tajidann ʾashadd n-nās ʿadāwat l-lladhīn ʾāmanūl-yahūd w-lladhīn ʾashrakū w-l-tajidann ʾaqrabahum mawaddat l-lladhīn ʾāmanūlladhīn qālū ʾinnā naṣārā dhālik b-ʾann minhum qissīsīn w-ruhbān w-ʾannahum lā yastakbirūn
english_saheeh_international: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the believers to be the Jews and those who associate others with Allah; and you will find the nearest of them in affection to the believers those who say, "We are Christians." That is because among them are priests and monks and because they are not arrogant

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا سَمِعوا ما أُنزِلَ إِلَى الرَّسولِ تَرىٰ أَعيُنَهُم تَفيضُ مِنَ الدَّمعِ مِمّا عَرَفوا مِنَ الحَقِّ ۖ يَقولونَ رَبَّنا آمَنّا فَاكتُبنا مَعَ الشّاهِدينَ
blank: w-ʾidhā samiʿū mā ʾunzil ʾilā r-rasūl tarā ʾaʿyunahum tafīḍ min d-damʿ mimmā ʿarafū minal-ḥaqq yaqūlūn rabbanā ʾāmannā f-ktubnā maʿ sh-shāhidīn
english_saheeh_international: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the truth. They say, "Our Lord, we have believed, so register us among the witnesses

arabic_uthmani: وَما لَنا لا نُؤمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَما جاءَنا مِنَ الحَقِّ وَنَطمَعُ أَن يُدخِلَنا رَبُّنا مَعَ القَومِ الصّالِحينَ
blank: w-mā lanā lā nuʾmin b-llāh w-mā jāʾanā minal-ḥaqq w-naṭmaʿ ʾ yudkhilanā rabbunā maʿal-qawm ṣ-ṣāliḥīn
english_saheeh_international: And why should we not believe in Allah and what has come to us of the truth? And we aspire that our Lord will admit us to Paradise with the righteous people

arabic_uthmani: فَأَثابَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِما قالوا جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها ۚ وَذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ المُحسِنينَ
blank: f-ʾathābahum llāh b-mā qālū jannāt tajrī m taḥtihāl-ʾanhār khālidīn fīhā w-dhālik jazāʾul-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: So Allah rewarded them for what they said with gardens in Paradise beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of doers of good

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَحيمِ
blank: w-lladhīn kafarū w-kadhdhabū b-ʾāyātinā ʾulāʾik ʾaṣḥābul-jaḥīm
english_saheeh_international: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - they are the companions of Hellfire

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تُحَرِّموا طَيِّباتِ ما أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكُم وَلا تَعتَدوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُحِبُّ المُعتَدينَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū lā tuḥarrimū ṭ-ṭayyibātimā ʾaḥall llāh lakum w-lā taʿtadū ʾinn llāh lā yuḥibbul-muʿtadīn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allah has made lawful to you and do not transgress. Indeed, Allah does not like transgressors

arabic_uthmani: وَكُلوا مِمّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ حَلالًا طَيِّبًا ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ الَّذي أَنتُم بِهِ مُؤمِنونَ
blank: w-kulū mimmā razaqakum llāh ḥalāl ṭayyib w-ttaqū llāhalladhī ʾantum bihī muʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: And eat of what Allah has provided for you which is lawful and good. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers

arabic_uthmani: لا يُؤاخِذُكُمُ اللَّهُ بِاللَّغوِ في أَيمانِكُم وَلٰكِن يُؤاخِذُكُم بِما عَقَّدتُمُ الأَيمانَ ۖ فَكَفّارَتُهُ إِطعامُ عَشَرَةِ مَساكينَ مِن أَوسَطِ ما تُطعِمونَ أَهليكُم أَو كِسوَتُهُم أَو تَحريرُ رَقَبَةٍ ۖ فَمَن لَم يَجِد فَصِيامُ ثَلاثَةِ أَيّامٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ كَفّارَةُ أَيمانِكُم إِذا حَلَفتُم ۚ وَاحفَظوا أَيمانَكُم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُم آياتِهِ لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
blank: lā yuʾākhidhukum llāh b-l-laghw fī ʾaymānikum w-lāk yuʾākhidhukum b-mā ʿaqqadtumul-ʾaymān f-kaffāratuhū ʾiṭʿām ʿasharat masākīn m ʾawsaṭ mā tuṭʿimūn ʾahlīkum ʾaw kiswatuhum ʾaw taḥrīr raqabat f-m lam yajid f-ṣiyām thalāthat ʾayyām dhālik kaffārat ʾaymānikum ʾidhā ḥalaftum w-ḥfaẓū ʾaymānakum k-dhālik yubayyin llāh lakum ʾāyātihī laʿallakum tashkurūn
english_saheeh_international: Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for breaking what you intended of oaths. So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people from the average of that which you feed your own families or clothing them or the freeing of a slave. But whoever cannot find or afford it - then a fast of three days is required. That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn. But guard your oaths. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be grateful

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِنَّمَا الخَمرُ وَالمَيسِرُ وَالأَنصابُ وَالأَزلامُ رِجسٌ مِن عَمَلِ الشَّيطانِ فَاجتَنِبوهُ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
