blank: f-ʾammālladhīn shaqū f-fī n-nār lahum fīhā zafīr w-shahīq
english_saheeh_international: As for those who were destined to be wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is violent exhaling and inhaling

arabic_uthmani: خالِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ فَعّالٌ لِما يُريدُ
blank: khālidīn fīhā mā dāmat s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ ʾillā mā shāʾ rabbuk ʾinn rabbak faʿʿāl l-mā yurīd
english_saheeh_international: They will be abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ سُعِدوا فَفِي الجَنَّةِ خالِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ ۖ عَطاءً غَيرَ مَجذوذٍ
blank: w-ʾammālladhīn suʿidū f-fīl-jannat khālidīn fīhā mā dāmat s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ ʾillā mā shāʾ rabbuk ʿaṭāʾ ghayr majdhūdh
english_saheeh_international: And as for those who were destined to be prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted

arabic_uthmani: فَلا تَكُ في مِريَةٍ مِمّا يَعبُدُ هٰؤُلاءِ ۚ ما يَعبُدونَ إِلّا كَما يَعبُدُ آباؤُهُم مِن قَبلُ ۚ وَإِنّا لَمُوَفّوهُم نَصيبَهُم غَيرَ مَنقوصٍ
blank: f-lā tak fī miryat mimmā yaʿbud hāʾulāʾ mā yaʿbudūn ʾillā k-mā yaʿbud ʾābāʾuhum m qabl w-ʾinnā l-muwaffūhum naṣībahum ghayr manqūṣ
english_saheeh_international: So do not be in doubt, O Muhammad, as to what these polytheists are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ فَاختُلِفَ فيهِ ۚ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّهُم لَفي شَكٍّ مِنهُ مُريبٍ
blank: w-l-qad ʾātaynā mūsāl-kitāb f-khtulif fīh w-law-lā kalimat sabaqat m rabbik l-quḍiy baynahum w-ʾinnahum l-fī shakk minh murīb
english_saheeh_international: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt

arabic_uthmani: وَإِنَّ كُلًّا لَمّا لَيُوَفِّيَنَّهُم رَبُّكَ أَعمالَهُم ۚ إِنَّهُ بِما يَعمَلونَ خَبيرٌ
blank: w-ʾinn kull lammā l-yuwaffiyannahum rabbuk ʾaʿmālahum ʾinnahū b-mā yaʿmalūn khabīr
english_saheeh_international: And indeed, each of the believers and disbelievers - your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Acquainted with what they do

arabic_uthmani: فَاستَقِم كَما أُمِرتَ وَمَن تابَ مَعَكَ وَلا تَطغَوا ۚ إِنَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
blank: f-staqim k-mā ʾumirt w-m tāb maʿak w-lā taṭghaw ʾinnahū b-mā taʿmalūn baṣīr
english_saheeh_international: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, you and those who have turned back with you to Allah, and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do

arabic_uthmani: وَلا تَركَنوا إِلَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا فَتَمَسَّكُمُ النّارُ وَما لَكُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ ثُمَّ لا تُنصَرونَ
blank: w-lā tarkanū ʾilālladhīn ẓalamū f-tamassakum n-nār w-mā lakum m dūn llāh m ʾawliyāʾ thumm lā tunṣarūn
english_saheeh_international: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than Allah any protectors; then you would not be helped

arabic_uthmani: وَأَقِمِ الصَّلاةَ طَرَفَيِ النَّهارِ وَزُلَفًا مِنَ اللَّيلِ ۚ إِنَّ الحَسَناتِ يُذهِبنَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ ذِكرىٰ لِلذّاكِرينَ
blank: w-ʾaqim ṣ-ṣalāt ṭarafay n-nahār w-zulafam-minal-layl ʾinnal-ḥasanāt yudhhibn s-sayyiʾāt dhālik dhikrā l-dh-dhākirīn
english_saheeh_international: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember

arabic_uthmani: وَاصبِر فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
blank: w-ṣbir f-ʾinn llāh lā yuḍīʿ ʾajral-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good

arabic_uthmani: فَلَولا كانَ مِنَ القُرونِ مِن قَبلِكُم أُولو بَقِيَّةٍ يَنهَونَ عَنِ الفَسادِ فِي الأَرضِ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمَّن أَنجَينا مِنهُم ۗ وَاتَّبَعَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ما أُترِفوا فيهِ وَكانوا مُجرِمينَ
blank: f-law-lā kān minal-qurūn m qablikum ʾulū baqiyyat yanhawn ʿanil-fasād fīl-ʾarḍ ʾillā qalīlam-mimm ʾanjaynā minhum w-ttabaʿalladhīn ẓalamū mā ʾutrifū fīh w-kānū mujrimīn
english_saheeh_international: So why were there not among the generations before you those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth - except a few of those We saved from among them? But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein, and they were criminals

arabic_uthmani: وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ لِيُهلِكَ القُرىٰ بِظُلمٍ وَأَهلُها مُصلِحونَ
blank: w-mā kān rabbuk l-yuhlikal-qurā b-ẓulm w-ʾahluhā muṣliḥūn
english_saheeh_international: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly while their people were reformers

arabic_uthmani: وَلَو شاءَ رَبُّكَ لَجَعَلَ النّاسَ أُمَّةً واحِدَةً ۖ وَلا يَزالونَ مُختَلِفينَ
blank: w-law shāʾ rabbuk l-jaʿal n-nās ʾummat wāḥidat w-lā yazālūn mukhtalifīn
english_saheeh_international: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ

arabic_uthmani: إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ رَبُّكَ ۚ وَلِذٰلِكَ خَلَقَهُم ۗ وَتَمَّت كَلِمَةُ رَبِّكَ لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
blank: ʾillā m raḥim rabbuk w-l-dhālik khalaqahum w-tammat kalimat rabbik l-ʾamlaʾann jahannam minal-jinnat w-n-nās ʾajmaʿīn
english_saheeh_international: Except whom your Lord has given mercy, and for that He created them. But the word of your Lord is to be fulfilled that, "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men all together

arabic_uthmani: وَكُلًّا نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنباءِ الرُّسُلِ ما نُثَبِّتُ بِهِ فُؤادَكَ ۚ وَجاءَكَ في هٰذِهِ الحَقُّ وَمَوعِظَةٌ وَذِكرىٰ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
blank: w-kull naquṣṣ ʿalayk m ʾanbāʾ r-rusul mā nuthabbit bihī fuʾādak w-jāʾak fī hādhihil-ḥaqq w-mawʿiẓat w-dhikrā l-l-muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: And each story We relate to you from the news of the messengers is that by which We make firm your heart. And there has come to you, in this, the truth and an instruction and a reminder for the believers

arabic_uthmani: وَقُل لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّا عامِلونَ
blank: w-qul l-lladhīn lā yuʾminūn ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnā ʿāmilūn
english_saheeh_international: And say to those who do not believe, "Work according to your position; indeed, we are working

arabic_uthmani: وَانتَظِروا إِنّا مُنتَظِرونَ
blank: w-ntaẓirū ʾinnā muntaẓirūn
english_saheeh_international: And wait, indeed, we are waiting

arabic_uthmani: وَلِلَّهِ غَيبُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ يُرجَعُ الأَمرُ كُلُّهُ فَاعبُدهُ وَتَوَكَّل عَلَيهِ ۚ وَما رَبُّكَ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
blank: w-l-llāh ghayb s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-ʾilayh yurjaʿul-ʾamr kulluhū f-ʿbudh w-tawakkal ʿalayh w-mā rabbuk b-ghāfil ʿammā taʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And to Allah belong the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it, so worship Him and rely upon Him. And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do

arabic_uthmani: الر ۚ تِلكَ آياتُ الكِتابِ المُبينِ
blank: -l-r (ʾalif lām rā) tilk ʾāyātul-kitābil-mubīn
english_saheeh_international: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book

arabic_uthmani: إِنّا أَنزَلناهُ قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
blank: ʾinnā ʾanzalnāh qurʾān ʿarabiyy laʿallakum taʿqilūn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand

arabic_uthmani: نَحنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ أَحسَنَ القَصَصِ بِما أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ هٰذَا القُرآنَ وَإِن كُنتَ مِن قَبلِهِ لَمِنَ الغافِلينَ
blank: naḥn naquṣṣ ʿalayk ʾaḥsanal-qaṣaṣ b-mā ʾawḥaynā ʾilayk hādhāl-qurʾān w-ʾ kunt m qablihī l-minal-ghāfilīn
english_saheeh_international: We relate to you, O Muhammad, the best of stories in what We have revealed to you of this Qur'an although you were, before it, among the unaware

arabic_uthmani: إِذ قالَ يوسُفُ لِأَبيهِ يا أَبَتِ إِنّي رَأَيتُ أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوكَبًا وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ رَأَيتُهُم لي ساجِدينَ
blank: ʾidh qāl yūsuf l-ʾabīh yā-ʾabat ʾinnī raʾayt ʾaḥad ʿashar kawkab w-sh-shams w-l-qamar raʾaytuhum lī sājidīn
english_saheeh_international: Of these stories mention when Joseph said to his father, "O my father, indeed I have seen in a dream eleven stars and the sun and the moon; I saw them prostrating to me

arabic_uthmani: قالَ يا بُنَيَّ لا تَقصُص رُؤياكَ عَلىٰ إِخوَتِكَ فَيَكيدوا لَكَ كَيدًا ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ لِلإِنسانِ عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
blank: qāl yā-bunayy lā taqṣuṣ ruʾyāk ʿalā ʾikhwatik f-yakīdū lak kayd ʾinn sh-shayṭān l-l-ʾinsān ʿaduww mubīn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers or they will contrive against you a plan. Indeed Satan, to man, is a manifest enemy

arabic_uthmani: وَكَذٰلِكَ يَجتَبيكَ رَبُّكَ وَيُعَلِّمُكَ مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ وَيُتِمُّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكَ وَعَلىٰ آلِ يَعقوبَ كَما أَتَمَّها عَلىٰ أَبَوَيكَ مِن قَبلُ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسحاقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
blank: w-k-dhālik yajtabīk rabbuk w-yuʿallimuk m taʾwīlil-ʾaḥādīth w-yutimm niʿmatahū ʿalayk w-ʿalā ʾāl yaʿqūb k-mā ʾatammahā ʿalā ʾabawayk m qabl ʾibrāhīm w-ʾisḥāq ʾinn rabbak ʿalīm ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of narratives and complete His favor upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He completed it upon your fathers before, Abraham and Isaac. Indeed, your Lord is Knowing and Wise

arabic_uthmani: ۞ لَقَد كانَ في يوسُفَ وَإِخوَتِهِ آياتٌ لِلسّائِلينَ
blank: l-qad kān fī yūsuf w-ʾikhwatihī ʾāyāt l-s-sāʾilīn
english_saheeh_international: Certainly were there in Joseph and his brothers signs for those who ask

arabic_uthmani: إِذ قالوا لَيوسُفُ وَأَخوهُ أَحَبُّ إِلىٰ أَبينا مِنّا وَنَحنُ عُصبَةٌ إِنَّ أَبانا لَفي ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
blank: ʾidh qālū l-yūsuf w-ʾakhūh ʾaḥabb ʾilā ʾabīnā minnā w-naḥn ʿuṣbat ʾinn ʾabānā l-fī ḍalāl mubīn-
english_saheeh_international: When they said, "Joseph and his brother are more beloved to our father than we, while we are a clan. Indeed, our father is in clear error

arabic_uthmani: اقتُلوا يوسُفَ أَوِ اطرَحوهُ أَرضًا يَخلُ لَكُم وَجهُ أَبيكُم وَتَكونوا مِن بَعدِهِ قَومًا صالِحينَ
blank: uqtulū yūsuf ʾaw ṭraḥūh ʾarḍ yakhl lakum wajh ʾabīkum w-takūnū m baʿdihī qawm ṣāliḥīn
english_saheeh_international: Kill Joseph or cast him out to another land; the countenance of your father will then be only for you, and you will be after that a righteous people

arabic_uthmani: قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم لا تَقتُلوا يوسُفَ وَأَلقوهُ في غَيابَتِ الجُبِّ يَلتَقِطهُ بَعضُ السَّيّارَةِ إِن كُنتُم فاعِلينَ
blank: qāl qāʾil minhum lā taqtulū yūsuf w-ʾalqūh fī ghayābatil-jubb yaltaqiṭh baʿḍ s-sayyārat ʾ kuntum fāʿilīn
english_saheeh_international: Said a speaker among them, "Do not kill Joseph but throw him into the bottom of the well; some travelers will pick him up - if you would do something

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا أَبانا ما لَكَ لا تَأمَنّا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ وَإِنّا لَهُ لَناصِحونَ
blank: qālū yā-ʾabānā mā lak lā taʾmannā ʿalā yūsuf w-ʾinnā lahū l-nāṣiḥūn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O our father, why do you not entrust us with Joseph while indeed, we are to him sincere counselors

arabic_uthmani: أَرسِلهُ مَعَنا غَدًا يَرتَع وَيَلعَب وَإِنّا لَهُ لَحافِظونَ
blank: ʾarsilh maʿanā ghad yartaʿ w-yalʿab w-ʾinnā lahū l-ḥāfiẓūn
english_saheeh_international: Send him with us tomorrow that he may eat well and play. And indeed, we will be his guardians

arabic_uthmani: قالَ إِنّي لَيَحزُنُني أَن تَذهَبوا بِهِ وَأَخافُ أَن يَأكُلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَأَنتُم عَنهُ غافِلونَ
blank: qāl ʾinnī l-yaḥzununī ʾ tadhhabū bihī w-ʾakhāf ʾ yaʾkulah dh-dhiʾb w-ʾantum ʿanh ghāfilūn
english_saheeh_international: Jacob said, "Indeed, it saddens me that you should take him, and I fear that a wolf would eat him while you are of him unaware

arabic_uthmani: قالوا لَئِن أَكَلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَنَحنُ عُصبَةٌ إِنّا إِذًا لَخاسِرونَ
blank: qālū l-ʾ ʾakalah dh-dhiʾb w-naḥn ʿuṣbat ʾinnā ʾidh l-khāsirūn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "If a wolf should eat him while we are a strong clan, indeed, we would then be losers

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا ذَهَبوا بِهِ وَأَجمَعوا أَن يَجعَلوهُ في غَيابَتِ الجُبِّ ۚ وَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم بِأَمرِهِم هٰذا وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
blank: f-lammā dhahabū bihī w-ʾajmaʿū ʾ yajʿalūh fī ghayābatil-jubb w-ʾawḥaynā ʾilayh l-tunabbiʾannahum b-ʾamrihim hādhā w-hum lā yashʿurūn
english_saheeh_international: So when they took him out and agreed to put him into the bottom of the well... But We inspired to him, "You will surely inform them someday about this affair of theirs while they do not perceive your identity

arabic_uthmani: وَجاءوا أَباهُم عِشاءً يَبكونَ
blank: w-jāʾū ʾabāhum ʿishāʾ yabkūn
english_saheeh_international: And they came to their father at night, weeping

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا أَبانا إِنّا ذَهَبنا نَستَبِقُ وَتَرَكنا يوسُفَ عِندَ مَتاعِنا فَأَكَلَهُ الذِّئبُ ۖ وَما أَنتَ بِمُؤمِنٍ لَنا وَلَو كُنّا صادِقينَ
blank: qālū yā-ʾabānā ʾinnā dhahabnā nastabiq w-taraknā yūsuf ʿind matāʿinā f-ʾakalah dh-dhiʾb w-mā ʾant b-muʾmin lanā w-law kunnā ṣādiqīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O our father, indeed we went racing each other and left Joseph with our possessions, and a wolf ate him. But you would not believe us, even if we were truthful

arabic_uthmani: وَجاءوا عَلىٰ قَميصِهِ بِدَمٍ كَذِبٍ ۚ قالَ بَل سَوَّلَت لَكُم أَنفُسُكُم أَمرًا ۖ فَصَبرٌ جَميلٌ ۖ وَاللَّهُ المُستَعانُ عَلىٰ ما تَصِفونَ
blank: w-jāʾū ʿalā qamīṣihī b-dam kadhib qāl bal sawwalat lakum ʾanfusukum ʾamr f-ṣabr jamīl w-llāhul-mustaʿān ʿalā mā taṣifūn
english_saheeh_international: And they brought upon his shirt false blood. Jacob said, "Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. And Allah is the one sought for help against that which you describe

arabic_uthmani: وَجاءَت سَيّارَةٌ فَأَرسَلوا وارِدَهُم فَأَدلىٰ دَلوَهُ ۖ قالَ يا بُشرىٰ هٰذا غُلامٌ ۚ وَأَسَرّوهُ بِضاعَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِما يَعمَلونَ
blank: w-jāʾat sayyārat f-ʾarsalū wāridahum f-ʾadlā dalwahū qāl yā-bushrā hādhā ghulām w-ʾasarrūh biḍāʿat w-llāh ʿalīm b-mā yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And there came a company of travelers; then they sent their water drawer, and he let down his bucket. He said, "Good news! Here is a boy." And they concealed him, taking him as merchandise; and Allah was knowing of what they did

arabic_uthmani: وَشَرَوهُ بِثَمَنٍ بَخسٍ دَراهِمَ مَعدودَةٍ وَكانوا فيهِ مِنَ الزّاهِدينَ
blank: w-sharawh b-thaman bakhs darāhim maʿdūdat w-kānū fīh min z-zāhidīn
english_saheeh_international: And they sold him for a reduced price - a few dirhams - and they were, concerning him, of those content with little

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ الَّذِي اشتَراهُ مِن مِصرَ لِامرَأَتِهِ أَكرِمي مَثواهُ عَسىٰ أَن يَنفَعَنا أَو نَتَّخِذَهُ وَلَدًا ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ مَكَّنّا لِيوسُفَ فِي الأَرضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُ مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غالِبٌ عَلىٰ أَمرِهِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
blank: w-qālalladhī shtarāh m miṣr l-mraʾatihī ʾakrimī mathwāh ʿasā ʾ yanfaʿanā ʾaw nattakhidhahū walad w-k-dhālik makkannā l-yūsuf fīl-ʾarḍ w-l-nuʿallimahū m taʾwīlil-ʾaḥādīth w-llāh ghālib ʿalā ʾamrihī w-lākinn ʾakthar n-nās lā yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And the one from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, "Make his residence comfortable. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a son." And thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most of the people do not know

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ آتَيناهُ حُكمًا وَعِلمًا ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُحسِنينَ
blank: w-lammā balagh ʾashuddahū ʾātaynāh ḥukm w-ʿilm w-k-dhālik najzīl-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: And when Joseph reached maturity, We gave him judgment and knowledge. And thus We reward the doers of good

arabic_uthmani: وَراوَدَتهُ الَّتي هُوَ في بَيتِها عَن نَفسِهِ وَغَلَّقَتِ الأَبوابَ وَقالَت هَيتَ لَكَ ۚ قالَ مَعاذَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ رَبّي أَحسَنَ مَثوايَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ الظّالِمونَ
blank: w-rāwadath llatī huw fī baytihā ʿ nafsihī w-ghallaqatil-ʾabwāb w-qālat hayt lak qāl maʿādh llāh ʾinnahū rabbī ʾaḥsan mathwāy ʾinnahū lā yufliḥ ẓ-ẓālimūn
english_saheeh_international: And she, in whose house he was, sought to seduce him. She closed the doors and said, "Come, you." He said, "I seek the refuge of Allah. Indeed, he is my master, who has made good my residence. Indeed, wrongdoers will not succeed

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد هَمَّت بِهِ ۖ وَهَمَّ بِها لَولا أَن رَأىٰ بُرهانَ رَبِّهِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ لِنَصرِفَ عَنهُ السّوءَ وَالفَحشاءَ ۚ إِنَّهُ مِن عِبادِنَا المُخلَصينَ
blank: w-l-qad hammat bihī w-hamm bihā law-lā ʾ raʾā burhān rabbihī k-dhālik l-naṣrif ʿanh s-sūʾ w-l-faḥshāʾ ʾinnahū m ʿibādināl-mukhlaṣīn
english_saheeh_international: And she certainly determined to seduce him, and he would have inclined to her had he not seen the proof of his Lord. And thus it was that We should avert from him evil and immorality. Indeed, he was of Our chosen servants

arabic_uthmani: وَاستَبَقَا البابَ وَقَدَّت قَميصَهُ مِن دُبُرٍ وَأَلفَيا سَيِّدَها لَدَى البابِ ۚ قالَت ما جَزاءُ مَن أَرادَ بِأَهلِكَ سوءًا إِلّا أَن يُسجَنَ أَو عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
blank: w-stabaqāl-bāb w-qaddat qamīṣahū m dubur w-ʾalfayā s-sayyidahā ladāl-bāb qālat mā jazāʾ m ʾarād b-ʾahlik sūʾ ʾillā ʾ yusjan ʾaw ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: And they both raced to the door, and she tore his shirt from the back, and they found her husband at the door. She said, "What is the recompense of one who intended evil for your wife but that he be imprisoned or a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: قالَ هِيَ راوَدَتني عَن نَفسي ۚ وَشَهِدَ شاهِدٌ مِن أَهلِها إِن كانَ قَميصُهُ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٍ فَصَدَقَت وَهُوَ مِنَ الكاذِبينَ
blank: qāl hiy rāwadatnī ʿ nafsī w-shahid shāhid m ʾahlihā ʾ kān qamīṣuhū qudd m qubul f-ṣadaqat w-huw minal-kādhibīn
english_saheeh_international: Joseph said, "It was she who sought to seduce me." And a witness from her family testified. "If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth, and he is of the liars

arabic_uthmani: وَإِن كانَ قَميصُهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ فَكَذَبَت وَهُوَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
blank: w-ʾ kān qamīṣuhū qudd m dubur f-kadhabat w-huw min ṣ-ṣādiqīn
english_saheeh_international: But if his shirt is torn from the back, then she has lied, and he is of the truthful

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا رَأىٰ قَميصَهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ قالَ إِنَّهُ مِن كَيدِكُنَّ ۖ إِنَّ كَيدَكُنَّ عَظيمٌ
blank: f-lammā raʾā qamīṣahū qudd m dubur qāl ʾinnahū m kaydikunn ʾinn kaydakunn ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: So when her husband saw his shirt torn from the back, he said, "Indeed, it is of the women's plan. Indeed, your plan is great

arabic_uthmani: يوسُفُ أَعرِض عَن هٰذا ۚ وَاستَغفِري لِذَنبِكِ ۖ إِنَّكِ كُنتِ مِنَ الخاطِئينَ
blank: yūsuf ʾaʿriḍ ʿ hādhā w-staghfirī l-dhanbik ʾinnak kunt minal-khāṭiʾīn
english_saheeh_international: Joseph, ignore this. And, my wife, ask forgiveness for your sin. Indeed, you were of the sinful

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَقالَ نِسوَةٌ فِي المَدينَةِ امرَأَتُ العَزيزِ تُراوِدُ فَتاها عَن نَفسِهِ ۖ قَد شَغَفَها حُبًّا ۖ إِنّا لَنَراها في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
blank: w-qāl niswat fīl-madīnat mraʾatul-ʿazīz turāwid fatāhā ʿ nafsihī qad shaghafahā ḥubb ʾinnā l-narāhā fī ḍalāl mubīn
english_saheeh_international: And women in the city said, "The wife of al-'Azeez is seeking to seduce her slave boy; he has impassioned her with love. Indeed, we see her to be in clear error

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا سَمِعَت بِمَكرِهِنَّ أَرسَلَت إِلَيهِنَّ وَأَعتَدَت لَهُنَّ مُتَّكَأً وَآتَت كُلَّ واحِدَةٍ مِنهُنَّ سِكّينًا وَقالَتِ اخرُج عَلَيهِنَّ ۖ فَلَمّا رَأَينَهُ أَكبَرنَهُ وَقَطَّعنَ أَيدِيَهُنَّ وَقُلنَ حاشَ لِلَّهِ ما هٰذا بَشَرًا إِن هٰذا إِلّا مَلَكٌ كَريمٌ
blank: f-lammā samiʿat b-makrihinn ʾarsalat ʾilayhinn w-ʾaʿtadat lahunn muttakaʾ w-ʾātat kull wāḥidat minhunn sikkīn w-qālat khruj ʿalayhinn f-lammā raʾaynahū ʾakbarnahū w-qaṭṭaʿn ʾaydiyahunn w-quln ḥāsh l-llāh mā hādhā bashar ʾ hādhā ʾillā malak karīm
english_saheeh_international: So when she heard of their scheming, she sent for them and prepared for them a banquet and gave each one of them a knife and said to Joseph, "Come out before them." And when they saw him, they greatly admired him and cut their hands and said, "Perfect is Allah! This is not a man; this is none but a noble angel

arabic_uthmani: قالَت فَذٰلِكُنَّ الَّذي لُمتُنَّني فيهِ ۖ وَلَقَد راوَدتُهُ عَن نَفسِهِ فَاستَعصَمَ ۖ وَلَئِن لَم يَفعَل ما آمُرُهُ لَيُسجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكونًا مِنَ الصّاغِرينَ
blank: qālat f-dhālikunnalladhī lumtunnanī fīh w-l-qad rāwadtuhū ʿ nafsihī f-staʿṣam w-laʾil-lam yafʿal mā ʾāmuruhū l-yusjanann w-l-yakūnam-min ṣ-ṣāghirīn
english_saheeh_international: She said, "That is the one about whom you blamed me. And I certainly sought to seduce him, but he firmly refused; and if he will not do what I order him, he will surely be imprisoned and will be of those debased

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَبِّ السِّجنُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمّا يَدعونَني إِلَيهِ ۖ وَإِلّا تَصرِف عَنّي كَيدَهُنَّ أَصبُ إِلَيهِنَّ وَأَكُن مِنَ الجاهِلينَ
blank: qāl rabb s-sijn ʾaḥabb ʾilayy mimmā yadʿūnanī ʾilayh w-ʾillā taṣrif ʿannī kaydahunn ʾaṣb ʾilayhinn w-ʾak minal-jāhilīn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "My Lord, prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me. And if You do not avert from me their plan, I might incline toward them and thus be of the ignorant

arabic_uthmani: فَاستَجابَ لَهُ رَبُّهُ فَصَرَفَ عَنهُ كَيدَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
blank: f-stajāb lahū rabbuhū f-ṣaraf ʿanh kaydahunn ʾinnahū huw s-samīʿul-ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: So his Lord responded to him and averted from him their plan. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ بَدا لَهُم مِن بَعدِ ما رَأَوُا الآياتِ لَيَسجُنُنَّهُ حَتّىٰ حينٍ
blank: thumm badā lahum m baʿd mā raʾawul-ʾāyāt l-yasjununnahū ḥattā ḥīn
english_saheeh_international: Then it appeared to them after they had seen the signs that al-'Azeez should surely imprison him for a time

arabic_uthmani: وَدَخَلَ مَعَهُ السِّجنَ فَتَيانِ ۖ قالَ أَحَدُهُما إِنّي أَراني أَعصِرُ خَمرًا ۖ وَقالَ الآخَرُ إِنّي أَراني أَحمِلُ فَوقَ رَأسي خُبزًا تَأكُلُ الطَّيرُ مِنهُ ۖ نَبِّئنا بِتَأويلِهِ ۖ إِنّا نَراكَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
blank: w-dakhal maʿah s-sijn fatayān qāl ʾaḥaduhumā ʾinnī ʾarānī ʾaʿṣir khamr w-qālal-ʾākhar ʾinnī ʾarānī ʾaḥmil fawq raʾsī khubz taʾkul ṭ-ṭayr minh nabbiʾnā b-taʾwīlihī ʾinnā narāk minal-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: And there entered the prison with him two young men. One of them said, "Indeed, I have seen myself in a dream pressing wine." The other said, "Indeed, I have seen myself carrying upon my head some bread, from which the birds were eating. Inform us of its interpretation; indeed, we see you to be of those who do good

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لا يَأتيكُما طَعامٌ تُرزَقانِهِ إِلّا نَبَّأتُكُما بِتَأويلِهِ قَبلَ أَن يَأتِيَكُما ۚ ذٰلِكُما مِمّا عَلَّمَني رَبّي ۚ إِنّي تَرَكتُ مِلَّةَ قَومٍ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم كافِرونَ
blank: qāl lā yaʾtīkumā ṭaʿām turzaqānihī ʾillā nabbaʾtukumā b-taʾwīlihī qabl ʾ yaʾtiyakumā dhālikumā mimmā ʿallamanī rabbī ʾinnī tarakt millat qawm lā yuʾminūn b-llāh w-hum b-l-ʾākhirat hum kāfirūn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "You will not receive food that is provided to you except that I will inform you of its interpretation before it comes to you. That is from what my Lord has taught me. Indeed, I have left the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah, and they, in the Hereafter, are disbelievers

arabic_uthmani: وَاتَّبَعتُ مِلَّةَ آبائي إِبراهيمَ وَإِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ ۚ ما كانَ لَنا أَن نُشرِكَ بِاللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ مِن فَضلِ اللَّهِ عَلَينا وَعَلَى النّاسِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَشكُرونَ
blank: w-ttabaʿt millat ʾābāʾī ʾibrāhīm w-ʾisḥāq w-yaʿqūb mā kān lanā ʾ nushrik b-llāh m shayʾ dhālik m faḍl llāh ʿalaynā w-ʿalā n-nās w-lākinn ʾakthar n-nās lā yashkurūn
english_saheeh_international: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. And it was not for us to associate anything with Allah. That is from the favor of Allah upon us and upon the people, but most of the people are not grateful

arabic_uthmani: يا صاحِبَيِ السِّجنِ أَأَربابٌ مُتَفَرِّقونَ خَيرٌ أَمِ اللَّهُ الواحِدُ القَهّارُ
blank: yā-ṣāḥibay s-sijn ʾ-ʾarbāb mutafarriqūn khayr ʾam llāhul-wāḥidul-qahhār
english_saheeh_international: O my two companions of prison, are separate lords better or Allah, the One, the Prevailing

arabic_uthmani: ما تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِهِ إِلّا أَسماءً سَمَّيتُموها أَنتُم وَآباؤُكُم ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بِها مِن سُلطانٍ ۚ إِنِ الحُكمُ إِلّا لِلَّهِ ۚ أَمَرَ أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلّا إِيّاهُ ۚ ذٰلِكَ الدّينُ القَيِّمُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
blank: mā taʿbudūn m dūnihī ʾillā ʾasmāʾ sammaytumūhā ʾantum w-ʾābāʾukum mā ʾanzal llāh bihā m sulṭān ʾinil-ḥukm ʾillā l-llāh ʾamar ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā ʾiyyāh dhālik d-dīnul-qayyim w-lākinn ʾakthar n-nās lā yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: You worship not besides Him except mere names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority. Legislation is not but for Allah. He has commanded that you worship not except Him. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know

arabic_uthmani: يا صاحِبَيِ السِّجنِ أَمّا أَحَدُكُما فَيَسقي رَبَّهُ خَمرًا ۖ وَأَمَّا الآخَرُ فَيُصلَبُ فَتَأكُلُ الطَّيرُ مِن رَأسِهِ ۚ قُضِيَ الأَمرُ الَّذي فيهِ تَستَفتِيانِ
blank: yā-ṣāḥibay s-sijn ʾammā ʾaḥadukumā f-yasqī rabbahū khamr w-ʾammāl-ʾākhar f-yuṣlab f-taʾkul ṭ-ṭayr m raʾsihī quḍiyal-ʾamrulladhī fīh tastaftiyān
english_saheeh_international: O two companions of prison, as for one of you, he will give drink to his master of wine; but as for the other, he will be crucified, and the birds will eat from his head. The matter has been decreed about which you both inquire

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ لِلَّذي ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ناجٍ مِنهُمَا اذكُرني عِندَ رَبِّكَ فَأَنساهُ الشَّيطانُ ذِكرَ رَبِّهِ فَلَبِثَ فِي السِّجنِ بِضعَ سِنينَ
blank: w-qāl l-lladhī ẓann ʾannahū nāj minhumā dhkurnī ʿind rabbik f-ʾansāh sh-shayṭān dhikr rabbihī f-labith fī s-sijn biḍʿ sinīn
english_saheeh_international: And he said to the one whom he knew would go free, "Mention me before your master." But Satan made him forget the mention to his master, and Joseph remained in prison several years

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ المَلِكُ إِنّي أَرىٰ سَبعَ بَقَراتٍ سِمانٍ يَأكُلُهُنَّ سَبعٌ عِجافٌ وَسَبعَ سُنبُلاتٍ خُضرٍ وَأُخَرَ يابِساتٍ ۖ يا أَيُّهَا المَلَأُ أَفتوني في رُؤيايَ إِن كُنتُم لِلرُّؤيا تَعبُرونَ
blank: w-qālal-malik ʾinnī ʾarā sabʿ baqarāt simān yaʾkuluhunn sabʿ ʿijāf w-sabʿ sunbulāt khuḍr w-ʾukhar yābisāt yā-ʾayyuhāl-malaʾ ʾaftūnī fī ruʾyāy ʾ kuntum l-r-ruʾyā taʿburūn
english_saheeh_international: And subsequently the king said, "Indeed, I have seen in a dream seven fat cows being eaten by seven that were lean, and seven green spikes of grain and others that were dry. O eminent ones, explain to me my vision, if you should interpret visions

arabic_uthmani: قالوا أَضغاثُ أَحلامٍ ۖ وَما نَحنُ بِتَأويلِ الأَحلامِ بِعالِمينَ
blank: qālū ʾaḍghāth ʾaḥlām w-mā naḥn b-taʾwīlil-ʾaḥlām b-ʿālimīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "It is but a mixture of false dreams, and we are not learned in the interpretation of dreams

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ الَّذي نَجا مِنهُما وَادَّكَرَ بَعدَ أُمَّةٍ أَنا أُنَبِّئُكُم بِتَأويلِهِ فَأَرسِلونِ
blank: w-qālalladhī najā minhumā w-ddakar baʿd ʾummat ʾan ʾunabbiʾukum b-taʾwīlihī f-ʾarsilūn
english_saheeh_international: But the one who was freed and remembered after a time said, "I will inform you of its interpretation, so send me forth

arabic_uthmani: يوسُفُ أَيُّهَا الصِّدّيقُ أَفتِنا في سَبعِ بَقَراتٍ سِمانٍ يَأكُلُهُنَّ سَبعٌ عِجافٌ وَسَبعِ سُنبُلاتٍ خُضرٍ وَأُخَرَ يابِساتٍ لَعَلّي أَرجِعُ إِلَى النّاسِ لَعَلَّهُم يَعلَمونَ
blank: yūsuf ʾayyuhā ṣ-ṣiddīq ʾaftinā fī sabʿ baqarāt simān yaʾkuluhunn sabʿ ʿijāf w-sabʿ sunbulāt khuḍr w-ʾukhar yābisāt laʿallī ʾarjiʿ ʾilā n-nās laʿallahum yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Joseph, O man of truth, explain to us about seven fat cows eaten by seven that were lean, and seven green spikes of grain and others that were dry - that I may return to the people; perhaps they will know about you

arabic_uthmani: قالَ تَزرَعونَ سَبعَ سِنينَ دَأَبًا فَما حَصَدتُم فَذَروهُ في سُنبُلِهِ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمّا تَأكُلونَ
blank: qāl tazraʿūn sabʿ sinīn daʾab f-mā ḥaṣadtum f-dharūh fī sunbulihī ʾillā qalīlam-mimmā taʾkulūn
english_saheeh_international: Joseph said, "You will plant for seven years consecutively; and what you harvest leave in its spikes, except a little from which you will eat

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ يَأتي مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ سَبعٌ شِدادٌ يَأكُلنَ ما قَدَّمتُم لَهُنَّ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمّا تُحصِنونَ
blank: thumm yaʾtī m baʿd dhālik sabʿ shidād yaʾkuln mā qaddamtum lahunn ʾillā qalīlam-mimmā tuḥṣinūn
english_saheeh_international: Then will come after that seven difficult years which will consume what you saved for them, except a little from which you will store

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ يَأتي مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ عامٌ فيهِ يُغاثُ النّاسُ وَفيهِ يَعصِرونَ
blank: thumm yaʾtī m baʿd dhālik ʿām fīh yughāth n-nās w-fīh yaʿṣirūn
english_saheeh_international: Then will come after that a year in which the people will be given rain and in which they will press olives and grapes

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ المَلِكُ ائتوني بِهِ ۖ فَلَمّا جاءَهُ الرَّسولُ قالَ ارجِع إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ فَاسأَلهُ ما بالُ النِّسوَةِ اللّاتي قَطَّعنَ أَيدِيَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي بِكَيدِهِنَّ عَليمٌ
blank: w-qālal-malik ʾtūnī bihī f-lammā jāʾah r-rasūl qāl rjiʿ ʾilā rabbik f-sʾalh mā bāl n-niswat llātī qaṭṭaʿn ʾaydiyahunn ʾinn rabbī b-kaydihinn ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: And the king said, "Bring him to me." But when the messenger came to him, Joseph said, "Return to your master and ask him what is the case of the women who cut their hands. Indeed, my Lord is Knowing of their plan

arabic_uthmani: قالَ ما خَطبُكُنَّ إِذ راوَدتُنَّ يوسُفَ عَن نَفسِهِ ۚ قُلنَ حاشَ لِلَّهِ ما عَلِمنا عَلَيهِ مِن سوءٍ ۚ قالَتِ امرَأَتُ العَزيزِ الآنَ حَصحَصَ الحَقُّ أَنا راوَدتُهُ عَن نَفسِهِ وَإِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصّادِقينَ
blank: qāl mā khaṭbukunn ʾidh rāwadtunn yūsuf ʿ nafsihī quln ḥāsh l-llāh mā ʿalimnā ʿalayh m sūʾ qālat mraʾatul-ʿazīzil-ʾān ḥaṣḥaṣal-ḥaqq ʾan rāwadtuhū ʿ nafsihī w-ʾinnahū l-min ṣ-ṣādiqīn
english_saheeh_international: Said the king to the women, "What was your condition when you sought to seduce Joseph?" They said, "Perfect is Allah! We know about him no evil." The wife of al-'Azeez said, "Now the truth has become evident. It was I who sought to seduce him, and indeed, he is of the truthful

arabic_uthmani: ذٰلِكَ لِيَعلَمَ أَنّي لَم أَخُنهُ بِالغَيبِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدي كَيدَ الخائِنينَ
blank: dhālik l-yaʿlam ʾannī lam ʾakhunh b-l-ghayb w-ʾann llāh lā yahdī kaydal-khāʾinīn
english_saheeh_international: That is so al-'Azeez will know that I did not betray him in his absence and that Allah does not guide the plan of betrayers

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَما أُبَرِّئُ نَفسي ۚ إِنَّ النَّفسَ لَأَمّارَةٌ بِالسّوءِ إِلّا ما رَحِمَ رَبّي ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: w-mā ʾubarriʾ nafsī ʾinn n-nafs l-ʾammārat b-s-sūʾ ʾillā mā raḥim rabbī ʾinn rabbī ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: And I do not acquit myself. Indeed, the soul is a persistent enjoiner of evil, except those upon which my Lord has mercy. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ المَلِكُ ائتوني بِهِ أَستَخلِصهُ لِنَفسي ۖ فَلَمّا كَلَّمَهُ قالَ إِنَّكَ اليَومَ لَدَينا مَكينٌ أَمينٌ
blank: w-qālal-malik ʾtūnī bihī ʾastakhliṣh l-nafsī f-lammā kallamahū qāl ʾinnakal-yawm ladaynā makīn ʾamīn
english_saheeh_international: And the king said, "Bring him to me; I will appoint him exclusively for myself." And when he spoke to him, he said, "Indeed, you are today established in position and trusted

arabic_uthmani: قالَ اجعَلني عَلىٰ خَزائِنِ الأَرضِ ۖ إِنّي حَفيظٌ عَليمٌ
blank: qāl jʿalnī ʿalā khazāʾinil-ʾarḍ ʾinnī ḥafīẓ ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: Joseph said, "Appoint me over the storehouses of the land. Indeed, I will be a knowing guardian

arabic_uthmani: وَكَذٰلِكَ مَكَّنّا لِيوسُفَ فِي الأَرضِ يَتَبَوَّأُ مِنها حَيثُ يَشاءُ ۚ نُصيبُ بِرَحمَتِنا مَن نَشاءُ ۖ وَلا نُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
blank: w-k-dhālik makkannā l-yūsuf fīl-ʾarḍ yatabawwaʾ minhā ḥayth yashāʾ nuṣīb b-raḥmatinā m nashāʾ w-lā nuḍīʿ ʾajral-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: And thus We established Joseph in the land to settle therein wherever he willed. We touch with Our mercy whom We will, and We do not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good

arabic_uthmani: وَلَأَجرُ الآخِرَةِ خَيرٌ لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا وَكانوا يَتَّقونَ
blank: w-l-ʾajrul-ʾākhirat khayr l-lladhīn ʾāmanū w-kānū yattaqūn
english_saheeh_international: And the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believed and were fearing Allah

arabic_uthmani: وَجاءَ إِخوَةُ يوسُفَ فَدَخَلوا عَلَيهِ فَعَرَفَهُم وَهُم لَهُ مُنكِرونَ
blank: w-jāʾ ʾikhwat yūsuf f-dakhalū ʿalayh f-ʿarafahum w-hum lahū munkirūn
english_saheeh_international: And the brothers of Joseph came seeking food, and they entered upon him; and he recognized them, but he was to them unknown

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهازِهِم قالَ ائتوني بِأَخٍ لَكُم مِن أَبيكُم ۚ أَلا تَرَونَ أَنّي أوفِي الكَيلَ وَأَنا خَيرُ المُنزِلينَ
blank: w-lammā jahhazahum b-jahāzihim qāl ʾtūnī b-ʾakh lakum m ʾabīkum ʾ-lā tarawn ʾannī ʾūfīl-kayl w-ʾan khayrul-munzilīn
english_saheeh_international: And when he had furnished them with their supplies, he said, "Bring me a brother of yours from your father. Do not you see that I give full measure and that I am the best of accommodators

arabic_uthmani: فَإِن لَم تَأتوني بِهِ فَلا كَيلَ لَكُم عِندي وَلا تَقرَبونِ
blank: f-ʾ lam taʾtūnī bihī f-lā kayl lakum ʿindī w-lā taqrabūn
english_saheeh_international: But if you do not bring him to me, no measure will there be hereafter for you from me, nor will you approach me

arabic_uthmani: قالوا سَنُراوِدُ عَنهُ أَباهُ وَإِنّا لَفاعِلونَ
blank: qālū s-nurāwid ʿanh ʾabāh w-ʾinnā l-fāʿilūn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "We will attempt to dissuade his father from keeping him, and indeed, we will do it

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ لِفِتيانِهِ اجعَلوا بِضاعَتَهُم في رِحالِهِم لَعَلَّهُم يَعرِفونَها إِذَا انقَلَبوا إِلىٰ أَهلِهِم لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
blank: w-qāl l-fityānih jʿalū biḍāʿatahum fī riḥālihim laʿallahum yaʿrifūnahā ʾidhā nqalabū ʾilā ʾahlihim laʿallahum yarjiʿūn
english_saheeh_international: And Joseph said to his servants, "Put their merchandise into their saddlebags so they might recognize it when they have gone back to their people that perhaps they will again return

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا رَجَعوا إِلىٰ أَبيهِم قالوا يا أَبانا مُنِعَ مِنَّا الكَيلُ فَأَرسِل مَعَنا أَخانا نَكتَل وَإِنّا لَهُ لَحافِظونَ
blank: f-lammā rajaʿū ʾilā ʾabīhim qālū yā-ʾabānā muniʿ minnāl-kayl f-ʾarsil maʿanā ʾakhānā naktal w-ʾinnā lahū l-ḥāfiẓūn
english_saheeh_international: So when they returned to their father, they said, "O our father, further measure has been denied to us, so send with us our brother that we will be given measure. And indeed, we will be his guardians

arabic_uthmani: قالَ هَل آمَنُكُم عَلَيهِ إِلّا كَما أَمِنتُكُم عَلىٰ أَخيهِ مِن قَبلُ ۖ فَاللَّهُ خَيرٌ حافِظًا ۖ وَهُوَ أَرحَمُ الرّاحِمينَ
blank: qāl hal ʾāmanukum ʿalayh ʾillā k-mā ʾamintukum ʿalā ʾakhīh m qabl f-llāh khayr ḥāfiẓ w-huw ʾarḥam r-rāḥimīn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Should I entrust you with him except under coercion as I entrusted you with his brother before? But Allah is the best guardian, and He is the most merciful of the merciful

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا فَتَحوا مَتاعَهُم وَجَدوا بِضاعَتَهُم رُدَّت إِلَيهِم ۖ قالوا يا أَبانا ما نَبغي ۖ هٰذِهِ بِضاعَتُنا رُدَّت إِلَينا ۖ وَنَميرُ أَهلَنا وَنَحفَظُ أَخانا وَنَزدادُ كَيلَ بَعيرٍ ۖ ذٰلِكَ كَيلٌ يَسيرٌ
blank: w-lammā fataḥū matāʿahum wajadū biḍāʿatahum ruddat ʾilayhim qālū yā-ʾabānā mā nabghī hādhihī biḍāʿatunā ruddat ʾilaynā w-namīr ʾahlanā w-naḥfaẓ ʾakhānā w-nazdād kayl baʿīr dhālik kayl yasīr
english_saheeh_international: And when they opened their baggage, they found their merchandise returned to them. They said, "O our father, what more could we desire? This is our merchandise returned to us. And we will obtain supplies for our family and protect our brother and obtain an increase of a camel's load; that is an easy measurement

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لَن أُرسِلَهُ مَعَكُم حَتّىٰ تُؤتونِ مَوثِقًا مِنَ اللَّهِ لَتَأتُنَّني بِهِ إِلّا أَن يُحاطَ بِكُم ۖ فَلَمّا آتَوهُ مَوثِقَهُم قالَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ ما نَقولُ وَكيلٌ
blank: qāl l ʾursilahū maʿakum ḥattā tuʾtūn mawthiqam-min llāh l-taʾtunnanī bihī ʾillā ʾ yuḥāṭ bikum f-lammā ʾātawh mawthiqahum qāl llāh ʿalā mā naqūl wakīl
english_saheeh_international: Jacob said, "Never will I send him with you until you give me a promise by Allah that you will bring him back to me, unless you should be surrounded by enemies." And when they had given their promise, he said, "Allah, over what we say, is Witness

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ يا بَنِيَّ لا تَدخُلوا مِن بابٍ واحِدٍ وَادخُلوا مِن أَبوابٍ مُتَفَرِّقَةٍ ۖ وَما أُغني عَنكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ ۖ إِنِ الحُكمُ إِلّا لِلَّهِ ۖ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ ۖ وَعَلَيهِ فَليَتَوَكَّلِ المُتَوَكِّلونَ
blank: w-qāl yā-baniyy lā tadkhulū m bāb wāḥid w-dkhulū m ʾabwāb mutafarriqat w-mā ʾughnī ʿankum min llāh m shayʾ ʾinil-ḥukm ʾillā l-llāh ʿalayh tawakkalt w-ʿalayh f-l-yatawakkalil-mutawakkilūn
english_saheeh_international: And he said, "O my sons, do not enter from one gate but enter from different gates; and I cannot avail you against the decree of Allah at all. The decision is only for Allah; upon Him I have relied, and upon Him let those who would rely indeed rely

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا دَخَلوا مِن حَيثُ أَمَرَهُم أَبوهُم ما كانَ يُغني عَنهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ إِلّا حاجَةً في نَفسِ يَعقوبَ قَضاها ۚ وَإِنَّهُ لَذو عِلمٍ لِما عَلَّمناهُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
blank: w-lammā dakhalū m ḥayth ʾamarahum ʾabūhum mā kān yughnī ʿanhum min llāh m shayʾ ʾillā ḥājat fī nafs yaʿqūb qaḍāhā w-ʾinnahū l-dhū ʿilm l-mā ʿallamnāh w-lākinn ʾakthar n-nās lā yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And when they entered from where their father had ordered them, it did not avail them against Allah at all except it was a need within the soul of Jacob, which he satisfied. And indeed, he was a possessor of knowledge because of what We had taught him, but most of the people do not know

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا دَخَلوا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ آوىٰ إِلَيهِ أَخاهُ ۖ قالَ إِنّي أَنا أَخوكَ فَلا تَبتَئِس بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
blank: w-lammā dakhalū ʿalā yūsuf ʾāwā ʾilayh ʾakhāh qāl ʾinnī ʾan ʾakhūk f-lā tabtaʾis b-mā kānū yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his brother to himself; he said, "Indeed, I am your brother, so do not despair over what they used to do to me

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهازِهِم جَعَلَ السِّقايَةَ في رَحلِ أَخيهِ ثُمَّ أَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ أَيَّتُهَا العيرُ إِنَّكُم لَسارِقونَ
blank: f-lammā jahhazahum b-jahāzihim jaʿal s-siqāyat fī raḥl ʾakhīh thumm ʾadhdhan muʾadhdhin ʾayyatuhāl-ʿīr ʾinnakum l-sāriqūn
english_saheeh_international: So when he had furnished them with their supplies, he put the gold measuring bowl into the bag of his brother. Then an announcer called out, "O caravan, indeed you are thieves

arabic_uthmani: قالوا وَأَقبَلوا عَلَيهِم ماذا تَفقِدونَ
blank: qālū w-ʾaqbalū ʿalayhim mādhā tafqidūn
english_saheeh_international: They said while approaching them, "What is it you are missing

arabic_uthmani: قالوا نَفقِدُ صُواعَ المَلِكِ وَلِمَن جاءَ بِهِ حِملُ بَعيرٍ وَأَنا بِهِ زَعيمٌ
blank: qālū nafqid ṣuwāʿal-malik w-l-m jāʾ bihī ḥiml baʿīr w-ʾan bihī zaʿīm
english_saheeh_international: They said, "We are missing the measure of the king. And for he who produces it is the reward of a camel's load, and I am responsible for it

arabic_uthmani: قالوا تَاللَّهِ لَقَد عَلِمتُم ما جِئنا لِنُفسِدَ فِي الأَرضِ وَما كُنّا سارِقينَ
blank: qālū t-llāh l-qad ʿalimtum mā jiʾnā l-nufsid fīl-ʾarḍ w-mā kunnā sāriqīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "By Allah, you have certainly known that we did not come to cause corruption in the land, and we have not been thieves

arabic_uthmani: قالوا فَما جَزاؤُهُ إِن كُنتُم كاذِبينَ
blank: qālū f-mā jazāʾuhū ʾ kuntum kādhibīn
english_saheeh_international: The accusers said, "Then what would be its recompense if you should be liars

arabic_uthmani: قالوا جَزاؤُهُ مَن وُجِدَ في رَحلِهِ فَهُوَ جَزاؤُهُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي الظّالِمينَ
blank: qālū jazāʾuhū m wujid fī raḥlihī f-huw jazāʾuhū k-dhālik najzī ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: The brothers said, "Its recompense is that he in whose bag it is found - he himself will be its recompense. Thus do we recompense the wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: فَبَدَأَ بِأَوعِيَتِهِم قَبلَ وِعاءِ أَخيهِ ثُمَّ استَخرَجَها مِن وِعاءِ أَخيهِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ كِدنا لِيوسُفَ ۖ ما كانَ لِيَأخُذَ أَخاهُ في دينِ المَلِكِ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ نَرفَعُ دَرَجاتٍ مَن نَشاءُ ۗ وَفَوقَ كُلِّ ذي عِلمٍ عَليمٌ
blank: f-badaʾ b-ʾawʿiyatihim qabl wiʿāʾ ʾakhīh thumm stakhrajahā m wiʿāʾ ʾakhīh k-dhālik kidnā l-yūsuf mā kān l-yaʾkhudh ʾakhāh fī dīnil-malik ʾillā ʾ yashāʾ llāh narfaʿ darajāt m nashāʾ w-fawq kull dhī ʿilm ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: So he began the search with their bags before the bag of his brother; then he extracted it from the bag of his brother. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother within the religion of the king except that Allah willed. We raise in degrees whom We will, but over every possessor of knowledge is one more knowing

arabic_uthmani: ۞ قالوا إِن يَسرِق فَقَد سَرَقَ أَخٌ لَهُ مِن قَبلُ ۚ فَأَسَرَّها يوسُفُ في نَفسِهِ وَلَم يُبدِها لَهُم ۚ قالَ أَنتُم شَرٌّ مَكانًا ۖ وَاللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما تَصِفونَ
blank: qālū ʾ yasriq f-qad saraq ʾakh lahū m qabl f-ʾasarrahā yūsuf fī nafsihī w-lam yubdihā lahum qāl ʾantum sharr makān w-llāh ʾaʿlam b-mā taṣifūn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "If he steals - a brother of his has stolen before." But Joseph kept it within himself and did not reveal it to them. He said, "You are worse in position, and Allah is most knowing of what you describe

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا أَيُّهَا العَزيزُ إِنَّ لَهُ أَبًا شَيخًا كَبيرًا فَخُذ أَحَدَنا مَكانَهُ ۖ إِنّا نَراكَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
blank: qālū yā-ʾayyuhāl-ʿazīz ʾinn lahū ʾab shaykh kabīr f-khudh ʾaḥadanā makānahū ʾinnā narāk minal-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O 'Azeez, indeed he has a father who is an old man, so take one of us in place of him. Indeed, we see you as a doer of good

arabic_uthmani: قالَ مَعاذَ اللَّهِ أَن نَأخُذَ إِلّا مَن وَجَدنا مَتاعَنا عِندَهُ إِنّا إِذًا لَظالِمونَ
blank: qāl maʿādh llāh ʾ naʾkhudh ʾillā m wajadnā matāʿanā ʿindahū ʾinnā ʾidh l-ẓālimūn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "I seek the refuge of Allah to prevent that we take except him with whom we found our possession. Indeed, we would then be unjust

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمَّا استَيأَسوا مِنهُ خَلَصوا نَجِيًّا ۖ قالَ كَبيرُهُم أَلَم تَعلَموا أَنَّ أَباكُم قَد أَخَذَ عَلَيكُم مَوثِقًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَمِن قَبلُ ما فَرَّطتُم في يوسُفَ ۖ فَلَن أَبرَحَ الأَرضَ حَتّىٰ يَأذَنَ لي أَبي أَو يَحكُمَ اللَّهُ لي ۖ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الحاكِمينَ
blank: f-lammā stayʾasū minh khalaṣū najiyy qāl kabīruhum ʾ-lam taʿlamū ʾann ʾabākum qad ʾakhadh ʿalaykum mawthiqam-min llāh w-m qabl mā farraṭtum fī yūsuf f-l ʾabraḥal-ʾarḍ ḥattā yaʾdhan lī ʾabī ʾaw yaḥkum llāh lī w-huw khāyrul-ḥākimīn
english_saheeh_international: So when they had despaired of him, they secluded themselves in private consultation. The eldest of them said, "Do you not know that your father has taken upon you an oath by Allah and that before you failed in your duty to Joseph? So I will never leave this land until my father permits me or Allah decides for me, and He is the best of judges

arabic_uthmani: ارجِعوا إِلىٰ أَبيكُم فَقولوا يا أَبانا إِنَّ ابنَكَ سَرَقَ وَما شَهِدنا إِلّا بِما عَلِمنا وَما كُنّا لِلغَيبِ حافِظينَ
blank: irjiʿū ʾilā ʾabīkum f-qūlū yā-ʾabānā ʾinn bnak saraq w-mā shahidnā ʾillā b-mā ʿalimnā w-mā kunnā l-l-ghayb ḥāfiẓīn
english_saheeh_international: Return to your father and say, "O our father, indeed your son has stolen, and we did not testify except to what we knew. And we were not witnesses of the unseen

arabic_uthmani: وَاسأَلِ القَريَةَ الَّتي كُنّا فيها وَالعيرَ الَّتي أَقبَلنا فيها ۖ وَإِنّا لَصادِقونَ
blank: w-sʾalil-qaryat llatī kunnā fīhā w-l-ʿīr llatī ʾaqbalnā fīhā w-ʾinnā l-ṣādiqūn
english_saheeh_international: And ask the city in which we were and the caravan in which we came - and indeed, we are truthful

arabic_uthmani: قالَ بَل سَوَّلَت لَكُم أَنفُسُكُم أَمرًا ۖ فَصَبرٌ جَميلٌ ۖ عَسَى اللَّهُ أَن يَأتِيَني بِهِم جَميعًا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ العَليمُ الحَكيمُ
blank: qāl bal sawwalat lakum ʾanfusukum ʾamr f-ṣabr jamīl ʿasā llāh ʾ yaʾtiyanī bihim jamīʿ ʾinnahū huwal-ʿalīmul-ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: Jacob said, "Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. Perhaps Allah will bring them to me all together. Indeed it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise

arabic_uthmani: وَتَوَلّىٰ عَنهُم وَقالَ يا أَسَفىٰ عَلىٰ يوسُفَ وَابيَضَّت عَيناهُ مِنَ الحُزنِ فَهُوَ كَظيمٌ
blank: w-tawallā ʿanhum w-qāl yā-ʾasafā ʿalā yūsuf w-byaḍḍat ʿaynāh minal-ḥuzn f-huw kaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: And he turned away from them and said, "Oh, my sorrow over Joseph," and his eyes became white from grief, for he was of that a suppressor

arabic_uthmani: قالوا تَاللَّهِ تَفتَأُ تَذكُرُ يوسُفَ حَتّىٰ تَكونَ حَرَضًا أَو تَكونَ مِنَ الهالِكينَ
blank: qālū t-llāh taftaʾ tadhkur yūsuf ḥattā takūn ḥaraḍ ʾaw takūn minal-hālikīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "By Allah, you will not cease remembering Joseph until you become fatally ill or become of those who perish

arabic_uthmani: قالَ إِنَّما أَشكو بَثّي وَحُزني إِلَى اللَّهِ وَأَعلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
blank: qāl ʾinnamā ʾashkū baththī w-ḥuznī ʾilā llāh w-ʾaʿlam min llāh mā lā taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you do not know

arabic_uthmani: يا بَنِيَّ اذهَبوا فَتَحَسَّسوا مِن يوسُفَ وَأَخيهِ وَلا تَيأَسوا مِن رَوحِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ لا يَيأَسُ مِن رَوحِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا القَومُ الكافِرونَ
blank: yā-baniyy dhhabū f-taḥassasū m yūsuf w-ʾakhīh w-lā tayʾasū m rawḥ llāh ʾinnahū lā yayʾas m rawḥ llāh ʾillāl-qawmul-kāfirūn
english_saheeh_international: O my sons, go and find out about Joseph and his brother and despair not of relief from Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا دَخَلوا عَلَيهِ قالوا يا أَيُّهَا العَزيزُ مَسَّنا وَأَهلَنَا الضُّرُّ وَجِئنا بِبِضاعَةٍ مُزجاةٍ فَأَوفِ لَنَا الكَيلَ وَتَصَدَّق عَلَينا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَجزِي المُتَصَدِّقينَ
blank: f-lammā dakhalū ʿalayh qālū yā-ʾayyuhāl-ʿazīz massanā w-ʾahlanā ḍ-ḍurr w-jiʾnā b-biḍāʿat muzjāt f-ʾawf lanāl-kayl w-taṣaddaq ʿalaynā ʾinn llāh yajzīl-mutaṣaddiqīn
english_saheeh_international: So when they entered upon Joseph, they said, "O 'Azeez, adversity has touched us and our family, and we have come with goods poor in quality, but give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable

arabic_uthmani: قالَ هَل عَلِمتُم ما فَعَلتُم بِيوسُفَ وَأَخيهِ إِذ أَنتُم جاهِلونَ
blank: qāl hal ʿalimtum mā faʿaltum b-yūsuf w-ʾakhīh ʾidh ʾantum jāhilūn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Do you know what you did with Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant

arabic_uthmani: قالوا أَإِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ يوسُفُ ۖ قالَ أَنا يوسُفُ وَهٰذا أَخي ۖ قَد مَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَينا ۖ إِنَّهُ مَن يَتَّقِ وَيَصبِر فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
blank: qālū ʾ-ʾinnak l-ʾant yūsuf qāl ʾan yūsuf w-hādhā ʾakhī qad mann llāh ʿalaynā ʾinnahū m yattaq w-yaṣbir f-ʾinn llāh lā yuḍīʿ ʾajral-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "Are you indeed Joseph?" He said "I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Allah has certainly favored us. Indeed, he who fears Allah and is patient, then indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good

arabic_uthmani: قالوا تَاللَّهِ لَقَد آثَرَكَ اللَّهُ عَلَينا وَإِن كُنّا لَخاطِئينَ
blank: qālū t-llāh l-qad ʾātharak llāh ʿalaynā w-ʾ kunnā l-khāṭiʾīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "By Allah, certainly has Allah preferred you over us, and indeed, we have been sinners

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لا تَثريبَ عَلَيكُمُ اليَومَ ۖ يَغفِرُ اللَّهُ لَكُم ۖ وَهُوَ أَرحَمُ الرّاحِمينَ
blank: qāl lā tathrīb ʿalaykumul-yawm yaghfir llāh lakum w-huw ʾarḥam r-rāḥimīn
english_saheeh_international: He said, "No blame will there be upon you today. Allah will forgive you; and He is the most merciful of the merciful

arabic_uthmani: اذهَبوا بِقَميصي هٰذا فَأَلقوهُ عَلىٰ وَجهِ أَبي يَأتِ بَصيرًا وَأتوني بِأَهلِكُم أَجمَعينَ
blank: idhhabū b-qamīṣī hādhā f-ʾalqūh ʿalā wajh ʾabī yaʾt baṣīr w-ʾtūnī b-ʾahlikum ʾajmaʿīn
english_saheeh_international: Take this, my shirt, and cast it over the face of my father; he will become seeing. And bring me your family, all together

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا فَصَلَتِ العيرُ قالَ أَبوهُم إِنّي لَأَجِدُ ريحَ يوسُفَ ۖ لَولا أَن تُفَنِّدونِ
blank: w-lammā faṣalatil-ʿīr qāl ʾabūhum ʾinnī l-ʾajid rīḥ yūsuf law-lā ʾ tufannidūn
english_saheeh_international: And when the caravan departed from Egypt, their father said, "Indeed, I find the smell of Joseph and would say that he was alive if you did not think me weakened in mind

arabic_uthmani: قالوا تَاللَّهِ إِنَّكَ لَفي ضَلالِكَ القَديمِ
blank: qālū t-llāh ʾinnak l-fī ḍalālikal-qadīm
english_saheeh_international: They said, "By Allah, indeed you are in your same old error

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا أَن جاءَ البَشيرُ أَلقاهُ عَلىٰ وَجهِهِ فَارتَدَّ بَصيرًا ۖ قالَ أَلَم أَقُل لَكُم إِنّي أَعلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
blank: f-lammā ʾ jāʾal-bashīr ʾalqāh ʿalā wajhihī f-rtadd baṣīr qāl ʾ-lam ʾaqul lakum ʾinnī ʾaʿlam min llāh mā lā taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And when the bearer of good tidings arrived, he cast it over his face, and he returned once again seeing. He said, "Did I not tell you that I know from Allah that which you do not know

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا أَبانَا استَغفِر لَنا ذُنوبَنا إِنّا كُنّا خاطِئينَ
blank: qālū yā-ʾabānā staghfir lanā dhunūbanā ʾinnā kunnā khāṭiʾīn
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O our father, ask for us forgiveness of our sins; indeed, we have been sinners

arabic_uthmani: قالَ سَوفَ أَستَغفِرُ لَكُم رَبّي ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
blank: qāl sawf ʾastaghfir lakum rabbī ʾinnahū huwal-ghafūr r-raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: He said, "I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا دَخَلوا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ آوىٰ إِلَيهِ أَبَوَيهِ وَقالَ ادخُلوا مِصرَ إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنينَ
blank: f-lammā dakhalū ʿalā yūsuf ʾāwā ʾilayh ʾabawayh w-qāl dkhulū miṣr ʾ shāʾ llāh ʾāminīn
english_saheeh_international: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his parents to himself and said, "Enter Egypt, Allah willing, safe and secure

arabic_uthmani: وَرَفَعَ أَبَوَيهِ عَلَى العَرشِ وَخَرّوا لَهُ سُجَّدًا ۖ وَقالَ يا أَبَتِ هٰذا تَأويلُ رُؤيايَ مِن قَبلُ قَد جَعَلَها رَبّي حَقًّا ۖ وَقَد أَحسَنَ بي إِذ أَخرَجَني مِنَ السِّجنِ وَجاءَ بِكُم مِنَ البَدوِ مِن بَعدِ أَن نَزَغَ الشَّيطانُ بَيني وَبَينَ إِخوَتي ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي لَطيفٌ لِما يَشاءُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ العَليمُ الحَكيمُ
blank: w-rafaʿ ʾabawayh ʿalāl-ʿarsh w-kharrū lahū sujjad w-qāl yā-ʾabat hādhā taʾwīl ruʾyāy m qabl qad jaʿalahā rabbī ḥaqq w-qad ʾaḥsan bī ʾidh ʾakhrajanī min s-sijn w-jāʾ bikum minal-badw m baʿd ʾ nazagh sh-shayṭān baynī w-bayn ʾikhwatī ʾinn rabbī laṭīf l-mā yashāʾ ʾinnahū huwal-ʿalīmul-ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: And he raised his parents upon the throne, and they bowed to him in prostration. And he said, "O my father, this is the explanation of my vision of before. My Lord has made it reality. And He was certainly good to me when He took me out of prison and brought you here from bedouin life after Satan had induced estrangement between me and my brothers. Indeed, my Lord is Subtle in what He wills. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise

arabic_uthmani: ۞ رَبِّ قَد آتَيتَني مِنَ المُلكِ وَعَلَّمتَني مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ ۚ فاطِرَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ أَنتَ وَلِيّي فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ ۖ تَوَفَّني مُسلِمًا وَأَلحِقني بِالصّالِحينَ
blank: rabb qad ʾātaytanī minal-mulk w-ʿallamtanī m taʾwīlil-ʾaḥādīth fāṭir s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ ʾant waliyyī fī d-dunyā w-l-ʾākhirat tawaffanī muslim w-ʾalḥiqnī b-ṣ-ṣāliḥīn
english_saheeh_international: My Lord, You have given me something of sovereignty and taught me of the interpretation of dreams. Creator of the heavens and earth, You are my protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous

arabic_uthmani: ذٰلِكَ مِن أَنباءِ الغَيبِ نوحيهِ إِلَيكَ ۖ وَما كُنتَ لَدَيهِم إِذ أَجمَعوا أَمرَهُم وَهُم يَمكُرونَ
blank: dhālik m ʾanbāʾil-ghayb nūḥīh ʾilayk w-mā kunt ladayhim ʾidh ʾajmaʿū ʾamrahum w-hum yamkurūn
english_saheeh_international: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal, O Muhammad, to you. And you were not with them when they put together their plan while they conspired

arabic_uthmani: وَما أَكثَرُ النّاسِ وَلَو حَرَصتَ بِمُؤمِنينَ
blank: w-mā ʾakthar n-nās w-law ḥaraṣt b-muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: And most of the people, although you strive for it, are not believers

arabic_uthmani: وَما تَسأَلُهُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۚ إِن هُوَ إِلّا ذِكرٌ لِلعالَمينَ
blank: w-mā tasʾaluhum ʿalayh m ʾajr ʾ huw ʾillā dhikr l-l-ʿālamīn
english_saheeh_international: And you do not ask of them for it any payment. It is not except a reminder to the worlds

arabic_uthmani: وَكَأَيِّن مِن آيَةٍ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ يَمُرّونَ عَلَيها وَهُم عَنها مُعرِضونَ
blank: w-k-ʾayy m ʾāyat fī s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ yamurrūn ʿalayhā w-hum ʿanhā muʿriḍūn
english_saheeh_international: And how many a sign within the heavens and earth do they pass over while they, therefrom, are turning away

arabic_uthmani: وَما يُؤمِنُ أَكثَرُهُم بِاللَّهِ إِلّا وَهُم مُشرِكونَ
blank: w-mā yuʾmin ʾaktharuhum b-llāh ʾillā w-hum mushrikūn
english_saheeh_international: And most of them believe not in Allah except while they associate others with Him

arabic_uthmani: أَفَأَمِنوا أَن تَأتِيَهُم غاشِيَةٌ مِن عَذابِ اللَّهِ أَو تَأتِيَهُمُ السّاعَةُ بَغتَةً وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
blank: ʾ-f-ʾaminū ʾ taʾtiyahum ghāshiyat m ʿadhāb llāh ʾaw taʾtiyahum s-sāʿat baghtat w-hum lā yashʿurūn
english_saheeh_international: Then do they feel secure that there will not come to them an overwhelming aspect of the punishment of Allah or that the Hour will not come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive

arabic_uthmani: قُل هٰذِهِ سَبيلي أَدعو إِلَى اللَّهِ ۚ عَلىٰ بَصيرَةٍ أَنا وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَني ۖ وَسُبحانَ اللَّهِ وَما أَنا مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
blank: qul hādhihī sabīlī ʾadʿū ʾilā llāh ʿalā baṣīrat ʾan w-man ttabaʿanī w-subḥān llāh w-mā ʾan minal-mushrikīn
english_saheeh_international: Say, "This is my way; I invite to Allah with insight, I and those who follow me. And exalted is Allah; and I am not of those who associate others with Him

arabic_uthmani: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ إِلّا رِجالًا نوحي إِلَيهِم مِن أَهلِ القُرىٰ ۗ أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۗ وَلَدارُ الآخِرَةِ خَيرٌ لِلَّذينَ اتَّقَوا ۗ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
blank: w-mā ʾarsalnā m qablik ʾillā rijāl nūḥī ʾilayhim m ʾahlil-qurā ʾ-f-lam yasīrū fīl-ʾarḍ f-yanẓurū kayf kān ʿāqibatulladhīn m qablihim w-l-dārul-ʾākhirat khayr l-lladhīn ttaqaw ʾ-f-lā taʿqilūn
english_saheeh_international: And We sent not before you as messengers except men to whom We revealed from among the people of cities. So have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah; then will you not reason

arabic_uthmani: حَتّىٰ إِذَا استَيأَسَ الرُّسُلُ وَظَنّوا أَنَّهُم قَد كُذِبوا جاءَهُم نَصرُنا فَنُجِّيَ مَن نَشاءُ ۖ وَلا يُرَدُّ بَأسُنا عَنِ القَومِ المُجرِمينَ
blank: ḥattā ʾidhā stayʾas r-rusul w-ẓannū ʾannahum qad kudhibū jāʾahum naṣrunā f-nujjiy m nashāʾ w-lā yuradd baʾsunā ʿanil-qawmil-mujrimīn
english_saheeh_international: They continued until, when the messengers despaired and were certain that they had been denied, there came to them Our victory, and whoever We willed was saved. And Our punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد كانَ في قَصَصِهِم عِبرَةٌ لِأُولِي الأَلبابِ ۗ ما كانَ حَديثًا يُفتَرىٰ وَلٰكِن تَصديقَ الَّذي بَينَ يَدَيهِ وَتَفصيلَ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
blank: l-qad kān fī qaṣaṣihim ʿibrat l-ʾulīl-ʾalbāb mā kān ḥadīth yuftarā w-lāk taṣdīqalladhī bayn yadayh w-tafṣīl kull shayʾ w-hud w-raḥmat l-qawm yuʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: There was certainly in their stories a lesson for those of understanding. Never was the Qur'an a narration invented, but a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of all things and guidance and mercy for a people who believe

arabic_uthmani: المر ۚ تِلكَ آياتُ الكِتابِ ۗ وَالَّذي أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ الحَقُّ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
blank: -l-m-r (ʾalif lām mīm rā) tilk ʾāyātul-kitāb w-lladhī ʾunzil ʾilayk m rabbikal-ḥaqq w-lākinn ʾakthar n-nās lā yuʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: Alif, Lam, Meem, Ra. These are the verses of the Book; and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe

arabic_uthmani: اللَّهُ الَّذي رَفَعَ السَّماواتِ بِغَيرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَونَها ۖ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجري لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ يُفَصِّلُ الآياتِ لَعَلَّكُم بِلِقاءِ رَبِّكُم توقِنونَ
blank: allāhulladhī rafaʿ s-samāwāt b-ghayr ʿamad tarawnahā thumm stawā ʿalāl-ʿarsh w-sakhkhar sh-shams w-l-qamar kull yajrī l-ʾajal musamm yudabbirul-ʾamr yufaṣṣilul-ʾāyāt laʿallakum b-liqāʾ rabbikum tūqinūn
english_saheeh_international: It is Allah who erected the heavens without pillars that you can see; then He established Himself above the Throne and made subject the sun and the moon, each running its course for a specified term. He arranges each matter; He details the signs that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain

arabic_uthmani: وَهُوَ الَّذي مَدَّ الأَرضَ وَجَعَلَ فيها رَواسِيَ وَأَنهارًا ۖ وَمِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ جَعَلَ فيها زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ ۖ يُغشِي اللَّيلَ النَّهارَ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
blank: w-huwalladhī maddal-ʾarḍ w-jaʿal fīhā rawāsiy w-ʾanhār w-m kull th-thamarāt jaʿal fīhā zawjayn thnayn yughshīl-layl n-nahār ʾinn fī dhālik l-ʾāyāt l-qawm yatafakkarūn
english_saheeh_international: And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates; He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought

arabic_uthmani: وَفِي الأَرضِ قِطَعٌ مُتَجاوِراتٌ وَجَنّاتٌ مِن أَعنابٍ وَزَرعٌ وَنَخيلٌ صِنوانٌ وَغَيرُ صِنوانٍ يُسقىٰ بِماءٍ واحِدٍ وَنُفَضِّلُ بَعضَها عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فِي الأُكُلِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
blank: w-fīl-ʾarḍ qiṭaʿ mutajāwirāt w-jannāt m ʾaʿnāb w-zarʿ w-nakhīl ṣinwān w-ghayr ṣinwān yusqā b-māʾ wāḥid w-nufaḍḍil baʿḍahā ʿalā baʿḍ fīl-ʾukul ʾinn fī dhālik l-ʾāyāt l-qawm yaʿqilūn
english_saheeh_international: And within the land are neighboring plots and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, growing several from a root or otherwise, watered with one water; but We make some of them exceed others in quality of fruit. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَإِن تَعجَب فَعَجَبٌ قَولُهُم أَإِذا كُنّا تُرابًا أَإِنّا لَفي خَلقٍ جَديدٍ ۗ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِرَبِّهِم ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ الأَغلالُ في أَعناقِهِم ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ النّارِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
blank: w-ʾ taʿjab f-ʿajab qawluhum ʾ-ʾidhā kunnā turāb ʾ-ʾinnā l-fī khalq jadīd ʾulāʾikalladhīn kafarū b-rabbihim w-ʾulāʾikal-ʾaghlāl fī ʾaʿnāqihim w-ʾulāʾik ʾaṣḥāb n-nār hum fīhā khālidūn
english_saheeh_international: And if you are astonished, O Muhammad - then astonishing is their saying, "When we are dust, will we indeed be brought into a new creation?" Those are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord, and those will have shackles upon their necks, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally

arabic_uthmani: وَيَستَعجِلونَكَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ قَبلَ الحَسَنَةِ وَقَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِهِمُ المَثُلاتُ ۗ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذو مَغفِرَةٍ لِلنّاسِ عَلىٰ ظُلمِهِم ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَشَديدُ العِقابِ
blank: w-yastaʿjilūnak b-s-sayyiʾat qablal-ḥasanat w-qad khalat m qablihimul-mathulāt w-ʾinn rabbak l-dhū maghfirat l-n-nās ʿalā ẓulmihim w-ʾinn rabbak l-shadīdul-ʿiqāb
english_saheeh_international: They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good, while there has already occurred before them similar punishments to what they demand. And indeed, your Lord is full of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing, and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty

arabic_uthmani: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ آيَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ ۗ إِنَّما أَنتَ مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَلِكُلِّ قَومٍ هادٍ
blank: w-yaqūlulladhīn kafarū law-lā ʾunzil ʿalayh ʾāyat m rabbihī ʾinnamā ʾant mundhir w-l-kull qawm hād-
english_saheeh_international: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and for every people is a guide

arabic_uthmani: اللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما تَحمِلُ كُلُّ أُنثىٰ وَما تَغيضُ الأَرحامُ وَما تَزدادُ ۖ وَكُلُّ شَيءٍ عِندَهُ بِمِقدارٍ
blank: allāh yaʿlam mā taḥmil kull ʾunthā w-mā taghīḍul-ʾarḥām w-mā tazdād w-kull shayʾ ʿindahū b-miqdār
english_saheeh_international: Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs lose prematurely or exceed. And everything with Him is by due measure

arabic_uthmani: عالِمُ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ الكَبيرُ المُتَعالِ
blank: ʿālimul-ghayb w-sh-shahādatil-kabīrul-mutaʿāl
english_saheeh_international: He is Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Grand, the Exalted

arabic_uthmani: سَواءٌ مِنكُم مَن أَسَرَّ القَولَ وَمَن جَهَرَ بِهِ وَمَن هُوَ مُستَخفٍ بِاللَّيلِ وَسارِبٌ بِالنَّهارِ
blank: sawāʾ minkum m ʾasarral-qawl w-m jahar bihī w-m huw mustakhf b-l-layl w-sārib b-n-nahār
english_saheeh_international: It is the same to Him concerning you whether one conceals his speech or one publicizes it and whether one is hidden by night or conspicuous among others by day

arabic_uthmani: لَهُ مُعَقِّباتٌ مِن بَينِ يَدَيهِ وَمِن خَلفِهِ يَحفَظونَهُ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُغَيِّرُ ما بِقَومٍ حَتّىٰ يُغَيِّروا ما بِأَنفُسِهِم ۗ وَإِذا أَرادَ اللَّهُ بِقَومٍ سوءًا فَلا مَرَدَّ لَهُ ۚ وَما لَهُم مِن دونِهِ مِن والٍ
blank: lahū muʿaqqibāt m bayn yadayh w-m khalfihī yaḥfaẓūnahū m ʾamr llāh ʾinn llāh lā yughayyir mā b-qawm ḥattā yughayyirū mā b-ʾanfusihim w-ʾidhā ʾarād llāh b-qawm sūʾ f-lā maradd lahū w-mā lahum m dūnihī m wāl
english_saheeh_international: For each one are successive angels before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron

arabic_uthmani: هُوَ الَّذي يُريكُمُ البَرقَ خَوفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنشِئُ السَّحابَ الثِّقالَ
blank: huwalladhī yurīkumul-barq khawf w-ṭamaʿ w-yunshiʾ s-saḥāb th-thiqāl
english_saheeh_international: It is He who shows you lightening, causing fear and aspiration, and generates the heavy clouds

arabic_uthmani: وَيُسَبِّحُ الرَّعدُ بِحَمدِهِ وَالمَلائِكَةُ مِن خيفَتِهِ وَيُرسِلُ الصَّواعِقَ فَيُصيبُ بِها مَن يَشاءُ وَهُم يُجادِلونَ فِي اللَّهِ وَهُوَ شَديدُ المِحالِ
blank: w-yusabbiḥ r-raʿd b-ḥamdihī w-l-malāʾikat m khīfatihī w-yursil ṣ-ṣawāʿiq f-yuṣīb bihā m yashāʾ w-hum yujādilūn fī llāh w-huw shadīdul-miḥāl
english_saheeh_international: And the thunder exalts Allah with praise of Him - and the angels as well from fear of Him - and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills while they dispute about Allah; and He is severe in assault

arabic_uthmani: لَهُ دَعوَةُ الحَقِّ ۖ وَالَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ لا يَستَجيبونَ لَهُم بِشَيءٍ إِلّا كَباسِطِ كَفَّيهِ إِلَى الماءِ لِيَبلُغَ فاهُ وَما هُوَ بِبالِغِهِ ۚ وَما دُعاءُ الكافِرينَ إِلّا في ضَلالٍ
blank: lahū daʿwatul-ḥaqq w-lladhīn yadʿūn m dūnihī lā yastajībūn lahum b-shayʾ ʾillā k-bāsiṭ kaffayh ʾilāl-māʾ l-yablugh fāh w-mā huw b-bālighihī w-mā duʿāʾul-kāfirīn ʾillā fī ḍalāl
english_saheeh_international: To Him alone is the supplication of truth. And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches his hands toward water from afar, calling it to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it thus. And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error i.e. futility

arabic_uthmani: وَلِلَّهِ يَسجُدُ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ طَوعًا وَكَرهًا وَظِلالُهُم بِالغُدُوِّ وَالآصالِ ۩
blank: w-l-llāh yasjud m fī s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ ṭawʿ w-karh w-ẓilāluhum b-l-ghuduww w-l-ʾāṣāl
english_saheeh_international: And to Allah prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and their shadows as well in the mornings and the afternoons

arabic_uthmani: قُل مَن رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ قُلِ اللَّهُ ۚ قُل أَفَاتَّخَذتُم مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ لا يَملِكونَ لِأَنفُسِهِم نَفعًا وَلا ضَرًّا ۚ قُل هَل يَستَوِي الأَعمىٰ وَالبَصيرُ أَم هَل تَستَوِي الظُّلُماتُ وَالنّورُ ۗ أَم جَعَلوا لِلَّهِ شُرَكاءَ خَلَقوا كَخَلقِهِ فَتَشابَهَ الخَلقُ عَلَيهِم ۚ قُلِ اللَّهُ خالِقُ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُوَ الواحِدُ القَهّارُ
blank: qul m rabb s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ qul llāh qul ʾ-f-ttakhadhtum m dūnihī ʾawliyāʾ lā yamlikūn l-ʾanfusihim nafʿ w-lā ḍarr qul hal yastawīl-ʾaʿmā w-l-baṣīr ʾam hal tastawī ẓ-ẓulumāt w-n-nūr ʾam jaʿalū l-llāh shurakāʾ khalaqū k-khalqihī f-tashābahal-khalq ʿalayhim qul llāh khāliq kull shayʾ w-huwal-wāḥidul-qahhār
english_saheeh_international: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and earth?" Say, "Allah." Say, "Have you then taken besides Him allies not possessing even for themselves any benefit or any harm?" Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Or is darkness equivalent to light? Or have they attributed to Allah partners who created like His creation so that the creation of each seemed similar to them?" Say, "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing

arabic_uthmani: أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَسالَت أَودِيَةٌ بِقَدَرِها فَاحتَمَلَ السَّيلُ زَبَدًا رابِيًا ۚ وَمِمّا يوقِدونَ عَلَيهِ فِي النّارِ ابتِغاءَ حِليَةٍ أَو مَتاعٍ زَبَدٌ مِثلُهُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الحَقَّ وَالباطِلَ ۚ فَأَمَّا الزَّبَدُ فَيَذهَبُ جُفاءً ۖ وَأَمّا ما يَنفَعُ النّاسَ فَيَمكُثُ فِي الأَرضِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الأَمثالَ
blank: ʾanzal min s-samāʾ māʾ f-sālat ʾawdiyat b-qadarihā f-ḥtamal s-sayl zabad rābiy w-mimmā yūqidūn ʿalayh fī n-nār btighāʾ ḥilyat ʾaw matāʿ zabad mithluhū k-dhālik yaḍrib llāhul-ḥaqq w-l-bāṭil f-ʾammā z-zabad f-yadhhab jufāʾ w-ʾammā mā yanfaʿ n-nās f-yamkuth fīl-ʾarḍ k-dhālik yaḍrib llāhul-ʾamthāl
english_saheeh_international: He sends down from the sky, rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a rising foam. And from that ore which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils, is a foam like it. Thus Allah presents the example of truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, being cast off; but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth. Thus does Allah present examples

arabic_uthmani: لِلَّذينَ استَجابوا لِرَبِّهِمُ الحُسنىٰ ۚ وَالَّذينَ لَم يَستَجيبوا لَهُ لَو أَنَّ لَهُم ما فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا وَمِثلَهُ مَعَهُ لَافتَدَوا بِهِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم سوءُ الحِسابِ وَمَأواهُم جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئسَ المِهادُ
blank: l-lladhīn stajābū l-rabbihimul-ḥusnā w-lladhīn lam yastajībū lahū law ʾann lahum mā fīl-ʾarḍ jamīʿ w-mithlahū maʿahū l-ftadaw bihī ʾulāʾik lahum sūʾul-ḥisāb w-maʾwāhum jahannam w-biʾsal-mihād
english_saheeh_international: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best reward, but those who did not respond to Him - if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would attempt to ransom themselves thereby. Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place

arabic_uthmani: ۞ أَفَمَن يَعلَمُ أَنَّما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ الحَقُّ كَمَن هُوَ أَعمىٰ ۚ إِنَّما يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُو الأَلبابِ
blank: ʾ-f-m yaʿlam ʾannamā ʾunzil ʾilayk m rabbikal-ḥaqq k-m huw ʾaʿmā ʾinnamā yatadhakkar ʾulūl-ʾalbāb
english_saheeh_international: Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? They will only be reminded who are people of understanding

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ يوفونَ بِعَهدِ اللَّهِ وَلا يَنقُضونَ الميثاقَ
blank: alladhīn yūfūn b-ʿahd llāh w-lā yanquḍūnal-mīthāq
english_saheeh_international: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ يَصِلونَ ما أَمَرَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَن يوصَلَ وَيَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم وَيَخافونَ سوءَ الحِسابِ
blank: w-lladhīn yaṣilūn mā ʾamar llāh bihī ʾ yūṣal w-yakhshawn rabbahum w-yakhāfūn sūʾal-ḥisāb
english_saheeh_international: And those who join that which Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of their account

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ صَبَرُوا ابتِغاءَ وَجهِ رَبِّهِم وَأَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ وَأَنفَقوا مِمّا رَزَقناهُم سِرًّا وَعَلانِيَةً وَيَدرَءونَ بِالحَسَنَةِ السَّيِّئَةَ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عُقبَى الدّارِ
blank: w-lladhīn ṣabarū btighāʾ wajh rabbihim w-ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāt w-ʾanfaqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirr w-ʿalāniyat w-yadraʾūn b-l-ḥasanat s-sayyiʾat ʾulāʾik lahum ʿuqbā d-dār
english_saheeh_international: And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of this home

arabic_uthmani: جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ يَدخُلونَها وَمَن صَلَحَ مِن آبائِهِم وَأَزواجِهِم وَذُرِّيّاتِهِم ۖ وَالمَلائِكَةُ يَدخُلونَ عَلَيهِم مِن كُلِّ بابٍ
blank: jannāt ʿadn yadkhulūnahā w-m ṣalaḥ m ʾābāʾihim w-ʾazwājihim w-dhurriyyātihim w-l-malāʾikat yadkhulūn ʿalayhim m kull bāb
english_saheeh_international: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, saying

arabic_uthmani: سَلامٌ عَلَيكُم بِما صَبَرتُم ۚ فَنِعمَ عُقبَى الدّارِ
blank: salām ʿalaykum b-mā ṣabartum f-niʿm ʿuqbā d-dār
english_saheeh_international: Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. And excellent is the final home

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ يَنقُضونَ عَهدَ اللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ ميثاقِهِ وَيَقطَعونَ ما أَمَرَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَن يوصَلَ وَيُفسِدونَ فِي الأَرضِ ۙ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُمُ اللَّعنَةُ وَلَهُم سوءُ الدّارِ
blank: w-lladhīn yanquḍūn ʿahd llāh m baʿd mīthāqihī w-yaqṭaʿūn mā ʾamar llāh bihī ʾ yūṣal w-yufsidūn fīl-ʾarḍ ʾulāʾik lahumul-laʿnat w-lahum sūʾ d-dār
english_saheeh_international: But those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home

arabic_uthmani: اللَّهُ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ ۚ وَفَرِحوا بِالحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَمَا الحَياةُ الدُّنيا فِي الآخِرَةِ إِلّا مَتاعٌ
blank: allāh yabsuṭ r-rizq l-m yashāʾ w-yaqdir w-fariḥū b-l-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-māl-ḥayāt d-dunyā fīl-ʾākhirat ʾillā matāʿ
english_saheeh_international: Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts it. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except brief enjoyment

arabic_uthmani: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ آيَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ ۗ قُل إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي إِلَيهِ مَن أَنابَ
blank: w-yaqūlulladhīn kafarū law-lā ʾunzil ʿalayh ʾāyat m rabbihī qul ʾinn llāh yuḍill m yashāʾ w-yahdī ʾilayh m ʾanāb
english_saheeh_international: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, O Muhammad, "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back to Him

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَتَطمَئِنُّ قُلوبُهُم بِذِكرِ اللَّهِ ۗ أَلا بِذِكرِ اللَّهِ تَطمَئِنُّ القُلوبُ
blank: alladhīn ʾāmanū w-taṭmaʾinn qulūbuhum b-dhikr llāh ʾ-lā b-dhikr llāh taṭmaʾinnul-qulūb
english_saheeh_international: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ طوبىٰ لَهُم وَحُسنُ مَآبٍ
blank: alladhīn ʾāmanū w-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāt ṭūbā lahum w-ḥusn maʾāb
english_saheeh_international: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return

arabic_uthmani: كَذٰلِكَ أَرسَلناكَ في أُمَّةٍ قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِها أُمَمٌ لِتَتلُوَ عَلَيهِمُ الَّذي أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ وَهُم يَكفُرونَ بِالرَّحمٰنِ ۚ قُل هُوَ رَبّي لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ وَإِلَيهِ مَتابِ
blank: k-dhālik ʾarsalnāk fī ʾummat qad khalat m qablihā ʾumam l-tatluw ʿalayhimulladhī ʾawḥaynā ʾilayk w-hum yakfurūn b-r-raḥmān qul huw rabbī lā ʾilāh ʾillā huw ʿalayh tawakkalt w-ʾilayh matāb
english_saheeh_international: Thus have We sent you to a community before which other communities have passed on so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return

arabic_uthmani: وَلَو أَنَّ قُرآنًا سُيِّرَت بِهِ الجِبالُ أَو قُطِّعَت بِهِ الأَرضُ أَو كُلِّمَ بِهِ المَوتىٰ ۗ بَل لِلَّهِ الأَمرُ جَميعًا ۗ أَفَلَم يَيأَسِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَن لَو يَشاءُ اللَّهُ لَهَدَى النّاسَ جَميعًا ۗ وَلا يَزالُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا تُصيبُهُم بِما صَنَعوا قارِعَةٌ أَو تَحُلُّ قَريبًا مِن دارِهِم حَتّىٰ يَأتِيَ وَعدُ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُخلِفُ الميعادَ
blank: w-law ʾann qurʾān suyyirat bihil-jibāl ʾaw quṭṭiʿat bihil-ʾarḍ ʾaw kullim bihil-mawtā bal l-llāhil-ʾamr jamīʿ ʾ-f-lam yayʾasilladhīn ʾāmanū ʾ law yashāʾ llāh l-hadā n-nās jamīʿ w-lā yazālulladhīn kafarū tuṣībuhum b-mā ṣanaʿū qāriʿat ʾaw taḥull qarībam-m dārihim ḥattā yaʾtiy waʿd llāh ʾinn llāh lā yukhliful-mīʿād
english_saheeh_international: And if there was any qur'an by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, it would be this Qur'an, but to Allah belongs the affair entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allah willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَدِ استُهزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِن قَبلِكَ فَأَملَيتُ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا ثُمَّ أَخَذتُهُم ۖ فَكَيفَ كانَ عِقابِ
blank: w-l-qad stuhziʾ b-rusul m qablik f-ʾamlayt l-lladhīn kafarū thumm ʾakhadhtuhum f-kayf kān ʿiqāb
english_saheeh_international: And already were other messengers ridiculed before you, and I extended the time of those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how terrible was My penalty

arabic_uthmani: أَفَمَن هُوَ قائِمٌ عَلىٰ كُلِّ نَفسٍ بِما كَسَبَت ۗ وَجَعَلوا لِلَّهِ شُرَكاءَ قُل سَمّوهُم ۚ أَم تُنَبِّئونَهُ بِما لا يَعلَمُ فِي الأَرضِ أَم بِظاهِرٍ مِنَ القَولِ ۗ بَل زُيِّنَ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مَكرُهُم وَصُدّوا عَنِ السَّبيلِ ۗ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
blank: ʾ-f-m huw qāʾim ʿalā kull nafs b-mā kasabat w-jaʿalū l-llāh shurakāʾ qul sammūhum ʾam tunabbiʾūnahū b-mā lā yaʿlam fīl-ʾarḍ ʾam b-ẓāhir minal-qawl bal zuyyin l-lladhīn kafarū makruhum w-ṣuddū ʿan s-sabīl w-m yuḍlil llāh f-mā lahū m hād
english_saheeh_international: Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul, knowing what it has earned, like any other? But to Allah they have attributed partners. Say, "Name them. Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth or of what is apparent of speech?" Rather, their own plan has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have been averted from the way. And whomever Allah leaves astray - there will be for him no guide

arabic_uthmani: لَهُم عَذابٌ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلَعَذابُ الآخِرَةِ أَشَقُّ ۖ وَما لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن واقٍ
blank: lahum ʿadhāb fīl-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-l-ʿadhābul-ʾākhirat ʾashaqq w-mā lahum min llāh m wāq
english_saheeh_international: For them will be punishment in the life of this world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allah any protector

arabic_uthmani: ۞ مَثَلُ الجَنَّةِ الَّتي وُعِدَ المُتَّقونَ ۖ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ أُكُلُها دائِمٌ وَظِلُّها ۚ تِلكَ عُقبَى الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا ۖ وَعُقبَى الكافِرينَ النّارُ
blank: mathalul-jannat llatī wuʿidal-muttaqūn tajrī m taḥtihāl-ʾanhār ʾukuluhā dāʾim w-ẓilluhā tilk ʿuqbālladhīn ttaqaw w-ʿuqbāl-kāfirīn n-nār
english_saheeh_international: The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is that beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire

arabic_uthmani: وَالَّذينَ آتَيناهُمُ الكِتابَ يَفرَحونَ بِما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ ۖ وَمِنَ الأَحزابِ مَن يُنكِرُ بَعضَهُ ۚ قُل إِنَّما أُمِرتُ أَن أَعبُدَ اللَّهَ وَلا أُشرِكَ بِهِ ۚ إِلَيهِ أَدعو وَإِلَيهِ مَآبِ
blank: w-lladhīn ʾātaynāhumul-kitāb yafraḥūn b-mā ʾunzil ʾilayk w-minal-ʾaḥzāb m yunkir baʿḍahū qul ʾinnamā ʾumirt ʾ ʾaʿbud llāh w-lā ʾushrik bihī ʾilayh ʾadʿū w-ʾilayh maʾāb
english_saheeh_international: And the believers among those to whom We have given the previous Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, O Muhammad, but among the opposing factions are those who deny part of it. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not associate anything with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return

arabic_uthmani: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَنزَلناهُ حُكمًا عَرَبِيًّا ۚ وَلَئِنِ اتَّبَعتَ أَهواءَهُم بَعدَما جاءَكَ مِنَ العِلمِ ما لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا واقٍ
blank: w-k-dhālik ʾanzalnāh ḥukm ʿarabiyy w-l-ʾin ttabaʿt ʾahwāʾahum baʿd mā jāʾak minal-ʿilm mā lak min llāh m waliyy w-lā wāq
english_saheeh_international: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allah any ally or any protector

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا رُسُلًا مِن قَبلِكَ وَجَعَلنا لَهُم أَزواجًا وَذُرِّيَّةً ۚ وَما كانَ لِرَسولٍ أَن يَأتِيَ بِآيَةٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۗ لِكُلِّ أَجَلٍ كِتابٌ
blank: w-l-qad ʾarsalnā rusulam-m qablik w-jaʿalnā lahum ʾazwāj w-dhurriyyat w-mā kān l-rasūl ʾ yaʾtiy b-ʾāyat ʾillā b-ʾidhn llāh l-kull ʾajal kitāb
english_saheeh_international: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree

arabic_uthmani: يَمحُو اللَّهُ ما يَشاءُ وَيُثبِتُ ۖ وَعِندَهُ أُمُّ الكِتابِ
blank: yamḥū llāh mā yashāʾ w-yuthbit w-ʿindahū ʾummul-kitāb
english_saheeh_international: Allah eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book
