So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among the speculators from anyone

arabic_uthmani: وَلا تَقولَنَّ لِشَيءٍ إِنّي فاعِلٌ ذٰلِكَ غَدًا
blank: w-lā taqūlann l-shayʾ ʾinnī fāʿil dhālik ghad
english_saheeh_international: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow

arabic_uthmani: إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ وَاذكُر رَبَّكَ إِذا نَسيتَ وَقُل عَسىٰ أَن يَهدِيَنِ رَبّي لِأَقرَبَ مِن هٰذا رَشَدًا
blank: ʾillā ʾ yashāʾ llāh w-dhkur rabbak ʾidhā nasīt w-qul ʿasā ʾ yahdiyan rabbī l-ʾaqrab m hādhā rashad
english_saheeh_international: Except when adding, "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget it and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct

arabic_uthmani: وَلَبِثوا في كَهفِهِم ثَلاثَ مِائَةٍ سِنينَ وَازدادوا تِسعًا
blank: w-labithū fī kahfihim thalāth miʾat sinīn w-zdādū tisʿ
english_saheeh_international: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine

arabic_uthmani: قُلِ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما لَبِثوا ۖ لَهُ غَيبُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ أَبصِر بِهِ وَأَسمِع ۚ ما لَهُم مِن دونِهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا يُشرِكُ في حُكمِهِ أَحَدًا
blank: qul llāh ʾaʿlam b-mā labithū lahū ghayb s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ ʾabṣir bihī w-ʾasmiʿ mā lahum m dūnihī m waliyy w-lā yushrik fī ḥukmihī ʾaḥad
english_saheeh_international: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has knowledge of the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone

arabic_uthmani: وَاتلُ ما أوحِيَ إِلَيكَ مِن كِتابِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِماتِهِ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دونِهِ مُلتَحَدًا
blank: w-tl mā ʾūḥiy ʾilayk m kitāb rabbik lā mubaddil l-kalimātihī w-l tajid m dūnihī multaḥad
english_saheeh_international: And recite, O Muhammad, what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge

arabic_uthmani: وَاصبِر نَفسَكَ مَعَ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَداةِ وَالعَشِيِّ يُريدونَ وَجهَهُ ۖ وَلا تَعدُ عَيناكَ عَنهُم تُريدُ زينَةَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلا تُطِع مَن أَغفَلنا قَلبَهُ عَن ذِكرِنا وَاتَّبَعَ هَواهُ وَكانَ أَمرُهُ فُرُطًا
blank: w-ṣbir nafsak maʿalladhīn yadʿūn rabbahum b-l-ghadāt w-l-ʿashiyy yurīdūn wajhahū w-lā taʿd ʿaynāk ʿanhum turīd zīnatal-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-lā tuṭiʿ m ʾaghfalnā qalbahū ʿ dhikrinā w-ttabaʿ hawāh w-kān ʾamruhū furuṭ
english_saheeh_international: And keep yourself patient by being with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever in neglect

arabic_uthmani: وَقُلِ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكُم ۖ فَمَن شاءَ فَليُؤمِن وَمَن شاءَ فَليَكفُر ۚ إِنّا أَعتَدنا لِلظّالِمينَ نارًا أَحاطَ بِهِم سُرادِقُها ۚ وَإِن يَستَغيثوا يُغاثوا بِماءٍ كَالمُهلِ يَشوِي الوُجوهَ ۚ بِئسَ الشَّرابُ وَساءَت مُرتَفَقًا
blank: w-qulil-ḥaqq m rabbikum f-m shāʾ f-l-yuʾm w-m shāʾ f-l-yakfur ʾinnā ʾaʿtadnā l-ẓ-ẓālimīn nār ʾaḥāṭ bihim surādiquhā w-ʾ yastaghīthū yughāthū b-māʾ k-l-muhl yashwīl-wujūh biʾs sh-sharāb w-sāʾat murtafaq
english_saheeh_international: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds their faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ إِنّا لا نُضيعُ أَجرَ مَن أَحسَنَ عَمَلًا
blank: ʾinnalladhīn ʾāmanū w-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāt ʾinnā lā nuḍīʿ ʾajr m ʾaḥsan ʿamal
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهِمُ الأَنهارُ يُحَلَّونَ فيها مِن أَساوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَيَلبَسونَ ثِيابًا خُضرًا مِن سُندُسٍ وَإِستَبرَقٍ مُتَّكِئينَ فيها عَلَى الأَرائِكِ ۚ نِعمَ الثَّوابُ وَحَسُنَت مُرتَفَقًا
blank: ʾulāʾik lahum jannāt ʿadn tajrī m taḥtihimul-ʾanhār yuḥallawn fīhā m ʾasāwir m dhahab w-yalbasūn thiyāb khuḍram-m sundus w-ʾistabraq muttakiʾīn fīhā ʿalāl-ʾarāʾik niʿm th-thawāb w-ḥasunat murtafaq
english_saheeh_international: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلًا رَجُلَينِ جَعَلنا لِأَحَدِهِما جَنَّتَينِ مِن أَعنابٍ وَحَفَفناهُما بِنَخلٍ وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُما زَرعًا
blank: w-ḍrib lahum mathal rajulayn jaʿalnā l-ʾaḥadihimā jannatayn m ʾaʿnāb w-ḥafafnāhumā b-nakhl w-jaʿalnā baynahumā zarʿ
english_saheeh_international: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them fields of crops

arabic_uthmani: كِلتَا الجَنَّتَينِ آتَت أُكُلَها وَلَم تَظلِم مِنهُ شَيئًا ۚ وَفَجَّرنا خِلالَهُما نَهَرًا
blank: kiltāl-jannatayn ʾātat ʾukulahā w-lam taẓlim minh shayʾ w-fajjarnā khilālahumā nahar
english_saheeh_international: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river

arabic_uthmani: وَكانَ لَهُ ثَمَرٌ فَقالَ لِصاحِبِهِ وَهُوَ يُحاوِرُهُ أَنا أَكثَرُ مِنكَ مالًا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًا
blank: w-kān lahū thamar f-qāl l-ṣāḥibihī w-huw yuḥāwiruhū ʾan ʾakthar mink māl w-ʾaʿazz nafar
english_saheeh_international: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in numbers of men

arabic_uthmani: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُ وَهُوَ ظالِمٌ لِنَفسِهِ قالَ ما أَظُنُّ أَن تَبيدَ هٰذِهِ أَبَدًا
blank: w-dakhal jannatahū w-huw ẓālim l-nafsihī qāl mā ʾaẓunn ʾ tabīd hādhihī ʾabad
english_saheeh_international: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever

arabic_uthmani: وَما أَظُنُّ السّاعَةَ قائِمَةً وَلَئِن رُدِدتُ إِلىٰ رَبّي لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيرًا مِنها مُنقَلَبًا
blank: w-mā ʾaẓunn s-sāʿat qāʾimat w-l-ʾ rudidt ʾilā rabbī l-ʾajidann khayram-minhā munqalab
english_saheeh_international: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لَهُ صاحِبُهُ وَهُوَ يُحاوِرُهُ أَكَفَرتَ بِالَّذي خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ سَوّاكَ رَجُلًا
blank: qāl lahū ṣāḥibuhū w-huw yuḥāwiruhū ʾ-kafart b-lladhī khalaqak m turāb thumm m nuṭfat thumm sawwāk rajul
english_saheeh_international: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you as a man

arabic_uthmani: لٰكِنّا هُوَ اللَّهُ رَبّي وَلا أُشرِكُ بِرَبّي أَحَدًا
blank: lākinn huw llāh rabbī w-lā ʾushrik b-rabbī ʾaḥad
english_saheeh_international: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone

arabic_uthmani: وَلَولا إِذ دَخَلتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلتَ ما شاءَ اللَّهُ لا قُوَّةَ إِلّا بِاللَّهِ ۚ إِن تَرَنِ أَنا أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مالًا وَوَلَدًا
blank: w-law-lā ʾidh dakhalt jannatak qult mā shāʾ llāh lā quwwat ʾillā b-llāh ʾ taran ʾan ʾaqall mink māl w-walad
english_saheeh_international: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed has occurred; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children

arabic_uthmani: فَعَسىٰ رَبّي أَن يُؤتِيَنِ خَيرًا مِن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرسِلَ عَلَيها حُسبانًا مِنَ السَّماءِ فَتُصبِحَ صَعيدًا زَلَقًا
blank: f-ʿasā rabbī ʾ yuʾtiyan khayram-m jannatik w-yursil ʿalayhā ḥusbānam-min s-samāʾ f-tuṣbiḥ ṣaʿīd zalaq
english_saheeh_international: It may be that my Lord will give me something better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground

arabic_uthmani: أَو يُصبِحَ ماؤُها غَورًا فَلَن تَستَطيعَ لَهُ طَلَبًا
blank: ʾaw yuṣbiḥ māʾuhā ghawr f-l tastaṭīʿ lahū ṭalab
english_saheeh_international: Or its water will become sunken into the earth, so you would never be able to seek it

arabic_uthmani: وَأُحيطَ بِثَمَرِهِ فَأَصبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيهِ عَلىٰ ما أَنفَقَ فيها وَهِيَ خاوِيَةٌ عَلىٰ عُروشِها وَيَقولُ يا لَيتَني لَم أُشرِك بِرَبّي أَحَدًا
blank: w-ʾuḥīṭ b-thamarihī f-ʾaṣbaḥ yuqallib kaffayh ʿalā mā ʾanfaq fīhā w-hiy khāwiyat ʿalā ʿurūshihā w-yaqūl yā-laytanī lam ʾushrik b-rabbī ʾaḥad
english_saheeh_international: And his fruits were encompassed by ruin, so he began to turn his hands about in dismay over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone

arabic_uthmani: وَلَم تَكُن لَهُ فِئَةٌ يَنصُرونَهُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَما كانَ مُنتَصِرًا
blank: w-lam tak lahū fiʾat yanṣurūnahū m dūn llāh w-mā kān muntaṣir
english_saheeh_international: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself

arabic_uthmani: هُنالِكَ الوَلايَةُ لِلَّهِ الحَقِّ ۚ هُوَ خَيرٌ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ عُقبًا
blank: hunālikal-walāyat l-llāhil-ḥaqq huw khayr thawāb w-khayr ʿuqb
english_saheeh_international: There the authority is completely for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome

arabic_uthmani: وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا كَماءٍ أَنزَلناهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَاختَلَطَ بِهِ نَباتُ الأَرضِ فَأَصبَحَ هَشيمًا تَذروهُ الرِّياحُ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ مُقتَدِرًا
blank: w-ḍrib lahum mathalal-ḥayāt d-dunyā k-māʾ ʾanzalnāh min s-samāʾ f-khtalaṭ bihī nabātul-ʾarḍ f-ʾaṣbaḥ hashīm tadhrūh r-riyāḥ w-kān llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ muqtadir-
english_saheeh_international: And present to them the example of the life of this world, its being like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and then it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability

arabic_uthmani: المالُ وَالبَنونَ زينَةُ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَالباقِياتُ الصّالِحاتُ خَيرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ أَمَلًا
blank: al-māl w-l-banūn zīnatul-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-l-bāqiyāt ṣ-ṣāliḥāt khayr ʿind rabbik thawāb w-khayr ʾamal
english_saheeh_international: Wealth and children are but adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for one's hope

arabic_uthmani: وَيَومَ نُسَيِّرُ الجِبالَ وَتَرَى الأَرضَ بارِزَةً وَحَشَرناهُم فَلَم نُغادِر مِنهُم أَحَدًا
blank: w-yawm nusayyirul-jibāl w-tarāl-ʾarḍ bārizat w-ḥasharnāhum f-lam nughādir minhum ʾaḥad
english_saheeh_international: And warn of the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone

arabic_uthmani: وَعُرِضوا عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّا لَقَد جِئتُمونا كَما خَلَقناكُم أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۚ بَل زَعَمتُم أَلَّن نَجعَلَ لَكُم مَوعِدًا
blank: w-ʿuriḍū ʿalā rabbik ṣaff l-qad jiʾtumūnā k-mā khalaqnākum ʾawwal marrat bal zaʿamtum ʾal-l najʿal lakum mawʿid
english_saheeh_international: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, and He will say, "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment

arabic_uthmani: وَوُضِعَ الكِتابُ فَتَرَى المُجرِمينَ مُشفِقينَ مِمّا فيهِ وَيَقولونَ يا وَيلَتَنا مالِ هٰذَا الكِتابِ لا يُغادِرُ صَغيرَةً وَلا كَبيرَةً إِلّا أَحصاها ۚ وَوَجَدوا ما عَمِلوا حاضِرًا ۗ وَلا يَظلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًا
blank: w-wuḍiʿal-kitāb f-tarāl-mujrimīn mushfiqīn mimmā fīh w-yaqūlūn yā-waylatanā mā-l hādhāl-kitāb lā yughādir ṣaghīrat w-lā kabīrat ʾillā ʾaḥṣāhā w-wajadū mā ʿamilū ḥāḍir w-lā yaẓlim rabbuk ʾaḥad
english_saheeh_international: And the record of deeds will be placed open, and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present before them. And your Lord does injustice to no one

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلائِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ كانَ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَن أَمرِ رَبِّهِ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذونَهُ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُ أَولِياءَ مِن دوني وَهُم لَكُم عَدُوٌّ ۚ بِئسَ لِلظّالِمينَ بَدَلًا
blank: w-ʾidh qulnā l-l-malāʾikat sjudū l-ʾādam f-sajadū ʾillā ʾiblīs kān minal-jinn f-fasaq ʿ ʾamr rabbihī ʾ-f-tattakhidhūnahū w-dhurriyyatahū ʾawliyāʾ m dūnī w-hum lakum ʿaduww biʾs l-ẓ-ẓālimīn badal
english_saheeh_international: And mention when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange

arabic_uthmani: ۞ ما أَشهَدتُهُم خَلقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلا خَلقَ أَنفُسِهِم وَما كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ المُضِلّينَ عَضُدًا
blank: mā ʾashhadtuhum khalq s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-lā khalq ʾanfusihim w-mā kunt muttakhidhal-muḍillīn ʿaḍud
english_saheeh_international: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants

arabic_uthmani: وَيَومَ يَقولُ نادوا شُرَكائِيَ الَّذينَ زَعَمتُم فَدَعَوهُم فَلَم يَستَجيبوا لَهُم وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُم مَوبِقًا
blank: w-yawm yaqūl nādū shurakāʾiyalladhīn zaʿamtum f-daʿawhum f-lam yastajībū lahum w-jaʿalnā baynahum mawbiq
english_saheeh_international: And warn of the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them a valley of destruction

arabic_uthmani: وَرَأَى المُجرِمونَ النّارَ فَظَنّوا أَنَّهُم مُواقِعوها وَلَم يَجِدوا عَنها مَصرِفًا
blank: w-raʾāl-mujrimūn n-nār f-ẓannū ʾannahum muwāqiʿūhā w-lam yajidū ʿanhā maṣrif
english_saheeh_international: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا في هٰذَا القُرآنِ لِلنّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ ۚ وَكانَ الإِنسانُ أَكثَرَ شَيءٍ جَدَلًا
blank: w-l-qad ṣarrafnā fī hādhāl-qurʾān l-n-nās m kull mathal w-kānal-ʾinsān ʾakthar shayʾ jadal
english_saheeh_international: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every kind of example; but man has ever been, most of anything, prone to dispute

arabic_uthmani: وَما مَنَعَ النّاسَ أَن يُؤمِنوا إِذ جاءَهُمُ الهُدىٰ وَيَستَغفِروا رَبَّهُم إِلّا أَن تَأتِيَهُم سُنَّةُ الأَوَّلينَ أَو يَأتِيَهُمُ العَذابُ قُبُلًا
blank: w-mā manaʿ n-nās ʾ yuʾminū ʾidh jāʾahumul-hudā w-yastaghfirū rabbahum ʾillā ʾ taʾtiyahum sunnatul-ʾawwalīn ʾaw yaʾtiyahumul-ʿadhāb qubul
english_saheeh_international: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there must befall them the accustomed precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come directly before them

arabic_uthmani: وَما نُرسِلُ المُرسَلينَ إِلّا مُبَشِّرينَ وَمُنذِرينَ ۚ وَيُجادِلُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِالباطِلِ لِيُدحِضوا بِهِ الحَقَّ ۖ وَاتَّخَذوا آياتي وَما أُنذِروا هُزُوًا
blank: w-mā nursilul-mursalīn ʾillā mubashshirīn w-mundhirīn w-yujādilulladhīn kafarū b-l-bāṭil l-yudḥiḍū bihil-ḥaqq w-ttakhadhū ʾāyātī w-mā ʾundhirū huzuw
english_saheeh_international: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by using falsehood to attempt to invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule

arabic_uthmani: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِآياتِ رَبِّهِ فَأَعرَضَ عَنها وَنَسِيَ ما قَدَّمَت يَداهُ ۚ إِنّا جَعَلنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفقَهوهُ وَفي آذانِهِم وَقرًا ۖ وَإِن تَدعُهُم إِلَى الهُدىٰ فَلَن يَهتَدوا إِذًا أَبَدًا
blank: w-m ʾaẓlam mimm dhukkir b-ʾāyāt rabbihī f-ʾaʿraḍ ʿanhā w-nasiy mā qaddamat yadāh ʾinnā jaʿalnā ʿalā qulūbihim ʾakinnat ʾ yafqahūh w-fī ʾādhānihim waqr w-ʾ tadʿuhum ʾilāl-hudā f-l yahtadū ʾidh ʾabad
english_saheeh_international: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever

arabic_uthmani: وَرَبُّكَ الغَفورُ ذُو الرَّحمَةِ ۖ لَو يُؤاخِذُهُم بِما كَسَبوا لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ العَذابَ ۚ بَل لَهُم مَوعِدٌ لَن يَجِدوا مِن دونِهِ مَوئِلًا
blank: w-rabbukal-ghafūr dhū r-raḥmat law yuʾākhidhuhum b-mā kasabū l-ʿajjal lahumul-ʿadhāb bal lahum mawʿid l yajidū m dūnihī mawʾil
english_saheeh_international: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape

arabic_uthmani: وَتِلكَ القُرىٰ أَهلَكناهُم لَمّا ظَلَموا وَجَعَلنا لِمَهلِكِهِم مَوعِدًا
blank: w-tilkal-qurā ʾahlaknāhum lammā ẓalamū w-jaʿalnā l-mahlikihim mawʿid
english_saheeh_international: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِفَتاهُ لا أَبرَحُ حَتّىٰ أَبلُغَ مَجمَعَ البَحرَينِ أَو أَمضِيَ حُقُبًا
blank: w-ʾidh qāl mūsā l-fatāh lā ʾabraḥ ḥattā ʾablugh majmaʿal-baḥrayn ʾaw ʾamḍiy ḥuqub
english_saheeh_international: And mention when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease traveling until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا بَلَغا مَجمَعَ بَينِهِما نَسِيا حوتَهُما فَاتَّخَذَ سَبيلَهُ فِي البَحرِ سَرَبًا
blank: f-lammā balaghā majmaʿ baynihimā nasiyā ḥūtahumā f-ttakhadh sabīlahū fīl-baḥr sarab
english_saheeh_international: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا جاوَزا قالَ لِفَتاهُ آتِنا غَداءَنا لَقَد لَقينا مِن سَفَرِنا هٰذا نَصَبًا
blank: f-lammā jāwazā qāl l-fatāh ʾātinā ghadāʾanā l-qad laqīnā m safarinā hādhā naṣab
english_saheeh_international: So when they had passed beyond it, Moses said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, much fatigue

arabic_uthmani: قالَ أَرَأَيتَ إِذ أَوَينا إِلَى الصَّخرَةِ فَإِنّي نَسيتُ الحوتَ وَما أَنسانيهُ إِلَّا الشَّيطانُ أَن أَذكُرَهُ ۚ وَاتَّخَذَ سَبيلَهُ فِي البَحرِ عَجَبًا
blank: qāl ʾ-raʾayt ʾidh ʾawaynā ʾilā ṣ-ṣakhrat f-ʾinnī nasītul-ḥūt w-mā ʾansānīh ʾillā sh-shayṭān ʾ ʾadhkurahū w-ttakhadh sabīlahū fīl-baḥr ʿajab
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot there the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly

arabic_uthmani: قالَ ذٰلِكَ ما كُنّا نَبغِ ۚ فَارتَدّا عَلىٰ آثارِهِما قَصَصًا
blank: qāl dhālik mā kunnā nabgh f-rtaddā ʿalā ʾāthārihimā qaṣaṣ
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints

arabic_uthmani: فَوَجَدا عَبدًا مِن عِبادِنا آتَيناهُ رَحمَةً مِن عِندِنا وَعَلَّمناهُ مِن لَدُنّا عِلمًا
blank: f-wajadā ʿabdam-m ʿibādinā ʾātaynāh raḥmatam-m ʿindinā w-ʿallamnāh m ladunnā ʿilm
english_saheeh_international: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a certain knowledge

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لَهُ موسىٰ هَل أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلىٰ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمّا عُلِّمتَ رُشدًا
blank: qāl lahū mūsā hal ʾattabiʿuk ʿalā ʾ tuʿalliman mimmā ʿullimt rushd
english_saheeh_international: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on the condition that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement

arabic_uthmani: قالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِيَ صَبرًا
blank: qāl ʾinnak l tastaṭīʿ maʿiy ṣabr
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience

arabic_uthmani: وَكَيفَ تَصبِرُ عَلىٰ ما لَم تُحِط بِهِ خُبرًا
blank: w-kayf taṣbir ʿalā mā lam tuḥiṭ bihī khubr
english_saheeh_international: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge

arabic_uthmani: قالَ سَتَجِدُني إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ صابِرًا وَلا أَعصي لَكَ أَمرًا
blank: qāl s-tajidunī ʾ shāʾ llāh ṣābir w-lā ʾaʿṣī lak ʾamr
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in any order

arabic_uthmani: قالَ فَإِنِ اتَّبَعتَني فَلا تَسأَلني عَن شَيءٍ حَتّىٰ أُحدِثَ لَكَ مِنهُ ذِكرًا
blank: qāl f-ʾin ttabaʿtanī f-lā tasʾalnī ʿ shayʾ ḥattā ʾuḥdith lak minh dhikr
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention

arabic_uthmani: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا رَكِبا فِي السَّفينَةِ خَرَقَها ۖ قالَ أَخَرَقتَها لِتُغرِقَ أَهلَها لَقَد جِئتَ شَيئًا إِمرًا
blank: f-nṭalaqā ḥattā ʾidhā rakibā fī s-safīnat kharaqahā qāl ʾ-kharaqtahā l-tughriq ʾahlahā l-qad jiʾt shayʾ ʾimr
english_saheeh_international: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. Moses said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing

arabic_uthmani: قالَ أَلَم أَقُل إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِيَ صَبرًا
blank: qāl ʾ-lam ʾaqul ʾinnak l tastaṭīʿ maʿiy ṣabr
english_saheeh_international: Al-Khidh r said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لا تُؤاخِذني بِما نَسيتُ وَلا تُرهِقني مِن أَمري عُسرًا
blank: qāl lā tuʾākhidhnī b-mā nasīt w-lā turhiqnī m ʾamrī ʿusr
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty

arabic_uthmani: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا لَقِيا غُلامًا فَقَتَلَهُ قالَ أَقَتَلتَ نَفسًا زَكِيَّةً بِغَيرِ نَفسٍ لَقَد جِئتَ شَيئًا نُكرًا
blank: f-nṭalaqā ḥattā ʾidhā laqiyā ghulām f-qatalahū qāl ʾ-qatalt nafs zakiyyat b-ghayr nafs l-qad jiʾt shayʾ nukr
english_saheeh_international: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. Moses said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than having killed a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing

arabic_uthmani: ۞ قالَ أَلَم أَقُل لَكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِيَ صَبرًا
blank: qāl ʾ-lam ʾaqul lak ʾinnak l tastaṭīʿ maʿiy ṣabr
english_saheeh_international: Al-Khidh r said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience

arabic_uthmani: قالَ إِن سَأَلتُكَ عَن شَيءٍ بَعدَها فَلا تُصاحِبني ۖ قَد بَلَغتَ مِن لَدُنّي عُذرًا
blank: qāl ʾ saʾaltuk ʿ shayʾ baʿdahā f-lā tuṣāḥibnī qad balaght m ladunnī ʿudhr
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse

arabic_uthmani: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا أَتَيا أَهلَ قَريَةٍ استَطعَما أَهلَها فَأَبَوا أَن يُضَيِّفوهُما فَوَجَدا فيها جِدارًا يُريدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقامَهُ ۖ قالَ لَو شِئتَ لَاتَّخَذتَ عَلَيهِ أَجرًا
blank: f-nṭalaqā ḥattā ʾidhā ʾatayā ʾahl qaryat- staṭʿamā ʾahlahā f-ʾabaw ʾ yuḍayyifūhumā f-wajadā fīhā jidār yurīd ʾ yanqaḍḍ f-ʾaqāmahū qāl law shiʾt l-ttakhadht ʿalayh ʾajr
english_saheeh_international: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. Moses said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment

arabic_uthmani: قالَ هٰذا فِراقُ بَيني وَبَينِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأويلِ ما لَم تَستَطِع عَلَيهِ صَبرًا
blank: qāl hādhā firāq baynī w-baynik s-ʾunabbiʾuk b-taʾwīl mā lam tastaṭiʿ ʿalayh ṣabr
english_saheeh_international: Al-Khidh r said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience

arabic_uthmani: أَمَّا السَّفينَةُ فَكانَت لِمَساكينَ يَعمَلونَ فِي البَحرِ فَأَرَدتُ أَن أَعيبَها وَكانَ وَراءَهُم مَلِكٌ يَأخُذُ كُلَّ سَفينَةٍ غَصبًا
blank: ʾammā s-safīnat f-kānat l-masākīn yaʿmalūn fīl-baḥr f-ʾaradt ʾ ʾaʿībahā w-kān warāʾahum malik yaʾkhudh kull safīnat ghaṣb
english_saheeh_international: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every good ship by force

arabic_uthmani: وَأَمَّا الغُلامُ فَكانَ أَبَواهُ مُؤمِنَينِ فَخَشينا أَن يُرهِقَهُما طُغيانًا وَكُفرًا
blank: w-ʾammāl-ghulām f-kānā ʾabawāh muʾminayn f-khashīnā ʾ yurhiqahumā ṭughyān w-kufr
english_saheeh_international: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief

arabic_uthmani: فَأَرَدنا أَن يُبدِلَهُما رَبُّهُما خَيرًا مِنهُ زَكاةً وَأَقرَبَ رُحمًا
blank: f-ʾaradnā ʾ yubdilahumā rabbuhumā khayram-minh zakāt w-ʾaqrab ruḥm
english_saheeh_international: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy

arabic_uthmani: وَأَمَّا الجِدارُ فَكانَ لِغُلامَينِ يَتيمَينِ فِي المَدينَةِ وَكانَ تَحتَهُ كَنزٌ لَهُما وَكانَ أَبوهُما صالِحًا فَأَرادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبلُغا أَشُدَّهُما وَيَستَخرِجا كَنزَهُما رَحمَةً مِن رَبِّكَ ۚ وَما فَعَلتُهُ عَن أَمري ۚ ذٰلِكَ تَأويلُ ما لَم تَسطِع عَلَيهِ صَبرًا
blank: w-ʾammāl-jidār f-kān l-ghulāmayn yatīmayn fīl-madīnat w-kān taḥtahū kanz lahumā w-kān ʾabūhumā ṣāliḥ f-ʾarād rabbuk ʾ yablughā ʾashuddahumā w-yastakhrijā kanzahumā raḥmatam-m rabbik w-mā faʿaltuhū ʿ ʾamrī dhālik taʾwīl mā lam tasṭiʿ ʿalayh ṣabr
english_saheeh_international: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience

arabic_uthmani: وَيَسأَلونَكَ عَن ذِي القَرنَينِ ۖ قُل سَأَتلو عَلَيكُم مِنهُ ذِكرًا
blank: w-yasʾalūnak ʿ dhīl-qarnayn qul s-ʾatlū ʿalaykum minh dhikr
english_saheeh_international: And they ask you, O Muhammad, about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report

arabic_uthmani: إِنّا مَكَّنّا لَهُ فِي الأَرضِ وَآتَيناهُ مِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ سَبَبًا
blank: ʾinnā makkannā lahū fīl-ʾarḍ w-ʾātaynāh m kull shayʾ sabab
english_saheeh_international: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way

arabic_uthmani: فَأَتبَعَ سَبَبًا
blank: f-ʾatbaʿ sabab
english_saheeh_international: So he followed a way

arabic_uthmani: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ مَغرِبَ الشَّمسِ وَجَدَها تَغرُبُ في عَينٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَها قَومًا ۗ قُلنا يا ذَا القَرنَينِ إِمّا أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمّا أَن تَتَّخِذَ فيهِم حُسنًا
blank: ḥattā ʾidhā balagh maghrib sh-shams wajadahā taghrub fī ʿayn ḥamiʾat w-wajad ʿindahā qawm qulnā yā-dhāl-qarnayn ʾimmā ʾ tuʿadhdhib w-ʾimmā ʾ tattakhidh fīhim ḥusn
english_saheeh_international: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it as if setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish them or else adopt among them a way of goodness

arabic_uthmani: قالَ أَمّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوفَ نُعَذِّبُهُ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ فَيُعَذِّبُهُ عَذابًا نُكرًا
blank: qāl ʾammā m ẓalam f-sawf nuʿadhdhibuhū thumm yuradd ʾilā rabbihī f-yuʿadhdhibuhū ʿadhāb nukr
english_saheeh_international: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment

arabic_uthmani: وَأَمّا مَن آمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَلَهُ جَزاءً الحُسنىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقولُ لَهُ مِن أَمرِنا يُسرًا
blank: w-ʾammā m ʾāman w-ʿamil ṣāliḥ f-lahū jazāʾ-il-ḥusnā w-s-naqūl lahū m ʾamrinā yusr
english_saheeh_international: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ أَتبَعَ سَبَبًا
blank: thumm ʾatbaʿ sabab
english_saheeh_international: Then he followed a way

arabic_uthmani: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ مَطلِعَ الشَّمسِ وَجَدَها تَطلُعُ عَلىٰ قَومٍ لَم نَجعَل لَهُم مِن دونِها سِترًا
blank: ḥattā ʾidhā balagh maṭliʿ sh-shams wajadahā taṭluʿ ʿalā qawm lam najʿal lahum m dūnihā sitr
english_saheeh_international: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield

arabic_uthmani: كَذٰلِكَ وَقَد أَحَطنا بِما لَدَيهِ خُبرًا
blank: k-dhālik w-qad ʾaḥaṭnā b-mā ladayh khubr
english_saheeh_international: Thus. And We had encompassed all that he had in knowledge

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ أَتبَعَ سَبَبًا
blank: thumm ʾatbaʿ sabab
english_saheeh_international: Then he followed a way

arabic_uthmani: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ بَينَ السَّدَّينِ وَجَدَ مِن دونِهِما قَومًا لا يَكادونَ يَفقَهونَ قَولًا
blank: ḥattā ʾidhā balagh bayn s-saddayn wajad m dūnihimā qawm lā yakādūn yafqahūn qawl
english_saheeh_international: Until, when he reached a pass between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand his speech

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا ذَا القَرنَينِ إِنَّ يَأجوجَ وَمَأجوجَ مُفسِدونَ فِي الأَرضِ فَهَل نَجعَلُ لَكَ خَرجًا عَلىٰ أَن تَجعَلَ بَينَنا وَبَينَهُم سَدًّا
blank: qālū yā-dhāl-qarnayn ʾinn yaʾjūj w-maʾjūj mufsidūn fīl-ʾarḍ f-hal najʿal lak kharj ʿalā ʾ tajʿal baynanā w-baynahum sadd
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are great corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier

arabic_uthmani: قالَ ما مَكَّنّي فيهِ رَبّي خَيرٌ فَأَعينوني بِقُوَّةٍ أَجعَل بَينَكُم وَبَينَهُم رَدمًا
blank: qāl mā makkannī fīh rabbī khayr f-ʾaʿīnūnī b-quwwat ʾajʿal baynakum w-baynahum radm
english_saheeh_international: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better than what you offer, but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam

arabic_uthmani: آتوني زُبَرَ الحَديدِ ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا ساوىٰ بَينَ الصَّدَفَينِ قالَ انفُخوا ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا جَعَلَهُ نارًا قالَ آتوني أُفرِغ عَلَيهِ قِطرًا
blank: ʾātūnī zubaral-ḥadīd ḥattā ʾidhā sāwā bayn ṣ-ṣadafayn qāl nfukhū ḥattā ʾidhā jaʿalahū nār qāl ʾātūnī ʾufrigh ʿalayh qiṭr
english_saheeh_international: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled them between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow with bellows," until when he had made it like fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper

arabic_uthmani: فَمَا اسطاعوا أَن يَظهَروهُ وَمَا استَطاعوا لَهُ نَقبًا
blank: f-mā sṭāʿū ʾ yaẓharūh w-mā staṭāʿū lahū naqb
english_saheeh_international: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able to effect in it any penetration

arabic_uthmani: قالَ هٰذا رَحمَةٌ مِن رَبّي ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ رَبّي جَعَلَهُ دَكّاءَ ۖ وَكانَ وَعدُ رَبّي حَقًّا
blank: qāl hādhā raḥmat m rabbī f-ʾidhā jāʾ waʿd rabbī jaʿalahū dakkāʾ w-kān waʿd rabbī ḥaqq
english_saheeh_international: Dhul-Qarnayn said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَتَرَكنا بَعضَهُم يَومَئِذٍ يَموجُ في بَعضٍ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ فَجَمَعناهُم جَمعًا
blank: w-taraknā baʿḍahum yawmaʾidh yamūj fī baʿḍ w-nufikh fī ṣ-ṣūr f-jamaʿnāhum jamʿ
english_saheeh_international: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and then the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in one assembly

arabic_uthmani: وَعَرَضنا جَهَنَّمَ يَومَئِذٍ لِلكافِرينَ عَرضًا
blank: w-ʿaraḍnā jahannam yawmaʾidh l-l-kāfirīn ʿarḍ-
english_saheeh_international: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ كانَت أَعيُنُهُم في غِطاءٍ عَن ذِكري وَكانوا لا يَستَطيعونَ سَمعًا
blank: alladhīn kānat ʾaʿyunuhum fī ghiṭāʾ ʿ dhikrī w-kānū lā yastaṭīʿūn samʿ
english_saheeh_international: Those whose eyes had been within a cover removed from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear

arabic_uthmani: أَفَحَسِبَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَن يَتَّخِذوا عِبادي مِن دوني أَولِياءَ ۚ إِنّا أَعتَدنا جَهَنَّمَ لِلكافِرينَ نُزُلًا
blank: ʾ-f-ḥasiballadhīn kafarū ʾ yattakhidhū ʿibādī m dūnī ʾawliyāʾ ʾinnā ʾaʿtadnā jahannam l-l-kāfirīn nuzul
english_saheeh_international: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging

arabic_uthmani: قُل هَل نُنَبِّئُكُم بِالأَخسَرينَ أَعمالًا
blank: qul hal nunabbiʾukum b-l-ʾakhsarīn ʾaʿmāl-
english_saheeh_international: Say, O Muhammad, "Shall we believers inform you of the greatest losers as to their deeds

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ ضَلَّ سَعيُهُم فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَهُم يَحسَبونَ أَنَّهُم يُحسِنونَ صُنعًا
blank: alladhīn ḍall saʿyuhum fīl-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-hum yaḥsabūn ʾannahum yuḥsinūn ṣunʿ
english_saheeh_international: They are those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم وَلِقائِهِ فَحَبِطَت أَعمالُهُم فَلا نُقيمُ لَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ وَزنًا
blank: ʾulāʾikalladhīn kafarū b-ʾāyāt rabbihim w-liqāʾihī f-ḥabiṭat ʾaʿmāluhum f-lā nuqīm lahum yawmal-qiyāmat wazn
english_saheeh_international: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in their meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance

arabic_uthmani: ذٰلِكَ جَزاؤُهُم جَهَنَّمُ بِما كَفَروا وَاتَّخَذوا آياتي وَرُسُلي هُزُوًا
blank: dhālik jazāʾuhum jahannam b-mā kafarū w-ttakhadhū ʾāyātī w-rusulī huzuw
english_saheeh_international: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and because they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ كانَت لَهُم جَنّاتُ الفِردَوسِ نُزُلًا
blank: ʾinnalladhīn ʾāmanū w-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāt kānat lahum jannātul-firdaws nuzul
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging

arabic_uthmani: خالِدينَ فيها لا يَبغونَ عَنها حِوَلًا
blank: khālidīn fīhā lā yabghūn ʿanhā ḥiwal
english_saheeh_international: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer

arabic_uthmani: قُل لَو كانَ البَحرُ مِدادًا لِكَلِماتِ رَبّي لَنَفِدَ البَحرُ قَبلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِماتُ رَبّي وَلَو جِئنا بِمِثلِهِ مَدَدًا
blank: qul law kānal-baḥr midād l-kalimāt rabbī l-nafidal-baḥr qabl ʾ tanfad kalimāt rabbī w-law jiʾnā b-mithlihī madad
english_saheeh_international: Say, "If the sea were ink for writing the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement

arabic_uthmani: قُل إِنَّما أَنا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّما إِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۖ فَمَن كانَ يَرجو لِقاءَ رَبِّهِ فَليَعمَل عَمَلًا صالِحًا وَلا يُشرِك بِعِبادَةِ رَبِّهِ أَحَدًا
blank: qul ʾinnamā ʾan bashar mithlukum yūḥā ʾilayy ʾannamā ʾilāhukum ʾilāh wāḥid f-m kān yarjū liqāʾ rabbihī f-l-yaʿmal ʿamal ṣāliḥ w-lā yushrik b-ʿibādat rabbihī ʾaḥad
english_saheeh_international: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone

arabic_uthmani: كهيعص
blank: k-h-y-ʿ-ṣ (kāf hā yā ʿayn ṣād)
english_saheeh_international: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad

arabic_uthmani: ذِكرُ رَحمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبدَهُ زَكَرِيّا
blank: dhikr raḥmat rabbik ʿabdahū zakariyyā
english_saheeh_international: This is a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

arabic_uthmani: إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ نِداءً خَفِيًّا
blank: ʾidh nādā rabbahū nidāʾ khafiyy
english_saheeh_international: When he called to his Lord a private supplication

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي وَهَنَ العَظمُ مِنّي وَاشتَعَلَ الرَّأسُ شَيبًا وَلَم أَكُن بِدُعائِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّا
blank: qāl rabb ʾinnī wahanal-ʿaẓm minnī w-shtaʿal r-raʾs shayb w-lam ʾak b-duʿāʾik rabb shaqiyy
english_saheeh_international: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy

arabic_uthmani: وَإِنّي خِفتُ المَوالِيَ مِن وَرائي وَكانَتِ امرَأَتي عاقِرًا فَهَب لي مِن لَدُنكَ وَلِيًّا
blank: w-ʾinnī khiftul-mawāliy m warāʾī w-kānat mraʾatī ʿāqir f-hab lī m ladunk waliyy
english_saheeh_international: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

arabic_uthmani: يَرِثُني وَيَرِثُ مِن آلِ يَعقوبَ ۖ وَاجعَلهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّا
blank: yarithunī w-yarith m ʾāl yaʿqūb w-jʿalh rabb raḍiyy
english_saheeh_international: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing to You

arabic_uthmani: يا زَكَرِيّا إِنّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلامٍ اسمُهُ يَحيىٰ لَم نَجعَل لَهُ مِن قَبلُ سَمِيًّا
blank: yā-zakariyyā ʾinnā nubashshiruk b-ghulām- smuhū yaḥyā lam najʿal lahū m qabl samiyy
english_saheeh_international: He was told, "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before this name

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَبِّ أَنّىٰ يَكونُ لي غُلامٌ وَكانَتِ امرَأَتي عاقِرًا وَقَد بَلَغتُ مِنَ الكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا
blank: qāl rabb ʾannā yakūn lī ghulām w-kānat mraʾatī ʿāqir w-qad balaght minal-kibar ʿitiyy
english_saheeh_international: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age

arabic_uthmani: قالَ كَذٰلِكَ قالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ وَقَد خَلَقتُكَ مِن قَبلُ وَلَم تَكُ شَيئًا
blank: qāl k-dhālik qāl rabbuk huw ʿalayy hayyin w-qad khalaqtuk m qabl w-lam tak shayʾ
english_saheeh_international: An angel said, "Thus it will be; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَبِّ اجعَل لي آيَةً ۚ قالَ آيَتُكَ أَلّا تُكَلِّمَ النّاسَ ثَلاثَ لَيالٍ سَوِيًّا
blank: qāl rabb jʿal lī ʾāyat qāl ʾāyatuk ʾallā tukallim n-nās thalāth layāl sawiyy
english_saheeh_international: Zechariah said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, being sound

arabic_uthmani: فَخَرَجَ عَلىٰ قَومِهِ مِنَ المِحرابِ فَأَوحىٰ إِلَيهِم أَن سَبِّحوا بُكرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
blank: f-kharaj ʿalā qawmihī minal-miḥrāb f-ʾawḥā ʾilayhim ʾ sabbiḥū bukrat w-ʿashiyy
english_saheeh_international: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt Allah in the morning and afternoon

arabic_uthmani: يا يَحيىٰ خُذِ الكِتابَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَآتَيناهُ الحُكمَ صَبِيًّا
blank: yā-yaḥyā khudhil-kitāb b-quwwat w-ʾātaynāhul-ḥukm ṣabiyy
english_saheeh_international: Allah said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement while yet a boy

arabic_uthmani: وَحَنانًا مِن لَدُنّا وَزَكاةً ۖ وَكانَ تَقِيًّا
blank: w-ḥanānam-m ladunnā w-zakāt w-kān taqiyy
english_saheeh_international: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah

arabic_uthmani: وَبَرًّا بِوالِدَيهِ وَلَم يَكُن جَبّارًا عَصِيًّا
blank: w-barr b-wālidayh w-lam yak jabbār ʿaṣiyy
english_saheeh_international: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant

arabic_uthmani: وَسَلامٌ عَلَيهِ يَومَ وُلِدَ وَيَومَ يَموتُ وَيَومَ يُبعَثُ حَيًّا
blank: w-salām ʿalayh yawm wulid w-yawm yamūt w-yawm yubʿath ḥayy
english_saheeh_international: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive

arabic_uthmani: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ مَريَمَ إِذِ انتَبَذَت مِن أَهلِها مَكانًا شَرقِيًّا
blank: w-dhkur fīl-kitāb maryam ʾidh ntabadhat m ʾahlihā makān sharqiyy
english_saheeh_international: And mention, O Muhammad, in the Book the story of Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east

arabic_uthmani: فَاتَّخَذَت مِن دونِهِم حِجابًا فَأَرسَلنا إِلَيها روحَنا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَها بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا
blank: f-ttakhadhat m dūnihim ḥijāb f-ʾarsalnā ʾilayhā rūḥanā f-tamaththal lahā bashar sawiyy
english_saheeh_international: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man

arabic_uthmani: قالَت إِنّي أَعوذُ بِالرَّحمٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّا
blank: qālat ʾinnī ʾaʿūdh b-r-raḥmān mink ʾ kunt taqiyy
english_saheeh_international: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, so leave me, if you should be fearing of Allah

arabic_uthmani: قالَ إِنَّما أَنا رَسولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلامًا زَكِيًّا
blank: qāl ʾinnamā ʾan rasūl rabbik l-ʾahab lak ghulām zakiyy
english_saheeh_international: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you news of a pure boy

arabic_uthmani: قالَت أَنّىٰ يَكونُ لي غُلامٌ وَلَم يَمسَسني بَشَرٌ وَلَم أَكُ بَغِيًّا
blank: qālat ʾannā yakūn lī ghulām w-lam yamsasnī bashar w-lam ʾak baghiyy
english_saheeh_international: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste

arabic_uthmani: قالَ كَذٰلِكِ قالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ ۖ وَلِنَجعَلَهُ آيَةً لِلنّاسِ وَرَحمَةً مِنّا ۚ وَكانَ أَمرًا مَقضِيًّا
blank: qāl k-dhālik qāl rabbuk huw ʿalayy hayyin w-l-najʿalahū ʾāyat l-n-nās w-raḥmatam-minnā w-kān ʾamram-maqḍiyy
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Thus it will be; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter already decreed

arabic_uthmani: ۞ فَحَمَلَتهُ فَانتَبَذَت بِهِ مَكانًا قَصِيًّا
blank: f-ḥamalath f-ntabadhat bihī makān qaṣiyy
english_saheeh_international: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place

arabic_uthmani: فَأَجاءَهَا المَخاضُ إِلىٰ جِذعِ النَّخلَةِ قالَت يا لَيتَني مِتُّ قَبلَ هٰذا وَكُنتُ نَسيًا مَنسِيًّا
blank: f-ʾajāʾahāl-makhāḍ ʾilā jidhʿ n-nakhlat qālat yā-laytanī mitt qabl hādhā w-kunt nasyam-mansiyy
english_saheeh_international: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten

arabic_uthmani: فَناداها مِن تَحتِها أَلّا تَحزَني قَد جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحتَكِ سَرِيًّا
blank: f-nādāhā m taḥtihā ʾallā taḥzanī qad jaʿal rabbuk taḥtak sariyy
english_saheeh_international: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream

arabic_uthmani: وَهُزّي إِلَيكِ بِجِذعِ النَّخلَةِ تُساقِط عَلَيكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
blank: w-huzzī ʾilayk b-jidhʿ n-nakhlat tusāqiṭ ʿalayk ruṭab janiyy
english_saheeh_international: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates

arabic_uthmani: فَكُلي وَاشرَبي وَقَرّي عَينًا ۖ فَإِمّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ البَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقولي إِنّي نَذَرتُ لِلرَّحمٰنِ صَومًا فَلَن أُكَلِّمَ اليَومَ إِنسِيًّا
blank: f-kulī w-shrabī w-qarrī ʿayn f-ʾimmā tarayinn minal-bashar ʾaḥad f-qūlī ʾinnī nadhart l-r-raḥmān ṣawm f-l ʾukallimal-yawm ʾinsiyy
english_saheeh_international: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to any man

arabic_uthmani: فَأَتَت بِهِ قَومَها تَحمِلُهُ ۖ قالوا يا مَريَمُ لَقَد جِئتِ شَيئًا فَرِيًّا
blank: f-ʾatat bihī qawmahā taḥmiluhū qālū yā-maryam l-qad jiʾt shayʾ fariyy
english_saheeh_international: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented

arabic_uthmani: يا أُختَ هارونَ ما كانَ أَبوكِ امرَأَ سَوءٍ وَما كانَت أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّا
blank: yā-ʾukht hārūn mā kān ʾabūk mraʾ sawʾ w-mā kānat ʾummuk baghiyy
english_saheeh_international: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste

arabic_uthmani: فَأَشارَت إِلَيهِ ۖ قالوا كَيفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كانَ فِي المَهدِ صَبِيًّا
blank: f-ʾashārat ʾilayh qālū kayf nukallim m kān fīl-mahd ṣabiyy
english_saheeh_international: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child

arabic_uthmani: قالَ إِنّي عَبدُ اللَّهِ آتانِيَ الكِتابَ وَجَعَلَني نَبِيًّا
blank: qāl ʾinnī ʿabd llāh ʾātāniyal-kitāb w-jaʿalanī nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: Jesus said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet

arabic_uthmani: وَجَعَلَني مُبارَكًا أَينَ ما كُنتُ وَأَوصاني بِالصَّلاةِ وَالزَّكاةِ ما دُمتُ حَيًّا
blank: w-jaʿalanī mubārak ʾayn mā kunt w-ʾawṣānī b-ṣ-ṣalāt w-z-zakātimā dumt ḥayy
english_saheeh_international: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive

arabic_uthmani: وَبَرًّا بِوالِدَتي وَلَم يَجعَلني جَبّارًا شَقِيًّا
blank: w-barr b-wālidatī w-lam yajʿalnī jabbār shaqiyy
english_saheeh_international: And made me dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant

arabic_uthmani: وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيَّ يَومَ وُلِدتُ وَيَومَ أَموتُ وَيَومَ أُبعَثُ حَيًّا
blank: w-s-salām ʿalayy yawm wulidt w-yawm ʾamūt w-yawm ʾubʿath ḥayy
english_saheeh_international: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive

arabic_uthmani: ذٰلِكَ عيسَى ابنُ مَريَمَ ۚ قَولَ الحَقِّ الَّذي فيهِ يَمتَرونَ
blank: dhālik ʿīsā bn maryam qawlal-ḥaqqilladhī fīh yamtarūn
english_saheeh_international: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute

arabic_uthmani: ما كانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍ ۖ سُبحانَهُ ۚ إِذا قَضىٰ أَمرًا فَإِنَّما يَقولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
blank: mā kān l-llāh ʾ yattakhidh m walad subḥānahū ʾidhā qaḍā ʾamr f-ʾinnamā yaqūl lahū k f-yakūn
english_saheeh_international: It is not befitting for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is

arabic_uthmani: وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ رَبّي وَرَبُّكُم فَاعبُدوهُ ۚ هٰذا صِراطٌ مُستَقيمٌ
blank: w-ʾinn llāh rabbī w-rabbukum f-ʿbudūh hādhā ṣirāṭ mustaqīm
english_saheeh_international: Jesus said, "And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path

arabic_uthmani: فَاختَلَفَ الأَحزابُ مِن بَينِهِم ۖ فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن مَشهَدِ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
blank: f-khtalafal-ʾaḥzāb m baynihim f-wayl l-lladhīn kafarū m mashhad yawm ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: Then the factions differed concerning Jesus from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day

arabic_uthmani: أَسمِع بِهِم وَأَبصِر يَومَ يَأتونَنا ۖ لٰكِنِ الظّالِمونَ اليَومَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
blank: ʾasmiʿ bihim w-ʾabṣir yawm yaʾtūnanā lākin ẓ-ẓālimūnal-yawm fī ḍalāl mubīn
english_saheeh_international: How clearly they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error

arabic_uthmani: وَأَنذِرهُم يَومَ الحَسرَةِ إِذ قُضِيَ الأَمرُ وَهُم في غَفلَةٍ وَهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
blank: w-ʾandhirhum yawmal-ḥasrat ʾidh quḍiyal-ʾamr w-hum fī ghaflat w-hum lā yuʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: And warn them, O Muhammad, of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and yet, they are in a state of heedlessness, and they do not believe

arabic_uthmani: إِنّا نَحنُ نَرِثُ الأَرضَ وَمَن عَلَيها وَإِلَينا يُرجَعونَ
blank: ʾinnā naḥn narithul-ʾarḍ w-m ʿalayhā w-ʾilaynā yurjaʿūn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned

arabic_uthmani: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ إِبراهيمَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ صِدّيقًا نَبِيًّا
blank: w-dhkur fīl-kitāb ʾibrāhīm ʾinnahū kān ṣiddīq nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: And mention in the Book the story of Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet

arabic_uthmani: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ يا أَبَتِ لِمَ تَعبُدُ ما لا يَسمَعُ وَلا يُبصِرُ وَلا يُغني عَنكَ شَيئًا
blank: ʾidh qāl l-ʾabīh yā-ʾabat l-m taʿbud mā lā yasmaʿ w-lā yubṣir w-lā yughnī ʿank shayʾ
english_saheeh_international: Mention when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all

arabic_uthmani: يا أَبَتِ إِنّي قَد جاءَني مِنَ العِلمِ ما لَم يَأتِكَ فَاتَّبِعني أَهدِكَ صِراطًا سَوِيًّا
blank: yā-ʾabat ʾinnī qad jāʾanī minal-ʿilm mā lam yaʾtik f-ttabiʿnī ʾahdik ṣirāṭ sawiyy
english_saheeh_international: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path

arabic_uthmani: يا أَبَتِ لا تَعبُدِ الشَّيطانَ ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ كانَ لِلرَّحمٰنِ عَصِيًّا
blank: yā-ʾabat lā taʿbud sh-shayṭān ʾinn sh-shayṭān kān l-r-raḥmān ʿaṣiyy
english_saheeh_international: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient

arabic_uthmani: يا أَبَتِ إِنّي أَخافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذابٌ مِنَ الرَّحمٰنِ فَتَكونَ لِلشَّيطانِ وَلِيًّا
blank: yā-ʾabat ʾinnī ʾakhāf ʾ yamassak ʿadhāb min r-raḥmān f-takūn l-sh-shayṭān waliyy
english_saheeh_international: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion in Hellfire

arabic_uthmani: قالَ أَراغِبٌ أَنتَ عَن آلِهَتي يا إِبراهيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ لَأَرجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَاهجُرني مَلِيًّا
blank: qāl ʾ-rāghib ʾant ʿ ʾālihatī yā-ʾibrāhīm laʾil-lam tantah l-ʾarjumannak w-hjurnī maliyy
english_saheeh_international: His father said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time

arabic_uthmani: قالَ سَلامٌ عَلَيكَ ۖ سَأَستَغفِرُ لَكَ رَبّي ۖ إِنَّهُ كانَ بي حَفِيًّا
blank: qāl salām ʿalayk s-ʾastaghfir lak rabbī ʾinnahū kān bī ḥafiyy
english_saheeh_international: Abraham said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me

arabic_uthmani: وَأَعتَزِلُكُم وَما تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَأَدعو رَبّي عَسىٰ أَلّا أَكونَ بِدُعاءِ رَبّي شَقِيًّا
blank: w-ʾaʿtazilukum w-mā tadʿūn m dūn llāh w-ʾadʿū rabbī ʿasā ʾallā ʾakūn b-duʿāʾ rabbī shaqiyy
english_saheeh_international: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمَّا اعتَزَلَهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَهَبنا لَهُ إِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلنا نَبِيًّا
blank: f-lammā ʿtazalahum w-mā yaʿbudūn m dūn llāh wahabnā lahū ʾisḥāq w-yaʿqūb w-kull jaʿalnā nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each of them We made a prophet

arabic_uthmani: وَوَهَبنا لَهُم مِن رَحمَتِنا وَجَعَلنا لَهُم لِسانَ صِدقٍ عَلِيًّا
blank: w-wahabnā lahum m raḥmatinā w-jaʿalnā lahum lisān ṣidq ʿaliyy
english_saheeh_international: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor

arabic_uthmani: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ موسىٰ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ مُخلَصًا وَكانَ رَسولًا نَبِيًّا
blank: w-dhkur fīl-kitāb mūsā ʾinnahū kān mukhlaṣ w-kān rasūl nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet

arabic_uthmani: وَنادَيناهُ مِن جانِبِ الطّورِ الأَيمَنِ وَقَرَّبناهُ نَجِيًّا
blank: w-nādaynāh m jānib ṭ-ṭūril-ʾayman w-qarrabnāh najiyy
english_saheeh_international: And We called him from the side of the mount at his right and brought him near, confiding to him

arabic_uthmani: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ مِن رَحمَتِنا أَخاهُ هارونَ نَبِيًّا
blank: w-wahabnā lahū m raḥmatinā ʾakhāh hārūn nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet

arabic_uthmani: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ إِسماعيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ صادِقَ الوَعدِ وَكانَ رَسولًا نَبِيًّا
blank: w-dhkur fīl-kitāb ʾismāʿīl ʾinnahū kān ṣādiqal-waʿd w-kān rasūl nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet

arabic_uthmani: وَكانَ يَأمُرُ أَهلَهُ بِالصَّلاةِ وَالزَّكاةِ وَكانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِ مَرضِيًّا
blank: w-kān yaʾmur ʾahlahū b-ṣ-ṣalāt w-z-zakāt w-kān ʿind rabbihī marḍiyy
english_saheeh_international: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing

arabic_uthmani: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ إِدريسَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ صِدّيقًا نَبِيًّا
blank: w-dhkur fīl-kitāb ʾidrīs ʾinnahū kān ṣiddīq nabiyy
english_saheeh_international: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet

arabic_uthmani: وَرَفَعناهُ مَكانًا عَلِيًّا
blank: w-rafaʿnāh makān ʿaliyy
english_saheeh_international: And We raised him to a high station

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ أَنعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم مِنَ النَّبِيّينَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ آدَمَ وَمِمَّن حَمَلنا مَعَ نوحٍ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسرائيلَ وَمِمَّن هَدَينا وَاجتَبَينا ۚ إِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُ الرَّحمٰنِ خَرّوا سُجَّدًا وَبُكِيًّا ۩
blank: ʾulāʾikalladhīn ʾanʿam llāh ʿalayhim min n-nabiyyīn m dhurriyyat ʾādam w-mimm ḥamalnā maʿ nūḥ w-m dhurriyyat ʾibrāhīm w-ʾisrāʾīl w-mimm hadaynā w-jtabaynā ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyāt r-raḥmān kharrū sujjad w-bukiyy
english_saheeh_international: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried in the ship with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping

arabic_uthmani: ۞ فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعدِهِم خَلفٌ أَضاعُوا الصَّلاةَ وَاتَّبَعُوا الشَّهَواتِ ۖ فَسَوفَ يَلقَونَ غَيًّا
blank: f-khalaf m baʿdihim khalf ʾaḍāʿū ṣ-ṣalāt w-ttabaʿū sh-shahawāt f-sawf yalqawn ghayy
english_saheeh_international: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil

arabic_uthmani: إِلّا مَن تابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَأُولٰئِكَ يَدخُلونَ الجَنَّةَ وَلا يُظلَمونَ شَيئًا
blank: ʾillā m tāb w-ʾāman w-ʿamil ṣāliḥ f-ʾulāʾik yadkhulūnal-jannat w-lā yuẓlamūn shayʾ
english_saheeh_international: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all

arabic_uthmani: جَنّاتِ عَدنٍ الَّتي وَعَدَ الرَّحمٰنُ عِبادَهُ بِالغَيبِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ وَعدُهُ مَأتِيًّا
blank: jannāt ʿadn- llatī waʿad r-raḥmān ʿibādahū b-l-ghayb ʾinnahū kān waʿduhū maʾtiyy
english_saheeh_international: Therein are gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming

arabic_uthmani: لا يَسمَعونَ فيها لَغوًا إِلّا سَلامًا ۖ وَلَهُم رِزقُهُم فيها بُكرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
blank: lā yasmaʿūn fīhā laghw ʾillā salām w-lahum rizquhum fīhā bukrat w-ʿashiyy
english_saheeh_international: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only greetings of peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon

arabic_uthmani: تِلكَ الجَنَّةُ الَّتي نورِثُ مِن عِبادِنا مَن كانَ تَقِيًّا
blank: tilkal-jannat llatī nūrith m ʿibādinā m kān taqiyy
english_saheeh_international: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah

arabic_uthmani: وَما نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلّا بِأَمرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُ ما بَينَ أَيدينا وَما خَلفَنا وَما بَينَ ذٰلِكَ ۚ وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا
blank: w-mā natanazzal ʾillā b-ʾamr rabbik lahū mā bayn ʾaydīnā w-mā khalfanā w-mā bayn dhālik w-mā kān rabbuk nasiyy
english_saheeh_international: Gabriel said, "And we angels descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful

arabic_uthmani: رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما فَاعبُدهُ وَاصطَبِر لِعِبادَتِهِ ۚ هَل تَعلَمُ لَهُ سَمِيًّا
blank: rabb s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-mā baynahumā f-ʿbudh w-ṣṭabir l-ʿibādatihī hal taʿlam lahū samiyy
english_saheeh_international: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him

arabic_uthmani: وَيَقولُ الإِنسانُ أَإِذا ما مِتُّ لَسَوفَ أُخرَجُ حَيًّا
blank: w-yaqūlul-ʾinsān ʾ-ʾidhā mā mitt l-sawf ʾukhraj ḥayy
english_saheeh_international: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive

arabic_uthmani: أَوَلا يَذكُرُ الإِنسانُ أَنّا خَلَقناهُ مِن قَبلُ وَلَم يَكُ شَيئًا
blank: ʾ-w-lā yadhkurul-ʾinsān ʾannā khalaqnāh m qabl w-lam yak shayʾ
english_saheeh_international: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing

arabic_uthmani: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحشُرَنَّهُم وَالشَّياطينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحضِرَنَّهُم حَولَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا
blank: f-w-rabbik l-naḥshurannahum w-sh-shayāṭīn thumm l-nuḥḍirannahum ḥawl jahannam jithiyy
english_saheeh_international: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شيعَةٍ أَيُّهُم أَشَدُّ عَلَى الرَّحمٰنِ عِتِيًّا
blank: thumm l-nanziʿann m kull shīʿat ʾayyuhum ʾashadd ʿalā r-raḥmān ʿitiyy
english_saheeh_international: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ لَنَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِالَّذينَ هُم أَولىٰ بِها صِلِيًّا
blank: thumm l-naḥn ʾaʿlam b-lladhīn hum ʾawlā bihā ṣiliyy
english_saheeh_international: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein

arabic_uthmani: وَإِن مِنكُم إِلّا وارِدُها ۚ كانَ عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتمًا مَقضِيًّا
blank: w-ʾ minkum ʾillā wāriduhā kān ʿalā rabbik ḥatmam-maqḍiyy
english_saheeh_international: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّي الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا وَنَذَرُ الظّالِمينَ فيها جِثِيًّا
blank: thumm nunajjīlladhīn ttaqaw w-nadhar ẓ-ẓālimīn fīhā jithiyy
english_saheeh_international: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ قالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا أَيُّ الفَريقَينِ خَيرٌ مَقامًا وَأَحسَنُ نَدِيًّا
blank: w-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyināt qālalladhīn kafarū l-lladhīn ʾāmanū ʾayyul-farīqayn khayr maqām w-ʾaḥsan nadiyy
english_saheeh_international: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of our two parties is best in position and best in association

arabic_uthmani: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هُم أَحسَنُ أَثاثًا وَرِئيًا
blank: w-kam ʾahlaknā qablahum m qarn hum ʾaḥsan ʾathāth w-riʾy
english_saheeh_international: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and outward appearance

arabic_uthmani: قُل مَن كانَ فِي الضَّلالَةِ فَليَمدُد لَهُ الرَّحمٰنُ مَدًّا ۚ حَتّىٰ إِذا رَأَوا ما يوعَدونَ إِمَّا العَذابَ وَإِمَّا السّاعَةَ فَسَيَعلَمونَ مَن هُوَ شَرٌّ مَكانًا وَأَضعَفُ جُندًا
blank: qul m kān fī ḍ-ḍalālat f-l-yamdud lah r-raḥmān madd ḥattā ʾidhā raʾaw mā yūʿadūn ʾimmāl-ʿadhāb w-ʾimmā s-sāʿat f-s-yaʿlamūn m huw sharr makān w-ʾaḍʿaf jund
english_saheeh_international: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension in wealth and time until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment in this world or the Hour of resurrection - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers

arabic_uthmani: وَيَزيدُ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ اهتَدَوا هُدًى ۗ وَالباقِياتُ الصّالِحاتُ خَيرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ مَرَدًّا
blank: w-yazīd llāhulladhīn htadaw hud w-l-bāqiyāt ṣ-ṣāliḥāt khayr ʿind rabbik thawāb w-khayr maradd
english_saheeh_international: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse

arabic_uthmani: أَفَرَأَيتَ الَّذي كَفَرَ بِآياتِنا وَقالَ لَأوتَيَنَّ مالًا وَوَلَدًا
blank: ʾ-f-raʾaytalladhī kafar b-ʾāyātinā w-qāl l-ʾūtayann māl w-walad
english_saheeh_international: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children in the next life

arabic_uthmani: أَطَّلَعَ الغَيبَ أَمِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحمٰنِ عَهدًا
blank: ʾ-ṭṭalaʿal-ghayb ʾam ttakhadh ʿind r-raḥmān ʿahd
english_saheeh_international: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise

arabic_uthmani: كَلّا ۚ سَنَكتُبُ ما يَقولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُ مِنَ العَذابِ مَدًّا
blank: kallā s-naktub mā yaqūl w-namudd lahū minal-ʿadhāb madd
english_saheeh_international: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively

arabic_uthmani: وَنَرِثُهُ ما يَقولُ وَيَأتينا فَردًا
blank: w-narithuhū mā yaqūl w-yaʾtīnā fard
english_saheeh_international: And We will inherit him in what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone

arabic_uthmani: وَاتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لِيَكونوا لَهُم عِزًّا
blank: w-ttakhadhū m dūn llāh ʾālihat l-yakūnū lahum ʿizz
english_saheeh_international: And they have taken besides Allah false deities that they would be for them a source of honor

arabic_uthmani: كَلّا ۚ سَيَكفُرونَ بِعِبادَتِهِم وَيَكونونَ عَلَيهِم ضِدًّا
blank: kallā s-yakfurūn b-ʿibādatihim w-yakūnūn ʿalayhim ḍidd
english_saheeh_international: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents on the Day of Judgement

arabic_uthmani: أَلَم تَرَ أَنّا أَرسَلنَا الشَّياطينَ عَلَى الكافِرينَ تَؤُزُّهُم أَزًّا
blank: ʾ-lam tar ʾannā ʾarsalnā sh-shayāṭīn ʿalāl-kāfirīn taʾuzzuhum ʾazz
english_saheeh_international: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to evil with constant incitement

arabic_uthmani: فَلا تَعجَل عَلَيهِم ۖ إِنَّما نَعُدُّ لَهُم عَدًّا
blank: f-lā taʿjal ʿalayhim ʾinnamā naʿudd lahum ʿadd
english_saheeh_international: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a limited number

arabic_uthmani: يَومَ نَحشُرُ المُتَّقينَ إِلَى الرَّحمٰنِ وَفدًا
blank: yawm naḥshurul-muttaqīn ʾilā r-raḥmān wafd
english_saheeh_international: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

arabic_uthmani: وَنَسوقُ المُجرِمينَ إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِردًا
blank: w-nasūqul-mujrimīn ʾilā jahannam wird
english_saheeh_international: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

arabic_uthmani: لا يَملِكونَ الشَّفاعَةَ إِلّا مَنِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحمٰنِ عَهدًا
blank: lā yamlikūn sh-shafāʿat ʾillā man ttakhadh ʿind r-raḥmān ʿahd
english_saheeh_international: None will have power of intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant

arabic_uthmani: وَقالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحمٰنُ وَلَدًا
blank: w-qālū ttakhadh r-raḥmān walad
english_saheeh_international: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken for Himself a son

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد جِئتُم شَيئًا إِدًّا
blank: l-qad jiʾtum shayʾ ʾidd
english_saheeh_international: You have done an atrocious thing

arabic_uthmani: تَكادُ السَّماواتُ يَتَفَطَّرنَ مِنهُ وَتَنشَقُّ الأَرضُ وَتَخِرُّ الجِبالُ هَدًّا
blank: takād s-samāwāt yatafaṭṭarn minh w-tanshaqqul-ʾarḍ w-takhirrul-jibāl hadd
english_saheeh_international: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

arabic_uthmani: أَن دَعَوا لِلرَّحمٰنِ وَلَدًا
blank: ʾ daʿaw l-r-raḥmān walad
english_saheeh_international: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son

arabic_uthmani: وَما يَنبَغي لِلرَّحمٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
blank: w-mā yanbaghī l-r-raḥmān ʾ yattakhidh walad
english_saheeh_international: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son

arabic_uthmani: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ إِلّا آتِي الرَّحمٰنِ عَبدًا
blank: ʾ kull m fī s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ ʾillā ʾātī r-raḥmān ʿabd
english_saheeh_international: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant

arabic_uthmani: لَقَد أَحصاهُم وَعَدَّهُم عَدًّا
blank: l-qad ʾaḥṣāhum w-ʿaddahum ʿadd
english_saheeh_international: He has enumerated them and counted them a full counting

arabic_uthmani: وَكُلُّهُم آتيهِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ فَردًا
blank: w-kulluhum ʾātīh yawmal-qiyāmat fard
english_saheeh_international: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ سَيَجعَلُ لَهُمُ الرَّحمٰنُ وُدًّا
blank: ʾinnalladhīn ʾāmanū w-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāt s-yajʿal lahum r-raḥmān wudd
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection

arabic_uthmani: فَإِنَّما يَسَّرناهُ بِلِسانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ المُتَّقينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِ قَومًا لُدًّا
blank: f-ʾinnamā yassarnāh b-lisānik l-tubashshir bihil-muttaqīn w-tundhir bihī qawm ludd
english_saheeh_international: So, O Muhammad, We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people

arabic_uthmani: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هَل تُحِسُّ مِنهُم مِن أَحَدٍ أَو تَسمَعُ لَهُم رِكزًا
blank: w-kam ʾahlaknā qablahum m qarn hal tuḥiss minhum m ʾaḥad ʾaw tasmaʿ lahum rikz
english_saheeh_international: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound

arabic_uthmani: طه
blank: ṭ-h (ṭā hā)
english_saheeh_international: Ta, Ha

arabic_uthmani: ما أَنزَلنا عَلَيكَ القُرآنَ لِتَشقىٰ
blank: mā ʾanzalnā ʿalaykal-qurʾān l-tashqā
english_saheeh_international: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed

arabic_uthmani: إِلّا تَذكِرَةً لِمَن يَخشىٰ
blank: ʾillā tadhkirat l-m yakhshā
english_saheeh_international: But only as a reminder for those who fear Allah

arabic_uthmani: تَنزيلًا مِمَّن خَلَقَ الأَرضَ وَالسَّماواتِ العُلَى
blank: tanzīlam-mimm khalaqal-ʾarḍ w-s-samāwātil-ʿulā
english_saheeh_international: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens

arabic_uthmani: الرَّحمٰنُ عَلَى العَرشِ استَوىٰ
blank: ar-raḥmān ʿalāl-ʿarsh stawā
english_saheeh_international: The Most Merciful who is above the Throne established

arabic_uthmani: لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما وَما تَحتَ الثَّرىٰ
blank: lahū mā fī s-samāwāt w-mā fīl-ʾarḍ w-mā baynahumā w-mā taḥt th-tharā
english_saheeh_international: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil

arabic_uthmani: وَإِن تَجهَر بِالقَولِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخفَى
blank: w-ʾ tajhar b-l-qawl f-ʾinnahū yaʿlam s-sirr w-ʾakhfā
english_saheeh_international: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is even more hidden

arabic_uthmani: اللَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الأَسماءُ الحُسنىٰ
blank: allāh lā ʾilāh ʾillā huw lahul-ʾasmāʾul-ḥusnā
english_saheeh_international: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names

arabic_uthmani: وَهَل أَتاكَ حَديثُ موسىٰ
blank: w-hal ʾatāk ḥadīth mūsā
english_saheeh_international: And has the story of Moses reached you

arabic_uthmani: إِذ رَأىٰ نارًا فَقالَ لِأَهلِهِ امكُثوا إِنّي آنَستُ نارًا لَعَلّي آتيكُم مِنها بِقَبَسٍ أَو أَجِدُ عَلَى النّارِ هُدًى
blank: ʾidh raʾā nār f-qāl l-ʾahlih mkuthū ʾinnī ʾānast nār laʿallī ʾātīkum minhā b-qabas ʾaw ʾajid ʿalā n-nār hud
english_saheeh_international: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance

arabic_uthmani: فَلَمّا أَتاها نودِيَ يا موسىٰ
blank: f-lammā ʾatāhā nūdiy yā-mūsā

blank: w-ʾan khtartuk f-stamiʿ l-mā yūḥā
english_saheeh_international: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed to you

english_saheeh_international: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives

arabic_uthmani: فَلا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنها مَن لا يُؤمِنُ بِها وَاتَّبَعَ هَواهُ فَتَردىٰ
blank: f-lā yaṣuddannak ʿanhā m lā yuʾmin bihā w-ttabaʿ hawāh f-tardā
english_saheeh_international: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you then would perish

blank: w-mā tilk b-yamīnik yā-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses

blank: qāl hiy ʿaṣāy ʾatawakkaʾ ʿalayhā w-ʾahushsh bihā ʿalā ghanamī w-liy fīhā maʾārib ʾukhrā
english_saheeh_international: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses

arabic_uthmani: قالَ أَلقِها يا موسىٰ
blank: qāl ʾalqihā yā-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: Allah said, "Throw it down, O Moses

arabic_uthmani: فَأَلقاها فَإِذا هِيَ حَيَّةٌ تَسعىٰ
blank: f-ʾalqāhā f-ʾidhā hiy ḥayyat tasʿā
english_saheeh_international: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly

arabic_uthmani: قالَ خُذها وَلا تَخَف ۖ سَنُعيدُها سيرَتَهَا الأولىٰ
blank: qāl khudhhā w-lā takhaf s-nuʿīduhā sīratahāl-ʾūlā
english_saheeh_international: Allah said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition

arabic_uthmani: وَاضمُم يَدَكَ إِلىٰ جَناحِكَ تَخرُج بَيضاءَ مِن غَيرِ سوءٍ آيَةً أُخرىٰ
blank: w-ḍmum yadak ʾilā janāḥik takhruj bayḍāʾ m ghayr sūʾ ʾāyat ʾukhrā
english_saheeh_international: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign

arabic_uthmani: لِنُرِيَكَ مِن آياتِنَا الكُبرَى
blank: l-nuriyak m ʾāyātināl-kubrā
english_saheeh_international: That We may show you some of Our greater signs

arabic_uthmani: اذهَب إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ إِنَّهُ طَغىٰ
blank: idhhab ʾilā firʿawn ʾinnahū ṭaghā
english_saheeh_international: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed

blank: qāl rabb shraḥ lī ṣadrī
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast with assurance

arabic_uthmani: وَيَسِّر لي أَمري
blank: w-yassir lī ʾamrī
english_saheeh_international: And ease for me my task

blank: w-ḥlul ʿuqdatam-m lisānī
english_saheeh_international: And untie the knot from my tongue

arabic_uthmani: يَفقَهوا قَولي
blank: yafqahū qawlī
english_saheeh_international: That they may understand my speech

arabic_uthmani: وَاجعَل لي وَزيرًا مِن أَهلي
blank: w-jʿal lī wazīram-m ʾahlī
english_saheeh_international: And appoint for me a minister from my family

arabic_uthmani: هارونَ أَخِي
blank: harūn ʾakhī
english_saheeh_international: Aaron, my brother

arabic_uthmani: اشدُد بِهِ أَزري
blank: ushdud bihī ʾazrī
english_saheeh_international: Increase through him my strength

arabic_uthmani: وَأَشرِكهُ في أَمري
blank: w-ʾashrikh fī ʾamrī
english_saheeh_international: And let him share my task

arabic_uthmani: كَي نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثيرًا
blank: kay nusabbiḥak kathīr
english_saheeh_international: That we may exalt You much

arabic_uthmani: وَنَذكُرَكَ كَثيرًا
blank: w-nadhkurak kathīr
english_saheeh_international: And remember You much

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّكَ كُنتَ بِنا بَصيرًا
blank: ʾinnak kunt binā baṣīr
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing

arabic_uthmani: قالَ قَد أوتيتَ سُؤلَكَ يا موسىٰ
blank: qāl qad ʾūtīt suʾlak yā-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: Allah said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد مَنَنّا عَلَيكَ مَرَّةً أُخرىٰ
blank: w-l-qad manannā ʿalayk marrat ʾukhrā
english_saheeh_international: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time

arabic_uthmani: إِذ أَوحَينا إِلىٰ أُمِّكَ ما يوحىٰ
blank: ʾidh ʾawḥaynā ʾilā ʾummik mā yūḥā
english_saheeh_international: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired

blank: ʾan qdhifīh fī t-tābūt f-qdhifīh fīl-yamm f-l-yulqihil-yamm b-s-sāḥil yaʾkhudhh ʿaduww lī w-ʿaduww lahū w-ʾalqayt ʿalayk maḥabbatam-minnī w-l-tuṣnaʿ ʿalā ʿaynī
english_saheeh_international: Saying, 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye

blank: ʾidh tamshī ʾukhtuk f-taqūl hal ʾadullukum ʿalā m yakfuluhū f-rajaʿnāk ʾilā ʾummik kay taqarr ʿaynuhā w-lā taḥzan w-qatalt nafs f-najjaynāk minal-ghamm w-fatannāk futūn f-labitht sinīn fī ʾahl madyan thumm jiʾt ʿalā qadar yā-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: And We favored you when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a severe trial. And you remained some years among the people of Madyan. Then you came here at the decreed time, O Moses

arabic_uthmani: وَاصطَنَعتُكَ لِنَفسِي
blank: w-ṣṭanaʿtuk l-nafsī
english_saheeh_international: And I produced you for Myself

arabic_uthmani: اذهَب أَنتَ وَأَخوكَ بِآياتي وَلا تَنِيا في ذِكرِي
blank: idhhab ʾant w-ʾakhūk b-ʾāyātī w-lā taniyā fī dhikrī
english_saheeh_international: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance

arabic_uthmani: اذهَبا إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ إِنَّهُ طَغىٰ
blank: idhhabā ʾilā firʿawn ʾinnahū ṭaghā
english_saheeh_international: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed

arabic_uthmani: فَقولا لَهُ قَولًا لَيِّنًا لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَو يَخشىٰ
blank: f-qūlā lahū qawl layyin laʿallahū yatadhakkar ʾaw yakhshā
english_saheeh_international: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear Allah

arabic_uthmani: قالا رَبَّنا إِنَّنا نَخافُ أَن يَفرُطَ عَلَينا أَو أَن يَطغىٰ
blank: qālā rabbanā ʾinnanā nakhāf ʾ yafruṭ ʿalaynā ʾaw ʾ yaṭghā
english_saheeh_international: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten punishment against us or that he will transgress

arabic_uthmani: قالَ لا تَخافا ۖ إِنَّني مَعَكُما أَسمَعُ وَأَرىٰ
blank: qāl lā takhāfā ʾinnanī maʿakumā ʾasmaʿ w-ʾarā
english_saheeh_international: Allah said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see

blank: f-ʾtiyāh f-qūlā ʾinnā rasūlā rabbik f-ʾarsil maʿanā banī ʾisrāʾīl w-lā tuʿadhdhibhum qad jiʾnāk b-ʾāyat m rabbik w-s-salām ʿalā man ttabaʿal-hudā
english_saheeh_international: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance

arabic_uthmani: إِنّا قَد أوحِيَ إِلَينا أَنَّ العَذابَ عَلىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلّىٰ

english_saheeh_international: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away

arabic_uthmani: قالَ فَمَن رَبُّكُما يا موسىٰ
blank: qāl f-m rabbukumā yā-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: Pharaoh said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses

arabic_uthmani: قالَ رَبُّنَا الَّذي أَعطىٰ كُلَّ شَيءٍ خَلقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدىٰ
blank: qāl rabbunālladhī ʾaʿṭā kull shayʾ khalqahū thumm hadā
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided it

blank: qāl f-mā bālul-qurūnil-ʾūlā
english_saheeh_international: Pharaoh said, "Then what is the case of the former generations

arabic_uthmani: قالَ عِلمُها عِندَ رَبّي في كِتابٍ ۖ لا يَضِلُّ رَبّي وَلا يَنسَى
blank: qāl ʿilmuhā ʿind rabbī fī kitāb lā yaḍill rabbī w-lā yansā
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets

arabic_uthmani: الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ مَهدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُم فيها سُبُلًا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَخرَجنا بِهِ أَزواجًا مِن نَباتٍ شَتّىٰ
blank: alladhī jaʿal lakumul-ʾarḍ mahd w-salak lakum fīhā subul w-ʾanzal min s-samāʾ māʾ f-ʾakhrajnā bihī ʾazwājam-m nabāt shattā
english_saheeh_international: It is He who has made for you the earth as a bed spread out and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants

blank: kulū w-rʿaw ʾanʿāmakum ʾinn fī dhālik l-ʾāyāt l-ʾulī n-nuhā
english_saheeh_international: Eat therefrom and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence

arabic_uthmani: ۞ مِنها خَلَقناكُم وَفيها نُعيدُكُم وَمِنها نُخرِجُكُم تارَةً أُخرىٰ
blank: minhā khalaqnākum w-fīhā nuʿīdukum w-minhā nukhrijukum tārat ʾukhrā
english_saheeh_international: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time

blank: w-l-qad ʾāraynāh ʾāyātinā kullahā f-kadhdhab w-ʾabā
english_saheeh_international: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused

arabic_uthmani: قالَ أَجِئتَنا لِتُخرِجَنا مِن أَرضِنا بِسِحرِكَ يا موسىٰ
blank: qāl ʾ-jiʾtanā l-tukhrijanā m ʾarḍinā b-siḥrik yā-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses

blank: f-l-naʾtiyannak b-siḥr mithlihī f-jʿal baynanā w-baynak mawʿid lā nukhlifuhū naḥn w-lā ʾant makān suw
english_saheeh_international: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned

arabic_uthmani: قالَ مَوعِدُكُم يَومُ الزّينَةِ وَأَن يُحشَرَ النّاسُ ضُحًى
blank: qāl mawʿidukum yawm z-zīnat w-ʾ yuḥshar n-nās ḍuḥ
english_saheeh_international: Moses said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning

blank: f-tawallā firʿawn f-jamaʿ kaydahū thumm ʾatā
english_saheeh_international: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came to Moses

blank: qāl lahum mūsā waylakum lā taftarū ʿalā llāh kadhib f-yusḥitakum b-ʿadhāb w-qad khāb man ftarā
english_saheeh_international: Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents such falsehood

arabic_uthmani: فَتَنازَعوا أَمرَهُم بَينَهُم وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجوىٰ
blank: f-tanāzaʿū ʾamrahum baynahum w-ʾasarrū n-najwā
english_saheeh_international: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation

blank: qālū ʾ hādhān l-sāḥirān yurīdān ʾ yukhrijākum m ʾarḍikum b-siḥrihimā w-yadhhabā b-ṭarīqatikumul-muthlā
english_saheeh_international: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way

arabic_uthmani: فَأَجمِعوا كَيدَكُم ثُمَّ ائتوا صَفًّا ۚ وَقَد أَفلَحَ اليَومَ مَنِ استَعلىٰ
blank: f-ʾajmiʿū kaydakum thumm ʾtū ṣaff w-qad ʾaflaḥal-yawm man staʿlā
english_saheeh_international: So resolve upon your plan and then come forward in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes

arabic_uthmani: قالوا يا موسىٰ إِمّا أَن تُلقِيَ وَإِمّا أَن نَكونَ أَوَّلَ مَن أَلقىٰ
blank: qālū yā-mūsā ʾimmā ʾ tulqiy w-ʾimmā ʾ nakūn ʾawwal m ʾalqā
english_saheeh_international: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw

arabic_uthmani: قالَ بَل أَلقوا ۖ فَإِذا حِبالُهُم وَعِصِيُّهُم يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيهِ مِن سِحرِهِم أَنَّها تَسعىٰ
blank: qāl bal ʾalqū f-ʾidhā ḥibāluhum w-ʿiṣiyyuhum yukhayyal ʾilayh m siḥrihim ʾannahā tasʿā
english_saheeh_international: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving like snakes

arabic_uthmani: فَأَوجَسَ في نَفسِهِ خيفَةً موسىٰ
blank: f-ʾawjas fī nafsihī khīfatam-mūsā
english_saheeh_international: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses

arabic_uthmani: قُلنا لا تَخَف إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الأَعلىٰ
blank: qulnā lā takhaf ʾinnak ʾantal-ʾaʿlā
